story:
5-Time Creator of Crowdfunded Solar Products

GoSun is leading the fuel-free frontier, utilizing the best in clean tech to help you USE MORE SUN.  We love being outdoors, sharing cold drinks and hot meals, but we don't love the mess and logistics that come with ice or fire.  Never waste your time or money on ice again.

As seen in

 

 

Coolers are a pain in the ICE...

This is the best way to make sure your investment in food is safe.  No more worries about crushing and freezing the food that's touching the ice or having to organize the sandwiches so they aren't drenched by the time you get there.  Food always looks good going in, but not so good when it comes time to eat it.

 

Fashion Coolers Beware

Sticky, spoiled, stinky... $400 over-built coolers may fend off grizzly bears, but they still rely on ice that's heavy, takes up space and leaves everything soggy.  We haven't found a cooler yet that drives to the store to buy more ice.  

 

Now you can stay cool with Solar

Whether it’s camping, bbq, fishing, or just relaxing in the Sun, we love the outdoors.  Nothing kills the trip like rotten food, soggy bread, or warm beer. To keep the adventure going, we minimized space needed for ice and fuel and maximized space for fresh food, cold drinks, and fun times. GoSun Chill is like having a fridge on wheels.​

 

The Era for Solar Living has arrived

It's the age of innovation, yet we are still fighting against the Sun to keep things cold.  Now, we have the ability to harness its power more efficiently than ever, taking melting ice out of the equation.  GoSun engineered a cooler that can keep colder temperatures longer and is more sanitary than anything else on the market.  Nothing is cleaner or easier than GoSun Chill. 

It's time to go solar.

 

Multi-Modal Power, means you've got options

GoSun Chill can be powered by multiple power sources, including: Powerbank, AC Adapter, 12 Volt Cord (car port charger), Solar Table, or Flexible Solar Panels. This way, you can access the most convenient power sources when you need it. To charge the Powerbank, plug in the included AC Adapter into any wall socket (100-250VAC) or use one of our two solar charging options - the Solar Table or Flexible Solar Panel.

 

Power to make ice and keep everyone charged

Every GoSun Chill comes with a detachable, lithium polymer Powerbank, providing a day's worth of ice.  Not a little phone charger, the Powerbank outputs 12 volts at up to 15 amps and can supply the average phone over 10 full charges. Only two pounds (one kilo), it features 3 USB ports and a 200 lumen light.

You've never seen a cooler like this!  We included all the essentials, and more: 

  • 144wh Detachable Powerbank to use even when you don't need the Chill
  • Accessory Storage Pouches to keep small items handy
  • Tie-Down Cleats and Straps for carrying a large load
  • Wheels and Handles to traverse nearly any terrain
  • Emergency Drain in case you ever run out of power and need to use ice
  • Bottle Opener to open drinks
  • One-Year No-Questions Warranty

 

How long will your Powerbank run?

Use the PowerBank when you're going afar, but the Chill comes with AC/DC compatibility so you have lots of power options.  Pull out the solar panels to keep your Powerbank charged while it runs the cooler all day long (or all week long) off-grid.

During a typical summer day (i.e. storing camp food and drinks), the Powerbank will keep everything cool for 14 hours on an 80°F (27°C) day.  If you're making ice, the compressor runs full-time, which can drain the Powerbank in 3-5 hours.

It is often easier to power the Chill from the 12 V cigarette port on a Car, Boat or RV.   Keep your food cold on the drive to the beach or camping and then switch to the Powerbank to run the Chill around the campfire.

 

GoSun is also there when you need it

Goods stay fresh and safe much longer in dry, ice-free environments. If you want to plug your Chill into an AC wall socket or 12V car port, your wires and adapters are always aboard the cooler, tucked into the two storage pouches. As an added bonus, the Powerbank detaches from the Chill to give you energy where you need it.

 

Stores anything at the right temperature

Coolers full of melting ice are oblivious to what's inside.  The GoSun Chill gives you complete temperature control from -4°F to 68°F (-20°C to 20°C).  Having a fridge/freezer gives your precious cargo a much longer lifespan by taking melting water out of the equation.

You can store...

 

Hear from GoSun's Founder 

In this video, Patrick Sherwin, shares his impression and how he best utilizes this portable, off-grid refrigerator.  With 200 Watts of solar on top of the RV and a GoSun Fusion, he never runs to generator. 

 

Support our Mission

 

Spread our Story

 

Same size, more space.

The savings are immediate, no more wasting time on melting ice.  Without ice you can use 100% of the cooler's volume.  GoSun Chill has nearly double the room for food and drinks when compared with coolers of equal dimensions. 

 

GoSun Chill weighs 28 LBS (12.7kg), fits 1.4 cubic feet (40 Liters) and stands 24" x 16" x 19" inches (60 x 40 x 48 cm).  For comparison, a "45 Liter" Yeti Tundra cooler holds just 28 beers and weighs 23 LBS before needing about 20 LBS of ice. 

 

How the Chill Compares

Among portable fridges, there is nothing that gets close to the Chill.  At half the price, GoSun's complete solar powered cooler is more accessible, plus it's compatible with the complete off-grid kitchen.

 

Together Under the Sun. No Ice. No Fuel.

These four GoSun products are all you need for a complete outdoor kitchen. 

  1. Cool and store your goods with the Chill
  2. Cook amazing meals using the hybrid solar and electric GoSun Fusion
  3. Charge the Cooler, Fusion or Devices with the Powerbank
  4. Recharge the Powerbank and relax with the Solar Table or Flexible Solar Panel.

 

GoSun Fusion is the latest and greatest in our line of breakthrough vacuum tube solar ovens.  A hybrid, the Fusion runs on direct sunlight during the day or 12 V during the night or bad weather.  The Fusion's electric heating element runs off the PowerBank through the same power cord as the GoSun Chill. 

 

How it works

GoSun designs products to make your outdoor life more accessible and independent. We combined solar power technology with innovative engineering and design to give you incredible long-lasting, versatile products.

Our breakthrough vacuum solar ovens cook food like never before - no mess, no fuss, no fuel. They are already making ripples of change and expanding cooking possibilities as reliable, portable, easy stoves.

The GoSun Chill builds off the same innovations and cools your goods completely ice-free and off-the-grid. 

 

 

Using solar and energy transfer technology, GoSun Chill uses one third the energy of typical portable fridges. The Chill applies an all-electric brushless DC compressor instead of the more commonly used thermo-electric coolers - which are terribly inefficient.

Our efficient brushless DC compressor draws only 40 watts of power - letting it keep your goods cool without using too much energy. Because it’s not thermoelectric, GoSun is also completely quiet, fully controllable and extremely durable.

 

Features that matter

Not just a box that carries ice, the GoSun Chill comes with everything you'll need for long-term chilling.  A deeper look into the features reveals the perfect blend of form and function, a signature of GoSun Design.

A deeper look into the features:​

Tie-Down Straps

Elastic straps with multiple connection points allow you to strap down your gear and go.

Charge Devices

Power when you need it, the detachable Powerbank can fully recharge your phone over 10 times.

Storage Pouches

Accessory pouches hold all your essentials, with lots of room for extras: keys, cards, phone...

Easy Carry Handles

Integrated handles and a dry weight of 28 LBS (13kg), make it easy to carry the Chill or load up.

Bottle Opener

No searching, you can pop open the bottle cap right on-board.

Removable Lid 

Great for when serving or display your goods, the insulated lid comes on and off in a snap.

All Terrain Wheels

Possibly the greatest invention of all time, these rugged wheels are ready for action.

     

    Introducing GoSun's Solar Table 

    The 15lb (7kg) folding Solar Table is designed to recharge your Powerbank in a few hours while providing a table surface and shade for the Chill.  You can always use a table and it is no problem to work on top of the tempered glass surface of the solar panel.  Shade will keep your cooler much cooler.  It's lightweight aluminum frame folds into a portable package that is easy to carry and store.  

     

    Flexible Solar Panel 

    Our flexible solar panel packs into a super thin carry that you can fit on top of the Chill. When you need solar energy, simply unfold and let the Sun cool your drinks down.

    You can also use the panel as a portable power station to charge up your Powerbank and other devices.  Solar is amazing.   

     

    Choose your Reward Package

    Every package includes a 40 Liter capacity insulated cooler with brushless DC compressor, 144Wh lithium-ion Powerbank, DC power cord, AC adapter cord, temperature control, telescoping handle, wheels,  tie-down straps and One-Year No-Questions-Asked Warranty. 

    Tech Specs

    GoSun is committed to making the highest quality and most accessible solar powered products.  We build products to be relied on, day in, day out so you can get the most out of them.  Take a deep look at the Specs or FAQ's and then send us a message if you don't find your answer.

     

    GoSun Chill

    • Dimensions: see above
    • Weight: 28 LBS (12.7kg)
    • Capacity: 40 Liters (1.4 cubic feet or 55 12oz cans)
    • Insulation: R-10, Closed cell polyurethane foam
    • Compressor: DC Brushless (runs on 12 or 24 Volt), draws 35-45 Watts
    • Refrigerant: environmentally safe R134A
    • Temperature Control:  -4°F to 68°F (-20°C to 20°C), backlit LCD display, audible alerts
    • Power Control: two modes (eco and high heat), three pre-set power supply (lead acid, AC adaptor and lithium ion) with low voltage disconnect (LVD) and compressor delay protection
    • PowerBank Runtime: see graphic above, wide range based on several factors
    • Effective Environmental Protection: Compressor/Electronics enclosure IP 32, Cold Goods area IP 65 
    • Warranty: One-Year No-Questions-Asked Warranty from GoSun
    • Package Includes: 144wh PowerBank, AC Adapter, 12 Volt Power Cord and Features  listed above

     

    Solar Table

    • Dimensions: see above
    • Dimensoins Folded: 28in (71cm) x 24in (61cm) x 4.25in (11cm)
    • Weight: 18.5 LBS (8.4kg)
    • Load Capacity: recommended max at 75 LBS (34 kg)
    • Power Output: 60 Watts at 18 V DC nominal, integrated 5' (1.5m) DC Cord, 5.5 x 2.1mm coaxial connector
    • Materials: Aluminum frame with stainless steel hardware, corrosion resistant
    • Handles: mounted for easy carrying,metal reinforced composite 
    • Solar Module: mono-crystaline cells, covered in tempered glass for durability
    • Effective Environmental Protection:   IP 45 
    • Warranty: One-Year No-Questions-Asked Warranty from GoSun

     

    Flex Solar

    • Dimensions: see above open and folded 
    • Weight: 3 LBS (1.4kg)
    • Power Output: 30 Watts at 18 V DC nominal, integrated 5' (1.5m) DC Cord, 5.5 x 2.1mm coaxial connector
    • Materials: Solar cells encapsulated in flexible polymer to be water resistant
    • Solar Module: mono-crystaline cells, covered in flexible polymer for durability
    • Effective Environmental Protection:   IP 65 
    • Warranty: One-Year No-Questions-Asked Warranty from GoSun

     

    Power Bank

    • Dimensions: see above  
    • Weight: 2.2 LBS (1 kg)
    • Battery Type and Capacity: Lithium Ion, 144 wh, 38,500 mAH @ 3.7 V, 12 AH @ 12 V, 
    • Power Input: 16-28V DC range, solar ready with MPPT, 60 Watt max 
    • Main Power Output: Cigarette Port, 12V at up to 15A 
    • USB Output 1: Smart 5V up to 2.4A
    • USB Output 2: 5V, 1A
    • USB Output 3: 5V, 2.1A
    • Integrated Light: white led lantern, 200 lumens, 2 day runtime on a full charge, red flashing led safety light, 200 lumens, 4 day runtime on a full charge
    • Materials: splash resistant design, all connectors have a rubberized cover when not in use
    • Effective Environmental Protection:   IP 45
    • Warranty: One-Year No-Questions-Asked Warranty from GoSun

     

    GoSun Fusion Stove

    • Dimensions: see above  
    • Weight: 14.5 LBS (6.6 kg)
    • Cooking Capacity: 3 Liters (100oz), feeds 4-6 people at the lowest weight possible
    • Cooking Power: 200 Watts in Direct Sunlight, 144 Watts when powered by electricity
    • Back-Up Heating Element and Power Input: 12V DC, 150 Watt, Kapton encapsulated PCB, integrated into cooking tray with plug in handle
    • Working Temperature: 250-400°F (121-204°C) 
    • Max Temperature: 500°F (260°C)
    • PowerBank Runtime: 50-70 minutes, GoSun Fusion is compatible with GoSun Chill PowerBank
    • Safety: all exterior is touch-safe at all temperatures thanks to vacuum insulation
    • Materials: mirrored and anodized aluminum reflectors, stainless steel cooking tray, high-temp. silicone gaskets,  ABS plastic end caps, extruded aluminum body, aluminum legs, borosilicate vacuum tube oven
    • Effective Environmental Protection:   IP 67
    • Warranty: One-Year No-Questions-Asked Warranty from GoSun

     

    GoSun Delivers

    This is our sixth crowdfunded product and we have always delivered.  The GoSun Chill has been in development for years, so we are ready for production.  Your pledge and this campaign will push the Chill forward.

     

    GoSun is working to stop melting and burning

    GoSun is pushing the fuel-free frontier by developing clean technology products that help you use more sun.  In just a few years, we’ve disrupted outdoor cooking with our breakthrough vacuum tube solar ovens. Now, we are going to change the way we keep things cool with an ultra-efficient solar cooler that eliminates ice and gives your portable kitchen a base for re-charging.

    GoSun is committed to making clean technology easy and accessible.  

     

    Our Team

    GoSun is a young company comprised of designers, engineers, and change-makers, intent on serving the world with accessible, clean technology. We are passionate about our products and how they power our customers’ lives. 

     

    Risks and Challenges

    This is our sixth crowdfunding campaign and there is always some risk (and plenty of challenge :) to building cutting edge technology.  Experience tells us to remain open with our backers and provide realistic expectations when getting through production and logistics.  Our estimated production timeline for the Chill provides a delivery schedule assuming things go as planned.  Any bumps or bruises along the path are typically absorbed by GoSun, so you can sit back and chill.

story:
Featured on:


The Apex Camping Shelter is a versatile, high quality weather shelter that will protect you and your gear from rain, wind, sun, and even snow! This tarp was designed to work with the GO! Hammock, but it can be used with virtually any camping hammock on the market. It also makes a great all-purpose camping tarp, or shade canopy, even when you're not using a hammock!



The Apex is lightweight, portable and easy to set up.

Setup is simple with the included guy ropes and stakes. It packs up easily into the included stuff sack. For maximum durability, the Apex is made from high strength 70d polyester fabric with a waterproof polyurethane coating. The ridgeline is professionally sealed with permanent waterproofing tape. Each of the 20 tie out loops is reinforced to create strong attachment points.


Set Up Modes

The Apex can be pitched in countless configurations to adjust to changing weather conditions. Here are just a few of the many set up modes that that can be used with the Apex Camping Shelter:

Porch Mode:

Use hiking poles or sticks to raise one or both sides of the Apex Camping Shelter. The Apex is shown here with the GO! Camping Hammock.

Center Pole Porch Mode (Shown with GO! Camping Hammock)



Two Pole Tarp Camping Mode

Storm Mode with Partially Closed Ends


Storm Mode with Closed Ends


Single Pole Tarp Camping Mode

Shade Canopy Mode Shown In Coyote Brown



What's Included?

The Apex Camping Shelter comes ready to use with the included accessories. Each kit includes: 1 Apex Camping Shelter, 1 stuff sack for the whole kit, one bag for the stakes and guy ropes, two 15' guy ropes with tensioners, six 8' guy ropes with tensioners and six stakes.



Product Details

Available Colors: Forest Green, Slate Gray

Dimensions:11' Ridgeline X 9'5" Width

Shape: Elongated Hexagon with Catenary Cuts

Tarp Weight: 20 oz.

Included Accessories Weight: 8 oz.

Material: High Strength 70D Polyester Fabric with Waterproof Polyurethane Coating

Ridgeline Seam Waterproofing: Factory Sealed with Permanent Waterproof Tape

Tie Out Loops: The Apex has 20 Tie Out Loops for Maximum Versatility.


We will need your help to product the Apex Camping Shelter.

If we can mass produce the Apex Camping Shelter we will be able to offer it at an amazing price! We will need to raise $2,000 to start production. The Apex will be available in Forest Green, Slate Gray and Coyote Brown



The Impact

Every Apex Camping Shelter sold helps give one person in need clean water for an entire year. 663 million people lack access to clean water. We have partnered with nonprofit organizations that develop sustainable water project.

Last year our flagship product the GO! Hammock was successfully funded on Kickstarter. We completed production quickly and received lots of positive feedback.

Risks & Challenges

By manufacturing the Apex Camping Shelter in the same factory we that produced the GO! Hammock in, we will be eliminating most of the risks associated with producing a new product. We have thoroughly tested the completed version of the Apex. It was tested for over 60 consecutive day in the outdoors. During this time, the Apex endured strong winds, heavy thunderstorms and harsh sunlight in south Florida. We tested the product rigorously to ensure that we are producing a top quality product that will provide lasting value for our backers and future customers.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our project with Indiegogo's share tools.

story:
The Copper Ledge Falls is a wooden dory built by Jerry Briggs for Martin Litton, founder of Grand Canyon Dories and Northwest Dories. Litton started the tradition of naming all of his dories after sacred places threatened or trampled by acts of man; this boat is named The Copper Ledge Falls after a substantial rapid flooded by the completion of Hells Canyon Dam on the Snake river in 1967.

Rowing wooden dories in whitewater is an exercise in true love. When things are smooth its the best feeling in the world, but rivers are not always smooth and plan B does not always work. Much of the magic around these boats comes from the love and care given, to keep them floating down stream. The Copper Ledge has some years on her, she has hit rocks countless times, and been repaired with love countless times. Her existence tells a story more important than the countless river tales told by river folk everywhere.

Rivers are my home. The love of rivers and the boats on which we travel them have taught me to be the person I am. I owe them many things, the least of which is to stand up. Stand up and fight.  Many of these rivers and the ecosystems that depend on them are under threat. Through The Dory Project, I am working to preserve and continue the history of wooden boats on rivers, while drawing attention to the issues and threats facing rivers in the American West. Restoring The Copper Ledge to her former glory is the first step towards this goal.

I am fundraising for the materials needed to bring The Copper Ledge back to life. She is built out of marine grade plywood encased in fiberglass and epoxy, her ribs are cedar and her gunnels are oak. I am replacing almost all of her structural components, rebuilding her deck and replacing her floor. She is getting a new transom as well, as I plan to gift the current transom back to the main guide who rowed her for so long, as a thank you for all the love and care he gave her.

Thank you for your time and donations. You are helping me to continue on my dream of little wooden boats on big rivers.

story:
The Trtl Pillow Plus is the premium adjustable, ergonomic and breathable travel pillow. Customise your comfort with Trtl Pillow Plus. Traditional travelling pillows have never been effective, but we are confident that the Trtl Pillow Plus is the best inflight pillow. Building on the success of the original Trtl Travel Pillow, the world’s first wrappable neck pillow for travel, the new Trtl Pillow Plus features a brand new, patented internal neck support, which allows you to adjust the pillow to your height, is super adaptable and fully customisable to your head and neck. Plush foam padding is means this neck pillow is more comfortable than the plane head rest. Breathable materials help to regulate temperature.

Trtl Pillow Plus comes with a water resistant travel bag which means you can keep your pillow clean on the go. Trtl Pillow Plus is also machine washable so you can take it anywhere. If you’re looking for a head support for air travel, the Trtl Pillow Plus is the ultimate adjustable travel pillow.

Interested in covering this campaign? Download the Trtl Pillow Plus Press pack here.

story:
Short Summary

Look at this home. This shows "Solar Windows” “SW” and starts the “SW” campaign. Exploiting the light coming through widows, patio doors, any sources of outside light, Sunshades and Suncurtains in Solar Windows convert it to SPV (Solar PV) electricity inside your home. In the pictured apartment it is possible to generate over 2kW of electricity*. It would be enough to operate most of your electrical appliances.

(* assumes 7x2 square meter windows, 16% PV cell efficiency outside the windows would generate 238 Watts. In 5 hours of sun delivering 12kWh per day. Assuming 20% loss going through the windows, SW could generate a maximum energy of 10kWh)


WHAT BENEFITS DOES THE CAMPAIGN OFFER?

If you are an apartment dweller, now you too can participate in the SPV renewable energy revolution. With the use of Sunshades in big cities old buildings can be electrified without altering landmark buildings.

The installed cost of Sunshade and Suncurtain SPV generators is less than conventional SPV modules because they do not have to be protected from the elements, and their installation cost and associated hardware is missing.

Suncurtains are much lighter than conventional glass to glass PV modules ( < 2kg compared to 10Kg/meter square) and they lend themselves for portable application. 

The SPV generators combined with either AC or DC mother battery storage offer cost-effective electricity delivery even when the electric grid is out.

Come along with us on the journey to replace fossils with SPV in the 21st century.                           SPV is one of the best candidates to take the majority in the energy mix in this century. (Reference 1). In the process we have an opportunity to create more than 100 million jobs world wide, influence the post free market economy and help Main Street  to generate their own SPV electricity. Nanergy Solar  www.nanergysolar.com explains the journey in greater detail. Please start by contributing to our SW campaign. 


THE BIG PICTURE, HOW FAR SPV HAS COME

The present Indiegogo campaign is a part of the energy transformation. The availability of fossil fuels are coming to an end. For mankind to survive we must find an alternative. One of the alternatives is changing to Solar PV. SPV generated electricity is the "electronic energy”, environmentally most benign, will be the lowest cost electricity in the energy mix. Ref.1. Just in the last decade 100 GW of SPV generation has been installed worldwide, creating 1 million jobs. As the change from fossil fuels to SPV advances, this industry is forecast to grow 1000 fold in the next 50 years. Ref.2.

Ref.1. http://www.seekingalpha.com/article/1324411-trends-in-the-cost-of-energy

Ref.2.  http://www.shell.com/global/future-energy/scenarios.html


ALSO EXPLOIT LIGHT INSIDE YOUR HOME

Until now, the installed SPV capacity was done outside, under direct sunlight. There are good reasons also to exploit the available light inside buildings. The first company formed to do this task is IBPV, "Inside Buildings PV”. IBPV is a division of Nanergy Solar, the source of technology. 

The amount of sunshine going through windows is large. In the US for example, if we count both residential and commercial east, south and west facing windows, this comes out to more than 20 meter square per resident. If all this sunlight is converted with 15% efficiency, we could generate 1000GW of IBPV electricity. This is today the US conventional electricity generating capacity.

There are many persons who have no outdoor opportunity to install solar panels. People in apartments, high rise city residences, etc. All of these users of electricity will also have now access to participate in the clean, green energy revolution. Even if you have outdoor SPV installation, you may find it useful combining it with SW products, specially the battery capabilities.


INNOVATIONS PRESENTED IN THE SW CAMPAIGN

The basic products developed under this campaign and available as perks are based on novel type of Solar Panels, the “Sunshade” and “Suncurtain”. The PV panel components are supplied by Nanergy Solar, either based on crystalline Si, cSi or thin films such as amorphous Si aSi or CIGS, and the products are designed, tooled and assembled by IBPV. We do not use any PV material that includes any toxic, carcinogenic compounds such as Cd Cadmium in CdTe. Both the Sunshade and Suncurtain are flexible and much lighter than their outdoor brothers and their mounting is simple enough to be done by the home user/buyer, thus eliminating the costs associated with the installation of the outdoor PV product.


TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS OF PRODUCTS

The two basic novel products developed, the “Sunshade” and the “Suncurtain”, are based on the same ”laminate”, “blade” construction.  On a circuit board base, 0.5 to 2 mm thick, 70 mm wide and 500 mm long (the size may vary according to need), are the cSi wafers mounted and interconnected in series to give 14V output . Using 15% efficient wafers, a typical laminate will produce 5 watts of SPV electricity per laminate (14V x 0.36A = 5W) under full sun. The pictures below show the laminates interconnected with flexible flat connectors into the Sunshade. The second picture shows the connection of the coaxial cable, going from the Sunshade to the battery.

FIG 1

The vertical dimension of the Sunshade can be increased in increments of the blade's width. For a window 0.5 meter long, there will be 7 laminates. The seven laminates are interconnected in parallel with a total output of 14V x 2.5A = 35W. The power output in full sunshine, assuming 15% reflection losses through the window will decrease to about 30W. This product will generate 120W DC SPV electricity per square meter of windows. The amount of electricity generated changes very little whether the laminates are open (horizontal position), or they are closed (vertical position). We may also use more efficient cSi wafers, up to 20% efficiency.

FIG 2


In the Suncurtain product the same laminates are used as shown above. 

Figure 3

In Figure 4A and 4B pictures show the Suncurtains with vertical laminates. On Figure 4A the Suncurtains are open. The curtains like a harmonica on either side of the windows gathers into a narrow fold. On Figure 4B the Suncurtain is fully covering the four windows.

Figure 4C, shows a Sunshade in the open position with the laminates being horizontal. In this example of Sunshades, the long dimension of the laminates are in horizontal direction. 

In the present campaign, the length of both the Suncurtains and Sunshades can come in increments of 0.5 meter. In future commercial marketing in addition to several standard sizes, custom dimensions will also be available.

To protect the products, the laminates are dipped into transparent acrylic. 

Both the Sunshade and the Suncurtain can be pulled out of the way and folded into a harmonica position. For example a 120W Suncurtain in the open position is a sheet of 2mm x 2.0m x 0.5m curtain. If the laminates go in the vertical dimension, this will fold into a volume of less than 0.05m x 0.08m x 2.0m. If the laminates go in the horizontal direction, the folded Suncurtain fits into a volume of less than 0.1m x 0.08m x 0.5m. The weight of the Sunshade or Suncuratin are less than 2kg per square meter.

FIG 4A                                                        FIG 4C

FIG 4B                                                           FIG 4D


PRODUCTS

The first products on the list are two examples of the fact, that not only sunlight, but also normal scattered daylight inside the rooms can be exploited. The aSi PV technology is specially useful for this purpose. You may have a calculator operated by aSi PV. They are so sensitive that they can work by moonlight. The first perks both convert the PV generated and stored energy to white light, using an LED.

The candle may be an interesting decoration for you to put in the window, like Christmas candles.

You will never have to worry about it.The candle will come on every night when it becomes dark and will shot off automatically when the sun comes up. The batteries should last for about 2 years, the PV panel generates about 0.2 Watts in sunlight.

The PV panel of the night light is about 1W. This can be used indoors as a night light.

The remaining five perks are all power generator of differing capacity. The SW50 and SW150 have both portable power banks charged by SW devices. The smallest one has a 10W foldable Suncurtain, and a 15000 mAh LiFePO(4) battery. The battery has a number of different output, capable of charging several different portable devices. It can even start your car when its battery is failing. For all the applications and specifications see the images below.

  1. Car emergency start more than 20 times when fully charged
  2. Start the car immediately even in cold weather
  3. Bright lighting 40 hours
  4. Detonation flash 30 hours
  5. SOS signal 120 hours
  6. Charge intelligent mobile phone full five times
  7. Laptop power supply 2 hours
  8. 1/20 size of the old jump starter
  9. 3 to 5 years lifetime
  10. Rechargeable, convenient (with wall & car adapter)

The five products offered in this campaign are all based on the SW SPV electricity generation charging batteries and from the batteries deliver to either the DC or AC loads. All the products are SPV uninterrupted power supplies (SPV UPS).

There are two kinds of batteries in the product line. When the power supplies are used in an emergency situation, the LiFePO(4) batteries are used. Their cycle times are limited to about 1000 cycles. For the larger systems where continuous supply is the goal we switch to NiFe batteries that are known to be able to perform for over 10,000 cycles+. The 5 basic products are summarized in Table1.

All these systems can run certain appliances. Some of the frequently used appliance consumption is listed below. These are the least energy consumer versions. For a complete list of appliances go to

http://siliconvalleypower.com/index.aspx?page=1922 

Portable heater                                 1.5 kWh/hr
Microwave oven                                0.12 kWh/5min
Air-conditioner 8kBTU                        0.0.73 kWh/hr
Refrigerator 14 cu.Ft.                        0.1 kWh/hr
Portable fan                                       0.03 kWh/hr
Television LCD                                  0.15 kWh/hr
Computer desktop                             0.06 kWh/hr
Laptop                                               0.02 kWh/hr
Cellphone                                          0.006 kWh/hr

To calculate the time that any appliance can be used on a given SW generator, divide the battery power in Table 1 by the consumption of the given appliance on the list above.

The diagram below summarizes the capabilities of all the perks

Again we wish to emphasize that the last three products, SW-500, SW-1k and SWP-4k are the building blocks of an independent self-sustaining electricity generation. These can be combined into a single system. It can also be combined with an outdoor SPV installation and can be increased in a modular fashion to a maximum allowed by your total suitable window space.

If your plans are to head toward this goal, we strongly urge you to invite the Nanergy Solar team to audit your space, and recommend the best way to proceed. This service is free with your committing for the SWP-4k system. This system is identical with the "Sunowner" offered in outdoor installations.

Basically there are two ways to go with the inside hook up. Either run directly certain appliances only, or take off part of your home electricity supply from the grid and hard wired it to the SW-4k 2kw inverter. Our expert electricians will take care of this in a safe way.

You also should be aware, that with this decision you have now joined "the battle for the sun”. We recommend you do research on this topic. You might start with an article of the same title on the Nanergy web site - www.nanergysolar.com

Some of the basic comparison is done on Table 2. The competing approach is offered by a number of leasing companies. Some of the largest players are Solar City, Sun Edison, SunPower, One Roof Energy, SunRun, Sungevity, Vivint Solar etc. When we mention any one of these companies we refer to it as the leasing method. The largest of these companies is City Solar, as noted in Table 2.

It is also to be noted that the largest Sunshade sw5/SV a 1 meter x 2 meter Vertical Sunshade comes with an automated tracker. That is, the laminates rotate from facing east to west as they follow the sun. This way we expect more than 10% gain in SPV generated by this Sunshade, from 300 watts for a stationary 2 meter square, 20% efficient wafer laminate to 340 Watts for the tracking version.

Please also note, as you build up your cumulative SW SPV indoor capacity, you can order additional battery components, or Suncurtain components through this program. The price of 1.2 kW Suncurtain is $1500, 1kWh LiFePO(4) battery is available for $1000 and 1kWh NiFe battery costs $600.

Any outdoor SPV system, compatible with the Sunowner approach installed through the SW SPV campaign, can be added seamlessly to the SW system built here. For further information contact Nanergy Solar.


SW CAMPAIGN CHOICES

The campaign has a number of standard dimensions available both in Sunshades and Suncurtains. There are five different sizes   

sw1= 0.5m x 0.5m                                                                
sw2 = 0.5m X 1.0m
sw3 = 0.5m x 2.0m                                        
sw4 = 1.0m x 1.0m
sw5 = 1.0m x 2.0m

The products can be ordered with the laminates aligned horizontally (H) or vertically (V)

There are two basic choices Sunshades (S) or Suncurtains (C)

The colors for the four different backing materials are shown below:
The yellow (cA),  The patterned (cB), The dark/light brown (cC) The blue (cD)

With the above conventions the products in 4A and 4B would be designated sw5/CV/cC and the picture in 4C and 4D designated as sw4/SH/cB

The yellow (cA),  The patterned (cB), The dark/light brown (cC) The blue (cD)


ECONOMIC CONSIDERATIONS

Economic scale installation only comes into effect with the use of of the largest quoted product WSP-4kWh.

The system has 1kW SPV and 4kWh of battery storage. A residential user has two primary other options, either buy from the utility or use a third party lease purchase, such as offered by Solar City. The three scenarios are compared in Table 2.

*The Solar City and utility prices are from the SEA report for 2013
** The Sunshade and the Suncurtain installation by the owner about 1 hour
*** This year we still count the 30% ITC
**** In California there is additional 60% subsidy for batteries
***** the battery cost for SWP-$ is $400/10,000= $0.04/kWh, for Solar City $1000/1000=$1.0/kWh

If we take the 30% ITC for both the batteries and PV and assume $1/W materials savings plus 60% battery subsidy, than the value to be amortized is $1.20/W. Depending on location for insolation (2000 hrs) and electricity prices ($0.18/kWh), the payback is less than 4 years. This calculation assumes that the same subsidies are available for all the systems.We do not make any representations as to what subsidies will be available for SW SPV generation. We see no reason why there should be different rules for the SW  or the leased systems

There is no question you own the SW products and can easily take it with you. Nanergy Solar offers a very similar product for outdoors, roof mounted or free standing at the same price as SW systems. Such outdoor system can be combined seamlessly with the SW system, specially using its inverters and batteries. You have a choice. You do not have to pay rent payment for sunshine to third party financing companies or to the utility for PV electricity which you loose when you need it most namely when the grid is out. And most of all the Nanergy Solar Sunowner product with batteries is at a lower price than any of the leasing company or utility competitors.

For contributors who wish to pursue federal and state incentives we will convert a contribution to a purchase and provide an invoice prior to delivery at the request of the contributor.


THE ORGANIZERS

The primary organizers are: 

CEO - Sebastian Ferrari 

 CTO - Isaac Lund                                            

Design Consultant - August Lehrecke                                           

Engineering Consultant - Max Kiss                                            

Zoltan Kiss - Technical adviser

John Tuttle - Technical adviser

The Campaign is organized by IBPV, a division of Nanergy Solar, in a collaboration with A Lehrecke a student at RISD. I Lund is a PhD candidate at Albany Nano and M Kiss completing Engineering at University of Michigan. For the resumes of the technical advisors go to the Nanergy Solar website. 

Nanergy Solar Inc - www.nanergysolar.com   email: indiegogo@nanergysolar.com

Telephone 609-423-4115


PAST EXPERIENCE, HISTORY

To have confidence in the fulfillment of the commitments outlined in this campaign we recommend you review the record and history of the two technical advisors. Both Drs Kiss and Tuttle are physicists with 50 and 30 years experience respectively in the PV industry. Dr Kiss started at RCA Laboratories in Princeton NJ, where the first cSi PV modules were fabricated and the aSi devices were developed. Dr Tuttle was one of the members of the NREL research team that developed and demonstrated the most efficient CIGS solar cells.

Some of the accomplishments of Dr Kiss and his colleges are shown in the collage below.

These same personnel of Nanergy Solar were present at the birth of the modern PV industry in the early 1960’s. Bell Labs and RCA Labs were the first ones to make crystalline solar panels. At the same time, amorphous Silicon thin film was also demonstrated as a PV device. Some of the highlights of this journey:

  • First Solar calculator – Princeton, NJ by Optel 1971
  • First SPV watch by Optel 1973
  • First thin film module manufacturing of Port Jarvis, NY by Chronar 1982
  • First PV power project Birmingham, Alabama by Chronar 1985
  • First SPV consumer product the Walklite by Chronar 1986
  • Sale of first PV factory Lens, France by Chronar 1986
  • First PV factory in Harbin, China by Chronar 1988
  • BIPV Times Square, New York City by EPV 2002
  • SPV water pumping in Africa by Nanergy 2006
  • Tandem aSi devices and manufacturing by Amelio Solar 2010


USE OF FUNDS

In the SW (Solar Window) Sunshade, Suncurtain campaign we require a minimum of $150,000 to accomplish three major tasks

i)    $50,000 to complete the design of the Sunshade and Suncurtain products

ii)   $50,000 to pay for the tooling of the components needed for volume production and

iii)   $50,000 to carry out the necessary certifications and approvals needed for distribution in various geographic areas

The main corporate effort at Nanergy Solar is at developing the next generation multi junction thin film PV module technology. The goal of this program is to reach 25% efficient multi junction thin film modules, with a manufacturing cost of $0.25 per watt by 2020. With this module cost the cost of PV electricity can be lowered by an additional factor of three to about $0.04 per kWh.

Parallel with this main effort, several usable advanced product ideas are developed and demonstrated at Nanergy Solar and we hope to fund the commercialization of these ideas by crowd funding like the present SW campaign.


THE TIMING OF DELIVERIES

The design and certification has already started, the tooling will take place when the funds become available.

Products based on aSi modules as used in products 1 and 2 are available from earlier times. We propose to start to deliver those in July 2014. Products 3, 4, 5,  6, and 7, based on the Sunshade and  Suncurtains using crystalline and poly crystalline silicon wafers we propose to start deliveries four month after the funds are available in October  2014.

Depending on the size of interest, the completion of deliveries are estimated to be two to three month after deliveries for the specific products begin

Finally the personnel associated with Nanergy Solar have a strong belief that the energy transformation from fossil fuel to renewable energy such as SPV can be also an instrument of social justice. We envision the penetration and installation of residential solar SPV electricity generation, where the user owns the generation as a collective effort by the communities themselves. This energy transformation can be the basis of self-sustaining communities. You welcome to review a business plan on the Nanergy Solar website for such potential profitable communities. 


FAQ

____________________________________________________________


1. HOW DO YOU COMBINE SW GENERATED ELECTRICITY WITH THE GRID ELECTRICITY IN THE BUILDING?

AC electricity supplied by SW systems should not be plugged into the grid sockets in the wall. Physically the system will work and the electricity you generate will flow back to the grid, but this is against utility regulations.

Only grid interactive inverters are allowed by utilities. That means, when the grid is out your solar power is wasted. SW AC generators, like an appliance, should be used to operate specific loads, that you plug in directly.

It is possible to make the SW generated electricity compatible with the grid, but this should only be considered for greater then 1kW WS electricity generation. We actually recommend to operate the WS system parallel with the grid and build up an independent (UPS type) user/ homeowner electricity supply without getting involved in utility politics and associated costs. Also remember in the event you change residence, you can take this with you without any difficulty.

2. HOW BEST CAN YOU SIZE YOUR HOME FOR SW ELECTRICITY GENERATION?

 We all need an emergency electricity  source in case of power failure. The SW  AC system can give you that with adequate power if you have enough windows. If you want to audit, just how much maximum power could you generate with SW, measure the total east, south and west facing windows in units of meter square. Than multiply the number of square meters by 160 watts (electricity generated by 16% efficient Suncurtain per m(2)) x  4 hours (the number of equivalent peak sun hours per day in the winter in NY) = 640Wh/day/m(2) = 0.64 kWh/day/m(2). Round this off to 0.5 kWh/m(2) of window area.

The power usage of the different appliances can be grouped in three categories

i.)  PC, cell phones, cameras and other portable instruments and certain lights can be run from the DC power block, that is 120 Wh and is charged by a single 30 W Sunshade (SW-150)

ii.)  television, desk computers ,room lights, fans will require 0.5 kWH power block battery,120W sunshade and 500W AC inverter (SW-500)

iii.)  window air conditioners, microwave ovens, refrigerators will need 1kWh battery storage and 1kW inverter (SW-1)

Since the batteries can also be charged by grid electricity,  you can enlarge your battery bank without adding any additional WS and use the 1kW inverter which comes with perk SW-1

3.  WHAT BATTERIES DO YOU USE?

Up to 1 kWh we use the safest version of Li batteries with LiFePO4 anodes. They have a demonstrated cycle time of about 1000 cycles. If you are interested in the largest package of the SW apartment product than we recommend to use NiFe batteries, with guaranteed 10,000 cycles+, the same life as the expected life of the Sunshade or Suncurtain of 25 years. 

4. WHAT SOLAR PANELS DO YOU USE?

We use different manufacturers of crystalline and poly crystalline wafers, with efficiency between 15% and 20%. For the BIPV samplers we use thin film aSi plates. 

5. HOW DO WE MOUNT THE SUNSHADES AND SUNCURTAINS?

Like mounting standard curtains, we supply the fasteners and the upper “ROD”. Just by following instructions an adult can do the mounting in about one hour. 

For SW-4 and greater, the 2 square meter Sunshades are utilized. For this specific product, there is an automatic remote controlled motor drive that follows the sun for maximum efficiency. It also opens and closes the sunshade automatically. 

If you are interested in SWP-4 or larger, the campaign will do the installation with Nanergy Solar personnel. An audit team will come out shortly after your commitment to the campaign to review how much window asset is available and what are your load requirements. The team will also recommend what combination of SW components are most suitable for your needs.

6. WHAT FINANCIAL HELP DOES WS ELECTRICITY GENERATION OFFER?

The first benefit is that you save the cost of the curtains or blinds that the Sunshade or Suncurtain replaces. Depending on your tastes this can range between $25 and $100 per square meter or higher.

Depending on the states you reside in, there may be differing subsidies available. We make no representation at this point as to the availability of subsidies. If you want to pursue federal or state subsidies, at your request we convert your gift to a purchase prior to shipment and will issue an invoice.

After having said that we strongly believe there is no justification to differentiate subsidies only for the utility interactive systems.

7.  CAN THESE SW SYSTEMS BE USED INTERNATIONALLY?

Yes the system can be delivered with appropriate inverters with 60 cycles or 50 cycles and the appropriate voltages used in different part of the world.

8.   IS THE ELECTRICITY PRODUCED MONITORED AND CONTROLLED.?

Yes the combiner box in the battery is equipped with a meter that reads 4 quantities, charging current, battery status, voltage output and output current. This can be coupled with a suitable application (available separately) to your smart phone and be recorded.

9. WHAT HAPPENS IF THE SUNSHADE OR SUNCURTAIN BREAKS?

The products have a manufacturing warranty for workmanship for 1 year. They also have performance warranties for 25 years; "The SW product will not loose more than 15% of its poet output in 25 years". This 25 year warranty also holds for the NiFe batteries. For the Li batteries 500 cycles are guaranteed at full capacity. A second 500 cycles can be extended at an 80% discharge level.

If the SW converter breaks in the first year, due to manufacturers fault, the SPV generator will be replaced. The curtains and the shades can be repaired by the owner, by replacing the broken laminates, provided by the campaign or Nanergy Solar.

10. WHAT IS THE BEST SOLUTION TO WORK OUT A COMPATIBLE SPV GENERATION WITH THE UTILITIES?

This is a very complex question, much discussed these days in the professional journals. Until now the utilities were the primary rent collectors for sunshine. With the leasing companies strongly backed by the big banks the rent collection is moving to Wall Street. When you lease the SPV on your own roof, you are paying for sunshine through the leasing companies to their backers the big banks.

Ideally the utilities grid should not be disconnected from your home, but the user should have the right to own their system. Also it would be in everyone's interest that the grid has access to the dispatchable stored renewable electricity, which is stored in your batteries. Effectively this is the smart grid, where the utilities are connected to your home through the micro grid, where you also share your stored electricity.
story_txt:
Short SummaryLook at this home. This shows "Solar Windows” “SW” and starts the “SW” campaign. Exploiting the light coming through widows, patio doors, any sources of outside light, Sunshades and Suncurtains in Solar Windows convert it to SPV (Solar PV) electricity inside your home. In the pictured apartment it is possible to generate over 2kW of electricity*. It would be enough to operate most of your electrical appliances.(* assumes 7x2 square meter windows, 16% PV cell efficiency outside the windows would generate 238 Watts. In 5 hours of sun delivering 12kWh per day. Assuming 20% loss going through the windows, SW could generate a maximum energy of 10kWh)WHAT BENEFITS DOES THE CAMPAIGN OFFER?If you are an apartment dweller, now you too can participate in the SPV renewable energy revolution. With the use of Sunshades in big cities old buildings can be electrified without altering landmark buildings.The installed cost of Sunshade and Suncurtain SPV generators is less than conventional SPV modules because they do not have to be protected from the elements, and their installation cost and associated hardware is missing.Suncurtains are much lighter than conventional glass to glass PV modules ( < 2kg compared to 10Kg/meter square) and they lend themselves for portable application. The SPV generators combined with either AC or DC mother battery storage offer cost-effective electricity delivery even when the electric grid is out.Come along with us on the journey to replace fossils with SPV in the 21st century.                           SPV is one of the best candidates to take the majority in the energy mix in this century. (Reference 1). In the process we have an opportunity to create more than 100 million jobs world wide, influence the post free market economy and help Main Street  to generate their own SPV electricity. Nanergy Solar  www.nanergysolar.com explains the journey in greater detail. Please start by contributing to our SW campaign. THE BIG PICTURE, HOW FAR SPV HAS COMEThe present Indiegogo campaign is a part of the energy transformation. The availability of fossil fuels are coming to an end. For mankind to survive we must find an alternative. One of the alternatives is changing to Solar PV. SPV generated electricity is the "electronic energy”, environmentally most benign, will be the lowest cost electricity in the energy mix. Ref.1. Just in the last decade 100 GW of SPV generation has been installed worldwide, creating 1 million jobs. As the change from fossil fuels to SPV advances, this industry is forecast to grow 1000 fold in the next 50 years. Ref.2.Ref.1. http://www.seekingalpha.com/article/1324411-trends-in-the-cost-of-energyRef.2.  http://www.shell.com/global/future-energy/scenarios.htmlALSO EXPLOIT LIGHT INSIDE YOUR HOMEUntil now, the installed SPV capacity was done outside, under direct sunlight. There are good reasons also to exploit the available light inside buildings. The first company formed to do this task is IBPV, "Inside Buildings PV”. IBPV is a division of Nanergy Solar, the source of technology. The amount of sunshine going through windows is large. In the US for example, if we count both residential and commercial east, south and west facing windows, this comes out to more than 20 meter square per resident. If all this sunlight is converted with 15% efficiency, we could generate 1000GW of IBPV electricity. This is today the US conventional electricity generating capacity.There are many persons who have no outdoor opportunity to install solar panels. People in apartments, high rise city residences, etc. All of these users of electricity will also have now access to participate in the clean, green energy revolution. Even if you have outdoor SPV installation, you may find it useful combining it with SW products, specially the battery capabilities.INNOVATIONS PRESENTED IN THE SW CAMPAIGNThe basic products developed under this campaign and available as perks are based on novel type of Solar Panels, the “Sunshade” and “Suncurtain”. The PV panel components are supplied by Nanergy Solar, either based on crystalline Si, cSi or thin films such as amorphous Si aSi or CIGS, and the products are designed, tooled and assembled by IBPV. We do not use any PV material that includes any toxic, carcinogenic compounds such as Cd Cadmium in CdTe. Both the Sunshade and Suncurtain are flexible and much lighter than their outdoor brothers and their mounting is simple enough to be done by the home user/buyer, thus eliminating the costs associated with the installation of the outdoor PV product.TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS OF PRODUCTSThe two basic novel products developed, the “Sunshade” and the “Suncurtain”, are based on the same ”laminate”, “blade” construction.  On a circuit board base, 0.5 to 2 mm thick, 70 mm wide and 500 mm long (the size may vary according to need), are the cSi wafers mounted and interconnected in series to give 14V output . Using 15% efficient wafers, a typical laminate will produce 5 watts of SPV electricity per laminate (14V x 0.36A = 5W) under full sun. The pictures below show the laminates interconnected with flexible flat connectors into the Sunshade. The second picture shows the connection of the coaxial cable, going from the Sunshade to the battery.FIG 1The vertical dimension of the Sunshade can be increased in increments of the blade's width. For a window 0.5 meter long, there will be 7 laminates. The seven laminates are interconnected in parallel with a total output of 14V x 2.5A = 35W. The power output in full sunshine, assuming 15% reflection losses through the window will decrease to about 30W. This product will generate 120W DC SPV electricity per square meter of windows. The amount of electricity generated changes very little whether the laminates are open (horizontal position), or they are closed (vertical position). We may also use more efficient cSi wafers, up to 20% efficiency.FIG 2In the Suncurtain product the same laminates are used as shown above. Figure 3In Figure 4A and 4B pictures show the Suncurtains with vertical laminates. On Figure 4A the Suncurtains are open. The curtains like a harmonica on either side of the windows gathers into a narrow fold. On Figure 4B the Suncurtain is fully covering the four windows.Figure 4C, shows a Sunshade in the open position with the laminates being horizontal. In this example of Sunshades, the long dimension of the laminates are in horizontal direction. In the present campaign, the length of both the Suncurtains and Sunshades can come in increments of 0.5 meter. In future commercial marketing in addition to several standard sizes, custom dimensions will also be available.To protect the products, the laminates are dipped into transparent acrylic. Both the Sunshade and the Suncurtain can be pulled out of the way and folded into a harmonica position. For example a 120W Suncurtain in the open position is a sheet of 2mm x 2.0m x 0.5m curtain. If the laminates go in the vertical dimension, this will fold into a volume of less than 0.05m x 0.08m x 2.0m. If the laminates go in the horizontal direction, the folded Suncurtain fits into a volume of less than 0.1m x 0.08m x 0.5m. The weight of the Sunshade or Suncuratin are less than 2kg per square meter.FIG 4A                                                        FIG 4CFIG 4B                                                           FIG 4DPRODUCTSThe first products on the list are two examples of the fact, that not only sunlight, but also normal scattered daylight inside the rooms can be exploited. The aSi PV technology is specially useful for this purpose. You may have a calculator operated by aSi PV. They are so sensitive that they can work by moonlight. The first perks both convert the PV generated and stored energy to white light, using an LED.The candle may be an interesting decoration for you to put in the window, like Christmas candles.You will never have to worry about it.The candle will come on every night when it becomes dark and will shot off automatically when the sun comes up. The batteries should last for about 2 years, the PV panel generates about 0.2 Watts in sunlight.The PV panel of the night light is about 1W. This can be used indoors as a night light.The remaining five perks are all power generator of differing capacity. The SW50 and SW150 have both portable power banks charged by SW devices. The smallest one has a 10W foldable Suncurtain, and a 15000 mAh LiFePO(4) battery. The battery has a number of different output, capable of charging several different portable devices. It can even start your car when its battery is failing. For all the applications and specifications see the images below.

Car emergency start more than 20 times when fully charged


Start the car immediately even in cold weather


Bright lighting 40 hours


Detonation flash 30 hours


SOS signal 120 hours


Charge intelligent mobile phone full five times


Laptop power supply 2 hours


1/20 size of the old jump starter


3 to 5 years lifetime

Rechargeable, convenient (with wall & car adapter)
The five products offered in this campaign are all based on the SW SPV electricity generation charging batteries and from the batteries deliver to either the DC or AC loads. All the products are SPV uninterrupted power supplies (SPV UPS).There are two kinds of batteries in the product line. When the power supplies are used in an emergency situation, the LiFePO(4) batteries are used. Their cycle times are limited to about 1000 cycles. For the larger systems where continuous supply is the goal we switch to NiFe batteries that are known to be able to perform for over 10,000 cycles+. The 5 basic products are summarized in Table1.All these systems can run certain appliances. Some of the frequently used appliance consumption is listed below. These are the least energy consumer versions. For a complete list of appliances go tohttp://siliconvalleypower.com/index.aspx?page=1922 Portable heater                                 1.5 kWh/hrMicrowave oven                                0.12 kWh/5minAir-conditioner 8kBTU                        0.0.73 kWh/hrRefrigerator 14 cu.Ft.                        0.1 kWh/hrPortable fan                                       0.03 kWh/hrTelevision LCD                                  0.15 kWh/hrComputer desktop                             0.06 kWh/hrLaptop                                               0.02 kWh/hrCellphone                                          0.006 kWh/hrTo calculate the time that any appliance can be used on a given SW generator, divide the battery power in Table 1 by the consumption of the given appliance on the list above.The diagram below summarizes the capabilities of all the perksAgain we wish to emphasize that the last three products, SW-500, SW-1k and SWP-4k are the building blocks of an independent self-sustaining electricity generation. These can be combined into a single system. It can also be combined with an outdoor SPV installation and can be increased in a modular fashion to a maximum allowed by your total suitable window space.If your plans are to head toward this goal, we strongly urge you to invite the Nanergy Solar team to audit your space, and recommend the best way to proceed. This service is free with your committing for the SWP-4k system. This system is identical with the "Sunowner" offered in outdoor installations.Basically there are two ways to go with the inside hook up. Either run directly certain appliances only, or take off part of your home electricity supply from the grid and hard wired it to the SW-4k 2kw inverter. Our expert electricians will take care of this in a safe way.You also should be aware, that with this decision you have now joined "the battle for the sun”. We recommend you do research on this topic. You might start with an article of the same title on the Nanergy web site - www.nanergysolar.comSome of the basic comparison is done on Table 2. The competing approach is offered by a number of leasing companies. Some of the largest players are Solar City, Sun Edison, SunPower, One Roof Energy, SunRun, Sungevity, Vivint Solar etc. When we mention any one of these companies we refer to it as the leasing method. The largest of these companies is City Solar, as noted in Table 2.It is also to be noted that the largest Sunshade sw5/SV a 1 meter x 2 meter Vertical Sunshade comes with an automated tracker. That is, the laminates rotate from facing east to west as they follow the sun. This way we expect more than 10% gain in SPV generated by this Sunshade, from 300 watts for a stationary 2 meter square, 20% efficient wafer laminate to 340 Watts for the tracking version.Please also note, as you build up your cumulative SW SPV indoor capacity, you can order additional battery components, or Suncurtain components through this program. The price of 1.2 kW Suncurtain is $1500, 1kWh LiFePO(4) battery is available for $1000 and 1kWh NiFe battery costs $600.Any outdoor SPV system, compatible with the Sunowner approach installed through the SW SPV campaign, can be added seamlessly to the SW system built here. For further information contact Nanergy Solar.SW CAMPAIGN CHOICESThe campaign has a number of standard dimensions available both in Sunshades and Suncurtains. There are five different sizes   sw1= 0.5m x 0.5m                                                                sw2 = 0.5m X 1.0msw3 = 0.5m x 2.0m                                         sw4 = 1.0m x 1.0msw5 = 1.0m x 2.0mThe products can be ordered with the laminates aligned horizontally (H) or vertically (V)There are two basic choices Sunshades (S) or Suncurtains (C)The colors for the four different backing materials are shown below:The yellow (cA),  The patterned (cB), The dark/light brown (cC) The blue (cD)With the above conventions the products in 4A and 4B would be designated sw5/CV/cC and the picture in 4C and 4D designated as sw4/SH/cBThe yellow (cA),  The patterned (cB), The dark/light brown (cC) The blue (cD)ECONOMIC CONSIDERATIONSEconomic scale installation only comes into effect with the use of of the largest quoted product WSP-4kWh.The system has 1kW SPV and 4kWh of battery storage. A residential user has two primary other options, either buy from the utility or use a third party lease purchase, such as offered by Solar City. The three scenarios are compared in Table 2.*The Solar City and utility prices are from the SEA report for 2013** The Sunshade and the Suncurtain installation by the owner about 1 hour*** This year we still count the 30% ITC**** In California there is additional 60% subsidy for batteries***** the battery cost for SWP-$ is $400/10,000= $0.04/kWh, for Solar City $1000/1000=$1.0/kWhIf we take the 30% ITC for both the batteries and PV and assume $1/W materials savings plus 60% battery subsidy, than the value to be amortized is $1.20/W. Depending on location for insolation (2000 hrs) and electricity prices ($0.18/kWh), the payback is less than 4 years. This calculation assumes that the same subsidies are available for all the systems.We do not make any representations as to what subsidies will be available for SW SPV generation. We see no reason why there should be different rules for the SW  or the leased systemsThere is no question you own the SW products and can easily take it with you. Nanergy Solar offers a very similar product for outdoors, roof mounted or free standing at the same price as SW systems. Such outdoor system can be combined seamlessly with the SW system, specially using its inverters and batteries. You have a choice. You do not have to pay rent payment for sunshine to third party financing companies or to the utility for PV electricity which you loose when you need it most namely when the grid is out. And most of all the Nanergy Solar Sunowner product with batteries is at a lower price than any of the leasing company or utility competitors.For contributors who wish to pursue federal and state incentives we will convert a contribution to a purchase and provide an invoice prior to delivery at the request of the contributor.THE ORGANIZERSThe primary organizers are: CEO - Sebastian Ferrari  CTO - Isaac Lund                                            Design Consultant - August Lehrecke                                           Engineering Consultant - Max Kiss                                            Zoltan Kiss - Technical adviserJohn Tuttle - Technical adviserThe Campaign is organized by IBPV, a division of Nanergy Solar, in a collaboration with A Lehrecke a student at RISD. I Lund is a PhD candidate at Albany Nano and M Kiss completing Engineering at University of Michigan. For the resumes of the technical advisors go to the Nanergy Solar website. Nanergy Solar Inc - www.nanergysolar.com   email: indiegogo@nanergysolar.comTelephone 609-423-4115PAST EXPERIENCE, HISTORYTo have confidence in the fulfillment of the commitments outlined in this campaign we recommend you review the record and history of the two technical advisors. Both Drs Kiss and Tuttle are physicists with 50 and 30 years experience respectively in the PV industry. Dr Kiss started at RCA Laboratories in Princeton NJ, where the first cSi PV modules were fabricated and the aSi devices were developed. Dr Tuttle was one of the members of the NREL research team that developed and demonstrated the most efficient CIGS solar cells.Some of the accomplishments of Dr Kiss and his colleges are shown in the collage below.These same personnel of Nanergy Solar were present at the birth of the modern PV industry in the early 1960’s. Bell Labs and RCA Labs were the first ones to make crystalline solar panels. At the same time, amorphous Silicon thin film was also demonstrated as a PV device. Some of the highlights of this journey:First Solar calculator – Princeton, NJ by Optel 1971First SPV watch by Optel 1973First thin film module manufacturing of Port Jarvis, NY by Chronar 1982First PV power project Birmingham, Alabama by Chronar 1985First SPV consumer product the Walklite by Chronar 1986Sale of first PV factory Lens, France by Chronar 1986First PV factory in Harbin, China by Chronar 1988BIPV Times Square, New York City by EPV 2002SPV water pumping in Africa by Nanergy 2006Tandem aSi devices and manufacturing by Amelio Solar 2010
USE OF FUNDS
In the SW (Solar Window) Sunshade, Suncurtain campaign we require a minimum of $150,000 to accomplish three major tasksi)    $50,000 to complete the design of the Sunshade and Suncurtain productsii)   $50,000 to pay for the tooling of the components needed for volume production andiii)   $50,000 to carry out the necessary certifications and approvals needed for distribution in various geographic areasThe main corporate effort at Nanergy Solar is at developing the next generation multi junction thin film PV module technology. The team will also recommend what combination of SW components are most suitable for your needs.6. WHAT FINANCIAL HELP DOES WS ELECTRICITY GENERATION OFFER?The first benefit is that you save the cost of the curtains or blinds that the Sunshade or Suncurtain replaces. Depending on your tastes this can range between $25 and $100 per square meter or higher.Depending on the states you reside in, there may be differing subsidies available. We make no representation at this point as to the availability of subsidies. If you want to pursue federal or state subsidies, at your request we convert your gift to a purchase prior to shipment and will issue an invoice.After having said that we strongly believe there is no justification to differentiate subsidies only for the utility interactive systems.7.  CAN THESE SW SYSTEMS BE USED INTERNATIONALLY?Yes the system can be delivered with appropriate inverters with 60 cycles or 50 cycles and the appropriate voltages used in different part of the world.8.   IS THE ELECTRICITY PRODUCED MONITORED AND CONTROLLED.?Yes the combiner box in the battery is equipped with a meter that reads 4 quantities, charging current, battery status, voltage output and output current. This can be coupled with a suitable application (available separately) to your smart phone and be recorded.9. WHAT HAPPENS IF THE SUNSHADE OR SUNCURTAIN BREAKS?The products have a manufacturing warranty for workmanship for 1 year. They also have performance warranties for 25 years; "The SW product will not loose more than 15% of its poet output in 25 years". This 25 year warranty also holds for the NiFe batteries. For the Li batteries 500 cycles are guaranteed at full capacity. A second 500 cycles can be extended at an 80% discharge level.If the SW converter breaks in the first year, due to manufacturers fault, the SPV generator will be replaced. The curtains and the shades can be repaired by the owner, by replacing the broken laminates, provided by the campaign or Nanergy Solar.10. WHAT IS THE BEST SOLUTION TO WORK OUT A COMPATIBLE SPV GENERATION WITH THE UTILITIES?This is a very complex question, much discussed these days in the professional journals. Until now the utilities were the primary rent collectors for sunshine. With the leasing companies strongly backed by the big banks the rent collection is moving to Wall Street. When you lease the SPV on your own roof, you are paying for sunshine through the leasing companies to their backers the big banks.Ideally the utilities grid should not be disconnected from your home, but the user should have the right to own their system. Also it would be in everyone's interest that the grid has access to the dispatchable stored renewable electricity, which is stored in your batteries. Effectively this is the smart grid, where the utilities are connected to your home through the micro grid, where you also share your stored electricity.

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Jarrett DeLorenzo and I'm Whitney's step-brother.  When Whitney and I met 5 years ago we had an instant connection and shortly after became best friends.  Later on I met her now husband, Raymon, who just recently was the Best Man in my wedding. 
  • My wife, Tiffany, and I were sipping on Mai Tai's on our Hawaiian Honeymoon when this fundraising idea came about - Raymon and Whitney never had their own Honeymoon.  Therein lies our goal - we would love to surprise Raymon and Whitney with the ultimate getaway they deserve.  This couple has helped each and every one of us in more ways than one and it's our feeling, that with some help from family and friends, we can achieve this goal.

What We Need

  • We believe sending them on a tropical cruise will not only be a fun-filled journey, but will keep the entire trip cost-free for them.  After a lot of research, we feel that raising $3000 would cover the costs of an all-inclusive trip to Mexico.
  • Whether you donate $20, $50 or $100, all of the funds will go straight to this getaway.

The Impact 

  • We understand the holidays are coming up and money is tight, but every dollar helps. Just think about the impact it will make on Raymon and Whitney to know that their friends and family came together to give them the trip of a lifetime.

Shhhhhhh! It's a Secret.

  • Of course, please don't tell or hint anything to Raymon or Whitney.  Any questions please contact me at jarrettdelorenzo@hotmail.com or 360-356-2573.

story:
Thank you for taking the time to check out this crazy Indiegog caimpaign! Patricia Dolores is a Greencheek conure Cinnamon mutation. She is 100% cage free and has riden bicycle with me(Popi) over 10,000+miles in the last3.5 years. We have riden most of that in the city of San Francisco where P.D. has because somewhat of a local "Celebirdy" But also on 2 road trips down the coast of California from San francisco to Big Sur Ca and back. About 2 and a half years ago we started to blog and share our adventures at the suggestions of some friends who work in tech in SF.
 So here we are. P.D. does all the reporting,blogging and Popi(me) do all the picture taking and spell checking for her. 
 If this sounds totally fun and crazy it is.
 
The blog has become somewhat of a local SF mission legand and it was even featured nationally in the Huffington post online.
 
PDBIRD.COM
Just google the words "PDbird"and you can see that this is real.
 
Anyway,This story/blog is just a small glimpse into an amazing relationship that I am blessed enough to share with Patricia and this was our attempt to show several things thru our action,and not by making some boring tutorial. 
1) That Conures are just as smart as the larger parrots and to educate the masses of the wonderful mini macaws,the mighty green cheek conure.
 2)To show what the power of love is capible of.
 3)To show that animals of any kind are Alot smarter then we as humans give them credit for.
  4) To show that a car free lifestyle does not have to be boring or restrictive and that anyone can do almost anything by bike.
 Patricia is with me 24 hours a day,7 days a week.
 She goes to any event I attend and then she blogs about it. 
Baseball games,farmers markets,party's,Dolores park,or just bike rides around the city or parks.
 
Last summer we spent 1 whole month on the road and camping in Big sur CA.
 This year we want to bring everyone with us on the trip! With daily and even live blog updates and video we want to share our journey this summer with everyone.
 No matter where we go there tends to be some sort of history or story that we hear, we would love to be able to blog and share these and our own adventures with the masses. 
 Right now we do all this on hand me down equipment and a bike that is not really made for the long tours we want to do this summer.
 
 
If you donate, you can keep the ride going - so that we can spread happiness, and knowledge, to more and more people in the world.

For safety and for the future of PD's adventures, we need a new bike and other blog related iteams. Anything we get past our goal will make bike tour 2013 that much more sucsessful. 
 
So what, exactly, do we need?

A new bike with a custom front rack designed for Patricia's comfort 

  • shade 
  • food
  • perches 
  • chews
  • water

A go-pro camera - $400

Some sort of tablet or small pc to blog from-500

A wireless internet setup - $500

food + living expenses for bike trip 2013 -1000

We want to live-blog my adventures 24/7 - so that you can visit pdbird.com at any time to see what Popi and I are up to. 
 
If we get enough donations, we want to go on a California-wide road trip, so that we can share you a quirky part of California, or some funny adventure we went on. 
 
With these upgrades we should be able to keep the blog and biking adventures going for years to come,not only this summer! This is a chance to help a real blog continue to be fun,wity relavent and fresh. 
 We have 80 pages of blog that you should take some time to go look at,help us make 80 more! 
Cheers   PDBird.com
