story:
The 24Seven - a modular backpack designed to protect your gear, and you.

The 24Seven features a integrated survival kit to get you through emergency situations and transforms to your need - whether traveling, exploring, learning or working.

 

 


DESIGNED TO PROTECT YOUR GEAR.

We built the 24Seven with the same great 600D coated tarpaulin that made our Seventy2 famous.  Instead of a roll-top, the 24Seven utilizes a clam-shell design and waterproof zipper, allowing you quick and easy access inside.  Our CARD system transforms the 24Seven to your day. So whether you’re headed out for an overnight photo safari, a full day of classes or you're a professional who goes from the gym to work to dinner before returning home at night, The 24Seven is a perfect solution to protect your gear, and to protect you...

 

DESIGNED TO PROTECT YOU.

Once inside The 24Seven, a survival kit and color coordinated expert instructions are designed to get you through 24 hours of an emergency.  

Tucked away in it's own pocket, you won't even notice the survival kit is there - until you need it.  It includes a space blanket, water filter, air mask, first aid kit, glow sticks and matches.  All TSA approved and all ready at a moments notice, without compromising space inside your kit.


 

We’ve created a modular CARD system to allow the 24Seven to fit whatever your day presents.  On the inside, our CARDS attach to the bag, creating a book-like experience allowing you to quickly organize and access whatever you need.  On the outside, our LoopLock system is designed to work with all new Uncharted Supply Co products, allowing you to interchange pieces between your 24Seven, Seventy2 and other future packs.

 

The DOPPCARD is a perfectly sized kit for your toiletries.  Waterproof, and designed to fit perfectly in the top of your 24Seven, or on the outside via our attachment system, or, as a fanny pack for those quick on the go missions.  It measures 4"x6"x12" and features two waterproof zippered pouches to organize and separate your toiletries inside.  

 

The CAMERACARD provides a secure, padded carrier designed to organize and protect fragile equipment in any environment. PE Foam panels help organize and brushed tricot fabric provides a luxurious home for your cameras and other electronics.  It measures 12"x12"x5" and also features a zippered mesh pocket on the cover for filters, cables, memory cards and other small pieces.

 

The TECHCARD features 2 padded laptop sleeves, a padded document sleeve, and stretch zip pouch to carry cables, cards, and other accessories.

 

The TRAVELCARD features two stretch mesh zip panels, perfectly sized to accept and protect folded shirts and pants, or pack them full of socks, underwear or any other clothing for a more efficient and compressed solution. More than enough room for a 2-3 day trip or weekend getaway.

The DRYCARD is designed to store wet or dirty clothing without compromising the rest of your pack.  Made of waterproof material, it compresses down for storage inside the 24Seven and then attached outside using our LoopLock attachment system the bag providing additional capacity when needed. 

 

The PETCARD is a complete system designed to give your pet the protection it needs when you're on the go.  Collapsible water bowl, dry food bag and plenty of space for all of your pets supplies in a waterproof, zippered pouch that attaches internally.  The kit also includes Waste Bags, Leash, Mylar blanket, and dog toy.

 

The new 24Seven from Uncharted Supply Co.  Life happens fast.  The more prepared you are, the safer the world becomes. 

 

 

ABOUT US: THE SEVENTY2, SHARK TANK AND MUCH MORE.

 

OUR LAST CAMPAIGN: THE SEVENTY2

I sold my condo, designed and ordered 1,000 units, and hoped to break even. We called the kit The Seventy2.  30 days later, it set a record as the highest funded survival product in crowdfunding history. 

We spent all of December working around the clock, building these kits by hand, in my apartment, and making sure they got out to our backers in time for the holidays.  We Shipped over 1,000 orders by Dec 18 - less than 50 days after the start of our campaign.  

 

SHARK TANK

From there, things got crazy - we appeared on the Season premiere of shark tank, where the sharks fought over us, and we reached a deal for 2x what we were looking for with Robert Herjavec.  Our company has grown, with over 20 team members around the country. 

 

To date, we’ve sold $5 million dollars worth of Seventy2’s to over 110 countries, and our company grows every day.

 

ABOUT US

 

Christian Schauf

Christian is a serial adventurer, athlete, entrepreneur and philanthropist. Originally from the Midwest, he founded the Uncharted Supply Company to help the average person escape extraordinary circumstances. In his downtime he lends aid to those in need, performs charity work in the world’s most dangerous cities, and chases adventure in every sense of the word.

 

Mike "Rooftop" Escamilla

Mike has visited over 60 countries as a professional BMX rider, TV host, stunt man, NYT photographer and Guinness World Record Holder, and he’s experienced his fair share of danger. Mike knows how fast situations can change, and how having the right tools prepared can be the difference between having another great story and not being able to tell it.

 

Josh Anderson

Josh has spent the past decade creating websites for some of the biggest brands in the world. He hails from the same small Wisconsin town as Christian and they have spent the last 15 years touring in a band together. When he isn’t working he enjoys spending time with family, woodworking and camping.

 

Brad Drennan

Brad grew up in Southern California and enjoyed surfing, cycling, running and climbing. After a move to Utah to work for the Uncharted Supply Company, he’s added skiing, snowmobiling and fly fishing to his interests. As an avid outdoorsman, Brad has found a way to channel his passion into his full-time job.

Lonnie Mayne

Lonnie Mayne led InMoment, one of the largest and most recognized customer experience technology companies in the world. As company president, Lonnie and his team worked closely with the leadership of some of the most well-known global brands across 25 vertical markets in over 120 countries helping them to differentiate their brand through exceptional customer experiences.  He is now based in Park City and is helping Uncharted Supply Co manage their rapid growth and development. 

 

Brian Warren

Brian is an AMGA Certified Alpine Guide, AMGA Certified Ski Guide, AIARE Certified Level 1 & 2 Instructor, and Wilderness First Responder. He works as a full-time mountain guide and has guided in various parts of the world like Jackson Hole, WY, the Andes, the Alps and the Himalayas. That’s our long way of saying: He’s walked the walk.

Eric Mayer, MD

Dr. Eric Meyer is one of the premier mountain climbers in the world and has served as a high-altitude medical advisor on some of the most challenging expeditions ever attempted. From summiting Mt. Everest multiple times to saving lives, Eric is the guy you want around when all hell breaks loose.

 

Creighton Baird

Creighton loves a good adventure. He ice climbs, skydives, highlines and regularly sleeps 700 feet off the ground. He specializes in immortalizing all the Uncharted moments that would cause most people to have to change their pants.

story:
Billie Holiday, onstage, singing “Embraceable You,” at the smoke-filled New Orleans Swing Club. Dexter Gordon and his saxophone hanging out at Bop City with Dizzy Gillespie. And Lionel Hampton, Charlie Parker, Duke Ellington, Chet Baker, and John Coltrane dropping in for late-night jam sessions.

A nostalgic snapshot of the New York or Chicago jazz scene?

Nope – this was San Francisco’s Fillmore District in its musical heyday.

In the 1940s and 1950s, the Fillmore was a swinging, eclectic, and integrated neighborhood. Its streets were lit up with lively restaurants, packed theaters, busy pool halls, and eclectic shops – many minority owned. Within one square mile, it boasted two dozen active nightclubs and music joints that thrived for decades until it virtually vanished – abruptly and thoroughly – in one of the largest redevelopment projects in the U.S. Its memory – held by those who lived and played music in the district – is now also in danger of being lost.

Our project, Harlem of the West, is a book, website, and traveling museum exhibit that will preserve and bring back to life the Fillmore's rich musical and cultural history. We are delighted to have newly discovered photographs and memorabilia, as well as audio interviews with those who lived and played in the Fillmore at the height of its glory. Harlem of the West celebrates this unique and rediscovered chapter in jazz history and the African American experience on the West Coast.

We are asking for $20,000 which will just cover the cost of the book, but the reality is that if we want to do the entire project -- book, website, and exhibit -- we need to raise $40,116.63. So getting the word out and trying to double our goal is critical.

To date, very little has been known about this remarkable community and its role in development of California’s unique culture. Most historical societies and archives didn’t think to collect materials about this multicultural community. Yet more than seventy years after the first African American jazz nightclub opened in the neighborhood, many elements of the Fillmore are receiving renewed interest. Its multiethnic residents fascinate. Its jazz, blues, and rhythm and blues musical history set the bar for decades to follow. Its precedence-setting court case, which profoundly changed the nation’s post-war drive to redevelop, is an untold chapter significant to California and U.S. history.

The Harlem of the West Project seeks to bring the Fillmore back to life in a book filled with rarely seen photographs and stories from those who lived through the Fillmore's musical heyday. We will also build a multimedia website so that anyone around the world can hear the entire recorded interviews of each person in the book, plus view photographs and additional stories of the neighborhood. Finally, we’ll launch a traveling museum exhibit based on the book and website, accessible to schools, community centers, museums, and other interested groups both nationally and internationally.

What We Need & What You Get

In 2006, Chronicle Books published our first book, “Harlem of the West: The San Francisco Fillmore Jazz Era.” We launched a tiny website and exhibit created from the materials gathered for that early book. Unfortunately after two pressings, the book was put out of print, although there was, and continues to be, a large demand. 

Within weeks of that book’s release, people began contacting us with insider information about the book’s photographs, offering new stories and oral histories, as well as additional images and artifacts. Many of those who lived the history are elderly; it’s crucial that we document their stories before they pass. We have also received countless inquiries from educators, historians, researchers, those from the neighborhood, and from around the state and the world, clamoring for access to both existing and new materials. We need additional financial resources to gather these new materials and create a much larger – and more accessible – Fillmore cultural history repository, and release a more robust version of the earlier book. 

We are actively seeking funds to complete this project: to interview new subjects who have offered us interviews, to collect their photos and memorabilia, and to research their relevance to the neighborhood. We need to archive and scan new photographs and materials, edit audio and text versions of all the oral histories, and upload the oral histories and new photographs and materials to the website to make them accessible to international audience interested in the subject. We need funds to create new updated e- and print versions of the book. We also seek additional funds to create a new Harlem of the West museum exhibit so that it can travel to venues throughout the state, to the East Coast, and to Europe. 

We have a list of more than 50 diverse interview subjects from a variety of backgrounds and viewpoints who have asked to be part of the oral history recordings. Because of financial and time constraints, we will prioritize the oldest individuals, whose stories about the neighborhood have not yet been told. We will select new photographs and materials in a similar way, with scanning and restoring priority given to images of people and locations not yet included in the project.

The Impact

The Harlem of the West Project targets a general audience of all ages, especially but not limited to anyone interested in American musical and cultural history, African American history, and both urban and community development. Susan Goldstein, head of the San Francisco Public Library History Center, reports that their small Fillmore history collection is one of the most heavily used by researchers around the nation and internationally, demonstrating the hunger for material about this neighborhood. 

The HOTW Project will enhance our understanding of how and why, beginning in the late 1800s, this diverse neighborhood came to be, how it grew through African American migration, and how it boomed almost overnight during World War II.  It tells the story of how people build communities, how they thrive, and how they may decline, if not protected.  In an era in which our cities and neighborhoods are under economic stress, it is enormously valuable to learn from decisions made by often well-intentioned city planners, politicians, and citizens, so that today’s communities can find promising solutions, embedded in our previously forgotten cultural history.

Who We Are

Elizabeth Pepin Silva is a writer, photographer, and filmmaker. Her interest in the Fillmore began when Bill Graham hired her as Historian and Day Manager of the Fillmore Auditorium in 1986. Her short booklet for Graham on the history of the Fillmore Auditorium began her research into the district and its music scene. Elizabeth has written about the neighborhood for magazines and newspapers, and was historian and writer for the San Francisco Redevelopment Agency's Fillmore Sidewalk and Plaza Project, as well as the Fillmore Center's Fillmore Historical Panel Project. Her photographs have been exhibited in museums and galleries including Yerba Buena Center for the Arts and the San Jose Museum, as well as in five books on women's surfing. Elizabeth’s first book as an author, “Harlem of the West: The San Francisco Fillmore Jazz Era,” was published by Chronicle Books in 2006. As a filmmaker, she has produced more than two-dozen programs and won five regional Emmy Awards, and numerous international film festival awards for her documentary film work. Elizabeth has a Bachelors of Arts in Journalism from San Francisco State University.

Lewis Watts  is a photographer, archivist and Professor Emeritus of Art at the University of California at Santa Cruz. He is co-author of “Harlem of the West: The San Francisco Fillmore Jazz Era,” which consists of found photographs and oral histories of the African American community that sprang up as a result of the migration west during WWII. Lewis’s photography has been exhibited and is in the collections of the San Francisco Museum of Art, CA; The Ogden Museum of Southern Art, New Orleans, LA; The Neuberger Museum of Art, Purchase, NY; Smithsonian Institution, Washington, D.C.; The Oakland Museum of California; The Studio Museum in Harlem, NY; and the California Historical Society, among other places. His work concentrates on examining the cultural landscape in Harlem, West Oakland, South Central Los Angeles, New Orleans and other parts of the African Diaspora. He is interested in traces of history, cultural expression, spiritual belief and contemporary experience found in the environment as well as those who leave the traces. Much of his work is informed by his own experience of being Southern-born but raised on the West Coast. This has led to an interest in the connection between the South and North in terms of cultural artifacts and customs brought during the African American migration in the mid-20th century, and the ways that the landscape and people in both regions reflect those influences.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge is time: we're running out of it! Those who experienced the Fillmore's musical heyday are in their seventies and eighties, and we have already lost more than a dozen key figures before we were able to interview them. This project can not wait any longer. The risk is that we either find the funds to conduct and record the remaining interviews on our list, or their stories will be lost forever. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Besides making a financial contribution to our documentary project, we hope you will tell your friends and family about the Harlem of the West Project. Email our link to anyone you think who would be interested. Talk about our project on your Facebook page and in your Twitter feed. Discuss it with your friends over a few beers. Chat about it at bars and restaurants. Help us spread the word and help launch this project back into the world.

We thank all of you for your help and support! With your help, we will be able to complete these interviews, finish this book, build this website and traveling exhibit, and launch this important cultural history into the world where it belongs.
story_txt:
Billie Holiday, onstage, singing “Embraceable
You,” at the smoke-filled New Orleans Swing Club. Dexter Gordon and his saxophone hanging
out at Bop City with Dizzy Gillespie. And Lionel Hampton, Charlie Parker, Duke
Ellington, Chet Baker, and John Coltrane dropping in for late-night jam
sessions.
A nostalgic snapshot of the New York
or Chicago jazz scene? 
Nope – this was San Francisco’s
Fillmore District in its musical heyday. 
In the 1940s and 1950s, the Fillmore
was a swinging, eclectic, and integrated neighborhood. Its streets were lit up
with lively restaurants, packed theaters, busy pool halls, and eclectic shops –
many minority owned. Within one square mile, it boasted two dozen active
nightclubs and music joints that thrived for decades until it virtually
vanished – abruptly and thoroughly – in one of the largest redevelopment
projects in the U.S. Its memory – held by those who lived and played music in
the district – is now also in danger of being lost.
Our project, Harlem of the West, is a book, website, and traveling museum
exhibit that will preserve and bring back to life the Fillmore's rich musical and
cultural history. We are delighted to have newly discovered photographs and
memorabilia, as well as audio interviews with those who lived and played in the
Fillmore at the height of its glory. Harlem
of the West celebrates this unique and rediscovered chapter in jazz history
and the African American experience on the West Coast.
We are asking for $20,000 which will just cover the cost of the book, but the reality is that if we want to do the entire project -- book, website, and exhibit -- we need to raise $40,116.63. So getting the word out and trying to double our goal is critical.
To date, very little has been known
about this remarkable community and its role in development of California’s
unique culture. Most historical societies and archives didn’t think to collect
materials about this multicultural community. Yet more than seventy years after
the first African American jazz nightclub opened in the neighborhood, many
elements of the Fillmore are receiving renewed interest. Its multiethnic
residents fascinate. Its jazz, blues, and rhythm and blues musical history set
the bar for decades to follow. Its precedence-setting court case, which
profoundly changed the nation’s post-war drive to redevelop, is an untold
chapter significant to California and U.S. history.
The Harlem of the West Project seeks
to bring the Fillmore back to life in a book filled with rarely seen
photographs and stories from those who lived through the Fillmore's musical
heyday. We will also build a multimedia website so that anyone around
the world can hear the entire recorded interviews of each person in the book,
plus view photographs and additional stories of the neighborhood. Finally,
we’ll launch a traveling museum exhibit based on the book and website,
accessible to schools, community centers, museums, and other interested groups
both nationally and internationally.



What We Need & What You Get 

In 2006, Chronicle Books published
our first book, “Harlem of the West: The San Francisco Fillmore Jazz Era.” We
launched a tiny website and exhibit created from the materials gathered
for that early book. Unfortunately after two pressings, the book was put out of
print, although there was, and continues to be, a large demand. 
Within weeks of that book’s release,
people began contacting us with insider information about the book’s photographs,
offering new stories and oral histories, as well as additional images and
artifacts. Many of those who lived the history are elderly; it’s crucial that
we document their stories before they pass. We have also received countless
inquiries from educators, historians, researchers, those from the neighborhood,
and from around the state and the world, clamoring for access to both existing
and new materials. We need additional financial resources to gather these new
materials and create a much larger – and more accessible – Fillmore cultural history
repository, and release a more robust version of the earlier book. 
We are actively seeking funds to complete
this project: to interview new subjects who have offered us interviews, to
collect their photos and memorabilia, and to research their relevance to the
neighborhood. We need to archive and scan new photographs and materials, edit
audio and text versions of all the oral histories, and upload the oral
histories and new photographs and materials to the website to make them
accessible to international audience interested in the subject. We need funds
to create new updated e- and print versions of the book. We also seek
additional funds to create a new Harlem
of the West museum exhibit so that it can travel to venues throughout the
state, to the East Coast, and to Europe. 
We have a list of more than 50
diverse interview subjects from a variety of backgrounds and viewpoints who
have asked to be part of the oral history recordings. Because of financial and
time constraints, we will prioritize the oldest individuals, whose stories
about the neighborhood have not yet been told. We will select new photographs
and materials in a similar way, with scanning and restoring priority given to
images of people and locations not yet included in the project.

The Impact 

The Harlem of the West Project targets a general audience of all ages, especially
but not limited to anyone interested in American musical and cultural history, African
American history, and both urban and community development. Susan
Goldstein, head of the San Francisco Public Library History Center, reports
that their small Fillmore history collection is one of the most heavily used by
researchers around the nation and internationally, demonstrating the hunger for
material about this neighborhood. 
The HOTW Project will enhance our
understanding of how and why, beginning in the late 1800s, this diverse
neighborhood came to be, how it grew through African American migration, and
how it boomed almost overnight during World War II.  It tells the story of
how people build communities, how they thrive, and how they may decline, if not
protected.  In an era in which our cities and neighborhoods are under
economic stress, it is enormously valuable to learn from decisions made by
often well-intentioned city planners, politicians, and citizens, so that
today’s communities can find promising solutions, embedded in our previously
forgotten cultural history.


Who We Are

Elizabeth Pepin Silva is a writer, photographer, and filmmaker. Her interest in the Fillmore began when Bill Graham hired her as Historian and Day Manager of the Fillmore Auditorium in 1986. Her short booklet for Graham on the history of the Fillmore Auditorium began her research into the district and its music scene. Elizabeth has written about the neighborhood for magazines and newspapers, and was historian and writer for the San Francisco Redevelopment Agency's Fillmore Sidewalk and Plaza Project, as well as the Fillmore Center's Fillmore Historical Panel Project. Her photographs have been exhibited in museums and galleries including Yerba Buena Center for the Arts and the San Jose Museum, as well as in five books on women's surfing. Elizabeth’s first book as an author, “Harlem of the West: The San Francisco Fillmore Jazz Era,” was published by Chronicle Books in 2006. As a filmmaker, she has produced more than two-dozen programs and won five regional Emmy Awards, and numerous international film festival awards for her documentary film work. Elizabeth has a Bachelors of Arts in Journalism from San Francisco State University.
Lewis Watts 
is a photographer, archivist
and Professor Emeritus of Art at the University of California at Santa Cruz. He
is co-author of “Harlem of the West: The San Francisco Fillmore Jazz Era,”
which consists of found photographs and oral histories of the African American community
that sprang up as a result of the migration west during WWII. Lewis’s
photography has been exhibited and is in the collections of the San Francisco
Museum of Art, CA; The Ogden Museum of Southern Art, New Orleans, LA; The
Neuberger Museum of Art, Purchase, NY; Smithsonian Institution, Washington,
D.C.; The Oakland Museum of California; The Studio Museum in Harlem, NY; and
the California Historical Society, among other places. His work concentrates on
examining the cultural landscape in Harlem, West Oakland, South Central Los
Angeles, New Orleans and other parts of the African Diaspora. He is interested
in traces of history, cultural expression, spiritual belief and
contemporary experience found in the environment as well as those who leave the
traces. Much of his work is informed by his own experience of being
Southern-born but raised on the West Coast. This has led to an interest in the
connection between the South and North in terms of cultural artifacts and
customs brought during the African American migration in the mid-20th
century, and the ways that the landscape and people in both regions reflect
those influences.
Risks & Challenges
Our biggest challenge is time: we're running out of it! Those who experienced the Fillmore's musical heyday are in their seventies and eighties, and we have already lost more than a dozen key figures before we were able to interview them. This project can not wait any longer. The risk is that we either find the funds to conduct and record the remaining interviews on our list, or their stories will be lost forever. Other Ways You Can HelpBesides making a financial contribution to our documentary project, we hope you will tell your friends and family about the Harlem of the West Project. Email our link to anyone you think who would be interested. Talk about our project on your Facebook page and in your Twitter feed. Discuss it with your friends over a few beers. Chat about it at bars and restaurants. Help us spread the word and help launch this project back into the world.
We thank all of you for your help and support! With your
help, we will be able to complete these interviews, finish this book, build
this website and traveling exhibit, and launch this important cultural history
into the world where it belongs.

story:
Since I can remember, I have this longing inside my heart that I need to understand the essence, and the purpose of our existence. 

Rishikesh, has been the centre of spiritual and religious activities and pilgrimages since ancient times in India. The main purpose to travel to this place, is to sit at the feet of the God Realised Masters who are indicating us the way to spiritual Freedom and ultimate Peace trough the Supreme and Divine Knowledge: Satsang. 

This is a country I dream of traveling since childhood, the colours and the smells of anything that is simillar to the Indian culture, keeps calling me from deep within me. This is the time to explore that calling.

All donations will be used to help me to pay the ticket to India from Madeira Island, Portugal from the end of February on, for one month.

If you feel in your heart to help me, donate here and I will offer you an artwork from the heart. Send me your name and address to carlarpsousa@gmail.com and after my trip, I will send you an artwork as a way to show you my deepest gratitude. It will be sent by airmail.

Also, you can follow me on facebook, i'll be posting photos, share some thoughts and comments during my trip.

Hope this can also inspire you to travel inside yourself.

Om shanti !

story:
Turning DC travelers into cycling VIPs!

Cycling is my passion. DC is my city. Becoming the DC Cycling Concierge is not just a new business — it’s an extension of my longtime work to share the benefits and joys of bicycling. 

Cycling is booming in cities across the United States — and there’s no better place to ride than the nation’s capitol. Each year, Washington D.C. gets more than 20 million visitors eager to explore the city, whether traveling for business or pleasure. As a local cyclist, I know the most memorable way to experience DC is from the saddle, so I started thinking: What if there was a service that made that experience quick, convenient and, most of all, fun?

That’s how DC Cycling Concierge got rolling.


Whether serious road riders, triathletes in training or more casual cyclists, people who ride want to get in some miles without worrying about missing the best routes, getting lost or being dumped onto unsafe roads. They want to see the sites on their own schedule at their own pace rather than being confined to a pre-packed group tour with people riding a different pace. They want to get off the beaten path and see why the District is consistently highlighted as one of the best places to bike. 

The DC Cycling Concierge will serve that niche — but growing — market by offering custom, guided tours in the Washington, D.C. region. With a few details on a rider’s desires and goals, I’ll show up at the customer’s hotel or door ready to roll on a route tailored to meet their specific needs. My motto: Your Ride, Your Pace.


What makes me a Cycling Concierge? 

I'm a national cycling expert with 20 years as an executive leading the charge for better biking. I want each customer to have the best possible experience on a bike. I’ve been fortunate to have biked across this great country and more than 20 others around the world. As a DC local, I ride every single day, whether running errands, chauffeuring my foster kids in our family's cargo bike, or getting out on to the back roads of the beautiful countryside around DC for a cycling adventure or training ride. From adventure cyclist and triathlete to bike safety expert training trainers, teachers and police, if it is related to biking, I know about it.

I’ve gotten the inside scoop from area hosts and experts, as well. From hotel concierges to DC’s premier bike rental business, this idea has been met with excitement. After all, most visitors come to the nation’s capital from March to October, overlapping perfectly with the best months to bike. And those visitors — 700,000 hotel rooms per month — contribute nearly $7 billion per year to our local economy!


Delivering priceless experiences.  

So what’s it  cost?  Less than a good bottle of wine.

Guests can choose between fully customized rides at an hourly rate or a menu of popular rides with a variety of riding levels, distance and time options. Fully customized rides cost $249 for one to four riders for the first 2 hours of riding time. Questionnaire, planning, preparation, and follow up included. Each additional hour is $99 with a day rate (up to 12 hours) of $749. The rate is right in line with private tours offered at luxury hotels while delivering experiences guests never thought possible. This personally tailored convenience works out to just over $30/hr per guest for a family of four or four friends who book a ride together.

If the guest(s) does not have their own bicycle, I have a partnership with DC's premier bike rental business to have top notch road bikes and hybrids delivered at reasonable rates. Several hotels in DC now also have bicycles available for guests which will be perfectly suitable for shorter rides in DC. Either way I'm willing to make these arrangements for the guests unless they wish to make their own.

In addition to an amazing experience you could get some cool swag!                     Our new custom top-of-the-line jerseys and water bottles are fashionable as well as functional and will serve you for many wonderful miles. 


Three reasons I'm doing this campaign: 

  1. Marketing opportunity to raise awareness with a cutting-edge team
  2. Pre-sell rides (most contribution levels include perks of one or more rides) 
  3. Help cover the costs of launching this new business

Here is the breakdown of the expenses to start up DC Cycling Concierge:

      $     665  Incorporation & Business Fees
      $ 4,387  Marketing & Branding
      $ 2,468  Equipment
      $ 2,676  E-commerce & Indiegogo Fees 
      $ 2,500  Referral Commissions
      $ 1,650  Professional Services & Affiliations 
      $    830  Liability Insurance

     Total $15,176


By supporting the DC Cycling Concierge campaign you’ll provide some of the essential start-up funding to help launch this unique new service this Spring in time for the start of the cycling season!

Please help me test out this business concept and contribute today!  

If you can be so generous (calling all Test Pilots!), you'll get to experience the benefits of my fully custom service personally. Let me curate a capital ride for you and give you the VIP treatment for a ride you will remember fondly for years.


Check out the Gallery for the fun Video "Give + Get THIS!"
If you are on a mobile device and can't find the Gallery in Indiegogo, you can view the video on You Tube at: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T5v594AGM7k

story:
Every time you travel, the journey beats relentlessly against your luggage — so it must withstand the toughest circumstances. For this reason, we sourced the highest quality components on the market to ensure you can relax and enjoy your trip. 

We have built our products to withstand the rigors of travel. Still, over time, your luggage will develop scratches and scuffs that tell the story of your journey. These marks are like badges of honor — something that shows the world you are living LIFE ON THE MOVE.

These bags have been designed to optimize packing by allowing you to pack more in less space and stay organized.  With the magnetic compression system, compression packing cubes, and tech compartment, you can customize your bag for any trip. 

 
 

Accessories: 

ID Tag included with every luggage piece. Shoe Cube & The Garment Sleeve sold separately.

Creating the best roller luggage was not easy. Our team of 5 designers worked around the clock for over 2 years, testing prototype after prototype, and finally got to a product we know you will love.

 PRODUCT WARRANTY

Here at NOMATIC, we stand behind all of our products. Just register your product to activate your product's Lifetime Warranty. If we can't fix or repair a manufacture defect, we will replace the product, no questions asked.

Please note that scratches, scuffs, dents, and other blemishes that occur due to normal wear and tear of travels will not fall under the product warranty.  These marks are like badges of honor and should be something you are proud of.  Something that helps tell your travel stories.

RETURN POLICY

We offer a 30 day no risk return policy. If you are not 100% satisfied with the quality of the product within 30 days of receiving your order, simply send it back and we will refund you the product cost, no questions asked. But don't worry, we know you are going to love it!

CUSTOMS & DUTIES INFORMATION

DOMESTIC SHIPPING - To 30 Countries:

United States, Canada, and 28 EU Countries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, United Kingdom.

We have 3 warehouses worldwide that allow us to offer low-cost domestic shipping to the 30 countries listed above. Backers with a shipping address in any of these 30 countries will NOT have to pay any additional duties, sales tax, VAT, etc. 

INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING - Rest of the World:

Backers from all other countries (apart from the 30 countries listed above) may have to pay additional import duties or other applicable taxes to the concerned authorities upon receipt of their goods - depending on the import policies of their respective countries. The duties and tax rates vary from country to country. If you wish to learn about the duties and taxes applicable to your shipment, you may want to check with the customs and border protection authority of your country.  

Unfortunately, we do not ship to every country in the world. Due to logistical reasons we are unable to efficiently ship to every country. If your country is not listed as a country that we ship to, we suggest you find a freight forwarder or freight consolidator that specializes in shipping to your country. If you have any questions about this process, feel free to reach out to us.

SHIPPING POLICY

If our shipping carrier attempts delivery to you and the package returns to our warehouse (either because you’re not there, the wrong address was provided, or you moved without telling us), it will be the buyer's responsibility to pay the shipping fee to reship the order. When you receive your tracking number, please keep an eye out for the package.

story:
Why TripFloss?

Travel is an eye-opening experience. It allows us to explore other people and cultures, but it also shows how empowered we are to step way outside our comfort zones and take on the world. And... it's a lot of fun. So we want to help people share those experiences no matter where they're starting out from.

"Getting lost will help you find yourself." - Holstee Manifesto


What We're Creating

We're crafting two video courses hosted on Udemy.com called The Beginner's Guide to Global Travel and First Time Around the World. We'll explore soft skills (having a confident mindset about travel, thinking through what happens to you in a trip) to practical skills (how to get from the US to Europe for under $200, finding reliable information about transit and safety in far-out places).

We hope to build out a full-on website (with gear, guides, interviews, blog posts, and special community-based content) once this gets rolling.


The Perks

We have discounts, free access that you can gift to other people, personal travel planning, and more ideas to come. Please let us know if you have ideas for what you'd like to see as a perk here and we'll most likely run with it!

  • $18 Level: Discount of $60 and our great thanks and appreciation*
  • $40 Level: Discount of $120 and our most excellent thanks and appreciation*
  • $75 Level: Free access plus a free travel planning session on Skype*
  • $160 Level: Three free passes to each course as gifts, a free travel planning session on Skype, and the opportunity to make a cameo in the course*
  • $480 Level: Everything before, plus free lifetime access to any course that we ever make together, and up to 20 hours of free travel planning.*

* Everybody gets a thank-you note because we love you. Don't forget to share your address when you chip in so that we have a place to send it!


Where the Funds Go

Here's the breakdown:

  • Basic recording equipment ($290)
  • Web hosting and domain ($195)
  • Domestic travel for one marathon shoot ($155)
  • Cloud storage for content ($150)
  • Fundraising fees ($65)
  • The joy of travel (Priceless)

If by some strange incredible stroke of luck we end up reaching $4,000 (Our Reach Goal) before the end of the campaign, we're going to do an in-depth course called The Financially Sustainable Nomad and offer it free to everyone who contributed to this Indiegogo campaign. Hey, we can dream...


The People

Ben and Eric are two old college roommates who built this project after planning Ben's honeymoon with his fiance Sara. Ben is an audiovisual expert in Minneapolis and Eric is an entrepreneur and consultant in Washington, DC. This is a passion project for both of us and we hope that this launch will allow us to sustain it over many years.


Spread the Word!

Please repost, retweet, show love, share us around the web. We're grateful! 

Update #2
story_txt:
Why TripFloss?Travel is an eye-opening experience. It allows us to explore other people and cultures, but it also shows how empowered we are to step way outside our comfort zones and take on the world. And... it's a lot of fun. So we want to help people share those experiences no matter where they're starting out from."Getting lost will help you find yourself." - Holstee ManifestoWhat We're CreatingWe're crafting two video courses hosted on Udemy.com called The Beginner's Guide to Global Travel and First Time Around the World. story:
DropMyStuff.com will be a FREE to use website that will help you manage all your favorite websites.

DropMyStuff.com will be what "My Yahoo" should have been.

If you are anything like me, I have over a dozen social media sites I monitor, several news sites I like to visit, a bunch of video and photo websites I keep up with and at least three email addresses I log into daily.

What if I could avoid clicking multiple tabs, bookmarks and drop down menus to get access to my favorite sites? What if I could just go to one place and have all my favorite stuff load up in a very useful way?

DropMyStuff.com will streamline all your sites and organize them the way you want them.

Here's a DEMO.

.........................................................................................................................................

Create "Playlists" of your favorite sites. I want one just for my social media, one playlist for work and one for when I'm home. One click loads the sites I want, wherever I'm at and whenever I want.

Get real time "News Feeds" and see what all your friends and contacts are sharing all over the web. Get emails, LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter updates and more! All in one place, all in real time.

Customize your dashboard by moving your sites to your desired locations. Choose from several wallpapers or create your own to complete your look. You can SAVE multiple playlists, settings and looks.

Here's a DEMO.

.........................................................................................................................................

I've built a DEMO. I’ve figured out how the software part of the website is going to work efficiently and the best ways to make it user friendly. I will continue working with brilliant programmers, designers, system administrators and focus groups to make this website a very special experience.

I need your help to take the next step. I'm looking for funds to put DropMyStuff.com into production.

Here’s the breakdown of how the money will be spent:

  • $125,000: Staff Salaries - 4 people for 12 weeks (2 Software Programmers, Web Designer and Graphic Artist)
  • $25,000: Equipment
  • $20,000: QA Testing
  • $20,000: Manufacturing and Shipping Physical Rewards
  • $10,000: IndieGoGo and Payment Processing Fees

I know what I'm doing; I've led the design and development of over a dozen software products for many Fortune 500 companies, such as AT&T, IBM, Lockhead Martin, HP and many others. So, I know exactly what's required to pull this off.

View My Reel 2013 >>

You are getting in early on a very useful and cool product that will be used by many, many people. And, best of all, you will forever be known with helping make this project possible.

I'm asking you to help me make DropMyStuff.com a reality.

Thank you,

Nelson Romero

  • Follow me on Twitter at @RomeroAgency, as well as DropMyStuff @StuffDrop.
  • 'Like' DropMyStuff.com on Facebook.
  • 'Like' Nelson Romero Agency on Facebook.

As software designer for BellSouth and AT&T, I was able to create software that was enjoyed by millions of customers. Products such as:

• AT&T U-Verse
I was one of the first people in the world to design and develop apps for the iPhone. I designed a highly usable touch-screen interface with a focus on minimalism and stunning visuals for the AT&T U-Verse Digital TV services. I also conceptualized, designed and developed the interface for the set-top box applications.

• BellSouth.net News Portal
Managed creative development and production of online content for the BellSouth.net News Portal (websites, video, games, activities, third party advertisements and promotions). Managed an internal team of associate producers, designers, illustrators, animators and web developers in an exciting fast-paced production environment.

• BellSouth Media Player
GUI design work and functional prototypes.

• BellSouth Instant Messenger
Determined instructional strategies, design solutions and provided support in development.

• BellSouth Video Chat
Responsible for a variety of tasks including user experience design, visual design and usability testing.

• BellSouth Pay Per Viewer
Participated in the requirements analysis and detail design of object oriented software applications.

• BellSouth Email
Developed user interfaces, communications and control software for Windows and Apple-based host systems.

• BellSouth Voice Over IP
Designed, documented, tested and implemented application features and enhancements.

• BellSouth Web Browser
Conducted design, job tasks, content and audience analysis.

story:
ABOUT THE ZipSpa


The ZipSpa is the only portable, collapsible indoor or outdoor pet washing device.  The ZipSpa is an animal's personal bathing unit where the animal is in a self-contained, stationery device where clean water is dispensed much like that of a human shower.  Likewise, used water is extracted and easily disposed into a drain.


ZipSpa allows pet owners to wash their pet at home without the mess of cleaning a sink or bathtub, especially when water splatters after a pet shakes from being wet.  For pet groomers, it can serve as a mobile pet washing device that fits into a car trunk and can be taken to various locations.


The ZipSpa creates an environment where a pet owner or groomer can wash animals and maintain a clean living or working environment.  Because it is collapsible and has wheels, it can be easily stored and transported even if you are on the road traveling by car or RV (recreational vehicle).  The ZipSpa is also convenient for cleaning a pet when outside weather is inclement and your pet is still in need of being bathed.


ZipSpa was created after my kids and I brought home a pet, and my wife did not want to compromise the cleanliness of our home.  Being an engineer in the field of product development, I researched products to see what could be used to bathe pets.  After no success with finding a product on the market, in order to have peace at home, I became charged with creating a solution, hence the ZipSpa.


FEATURES

  • Convenient, easy and  luxurious way to bathe your pet

  • Easy connection to indoor or outdoor faucet

  • Hand-held, adjustable shower head for additional water source

  • Wrap-around shower curtain for easy pet entrance and exit

  • Mounted collar chain to secure pet inside

  • Removable clear cover with cut-out opening for hands and arms (locks into place when pet is in enclosure)

  • Portable with rollers on base for easy movement (lock mechanisms on wheels to fix unit in place)

  • Open entry curtains and drain with connected drain hose

  • Quick lock and release top cover


UTILITY PATENT

Pet Washing Apparatus

United States Patent #8371248B2

Issued February 12, 2013


About the Inventor

Kevin Redick is an engineer and accomplished leader with more than 28 years’ experience in the areas of product design, supply-chain management, program management and prototype conceptual design. Throughout his career, he has demonstrated executive-level expertise in the development and implementation of manufacturing new products. As the product development leader for companies, he has been responsible for solving and supporting production issues. In various capacities, he has worked as an applications engineer, mechanical designer, product engineer, senior process engineer and product manager. He has extensive experience using Solid Works and Pro-Engineering Computer-Aided Design (CAD) software.

With his invention of the ZipSpa, his goal is to utilize his experience with bringing companies’ products from concept to the market with his own product.

Education:

MBA – Lake Forest Graduate School of Management, Lake Forest, IL

M.S. – Operations Technology Management – Illinois Institute of Technology, Chicago, IL

B.S. – Industrial Technology  – Southern Illinois University, Carbondale, IL

A.S. – Diesel & Heavy Equipment Mechanics & Diploma of Automotive Machinist – Oklahoma State University (School of Technical Training), Okmulgee, OK


Can't Contribute, but still want to help:  Here's how:

The ZipSpa brings innovation to the pet industry with regard to having cleaner pets and household environments.  YOU have the ability to make this product get to the market and to consumers by sharing in this campaign.  Help by doing the following:

  • Share the campaign url – https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/zipspa-portable-pet-shower/x/7131637

    • Tweet your support on Twitter; post your support on Facebook; post your support on LinkedIn; use Instagram; use Google Plus or other social media tools.
    • Tell your family and friends to get involved and join the campaign.

    • Use all the sharing options available in Indiegogo to make this product a reality!

As the product development leader for companies, he has been responsible for
solving and supporting production issues. In various capacities, he has worked
as an applications engineer, mechanical designer, product engineer, senior process
engineer and product manager. He
has extensive experience using Solid Works and Pro-Engineering Computer-Aided
Design (CAD) software.
With
his invention of the ZipSpa, his goal is to utilize his experience with
bringing companies’ products from concept to the market with his own product.




Education:
MBA – Lake Forest Graduate School of Management, Lake Forest, IL
M.S. – Operations Technology Management – Illinois Institute of Technology, Chicago, IL
B.S.
– Industrial Technology  – Southern Illinois University,
Carbondale, IL
A.S.
– Diesel & Heavy Equipment Mechanics & Diploma
of Automotive Machinist – Oklahoma State University (School of Technical
Training), Okmulgee, OK

Can't Contribute, but still want to help:  Here's how:The ZipSpa brings innovation
to the pet industry with regard to having cleaner pets and household environments.  YOU have the ability to make this
product get to the market and to consumers by sharing in this campaign.  Help by doing the following:


Share the
     campaign url – https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/zipspa-portable-pet-shower/x/7131637



Tweet your
     support on Twitter; post your support on Facebook; post your support on LinkedIn;
     use Instagram; use Google Plus or other social media tools.Tell your
     family and friends to get involved and join the campaign.

Use all the
     sharing options available in Indiegogo to make this product a reality!

story:
Now, you can add an Electric Water Pump For Water Cushion!

Note: the pump is only for the water filling, not for the air.

If you only need a pump, please go to BUY PUMP. We offer free shipping worldwide.

Live Healthier, Sit Comfortably

Studies have shown that after waking up every day, we spend more than 60% of the time on sitting, more than 9 hours on average. In this case, the spine is responsible for supporting of the entire upper body. If the pressure is too much, it is very likely to cause the disc herniation. In addition, there may be a series of health problems, including neck and back pain, obesity, cancer and so on.
According to statistics, more than 2 million people die every year because of sedentary. It is estimated that by 2020, 70% of the world's diseases will be caused by sedentary. If you can't change the status of long-time sedentary, you can at least choose a way to sit comfortably.

Why We Are Professional

The ordinary cushion is filled with a sponge. Although it is soft, it is not flexible enough to support the body and share the pressure. Long-term sedentary can also lead to airlessness, sweating, and bacteria. This upgraded seat cushion can not only be filled with air, but also filled with water. Help you decompress and be cool in the summer.

  • Relief stress

Even the falling egg doesn't crack! That's because the gas in the seat cushion is evenly distributed in the airbag. Each airbag can help you reduce the stress on your spine. Keep you away from spinal diseases and take a step closer to a healthy life.

  • Air convection technology

Seat on an egg? It's not a magic! With multiple air convection technology, when the airbag receives the squeeze, the gas flows to each other, producing a uniformly pressurized "anti-gravity" effect. This process can buffer the vertical pressure of more than 1/3 of the body weight, greatly reducing the load and pressure of the tail vertebra.

  • Water cool down

In addition to aeration, it also innovatively uses a water injection design, which is specifically designed for long-distance driving/sedentary people. It has been found by experiments that it can effectively help to cool down and disperse heat, so that you can stay away from sweat.

  • Non-slip on the seat

It won't go anywhere.  No straps required. There are 40,000 Class A anti-slip particles on the bottom of the cushion. It is densely distributed in regular hexagons. For any surface of the material, it can achieve an adhesion effect. The anti-slip effect can reach level A.

  • No air leakage, no deformation

Oh, it's strong enough against a car! We did a 200 kg pressure test: after repeated rolling of the car, the seat cushion does not leak or rupture.

  • Reduce thigh pressure

Even feel stressful of your thigh? That's because the regular cushion doesn't have a special design to hold your thigh. The gas inside the airbag circulates, which distributes the pressure of the thigh evenly. The cushion can naturally support the legs, and reduce the pressure on the thigh of the chair surface.

  • Full support, shape your body

Say NO to flat butt! The venting holes of the bumps form a unique support force to prevent the hip muscles from spreading. Dispersing the pressure from the point line surface, it is not easy to form a flat hip, thus shaping the natural beautiful buttocks.

  • Good material

It feels so smooth, and silky. A selection of polyester fabrics can be in direct contact with the skin, and the feel is comparable to silk. The fabric is smooth and comfortable, with good wrinkle resistance and shape retention. It also reduces sweating and heat, making it cool for the user even in the summer.

  • Easy inflation

One breath? It's not a challenge. For standard cushion, the intelligent nozzle design can be inflated with one breath. When deflation, just press the deflation button and give it a slight squeeze.

  • Breathable

It's "live", it breathes. There are gaps between the airbags on the seat cushion to ensure that the buttocks are on the soft cushion while enjoying a relatively breathable state.

Ordinary cushion:
After the hip curve is seated, it forms a "one" shape. The air can't circulate, the buttocks are stuffy. At the same time, the spine is under pressure for a long time, and problems such as blood blockage may also occur.

Air water cushion:
The shallow groove gap design reduces the heat transfer between the legs, buttocks and the seat. This can effectively achieve the ventilation and ventilation effect.

  • Portable

It can be small. After draining the water/air, the seat cushion can be easily folded and stored more conveniently. Small and portable, it is easy to carry around. More suitable for traveling and carrying.

 

Wherever you are, it's always there

Whether you are going to work, studying or driving, this cushion is a good partner for you. Due to the anti-slip particles of the seat itself, it is no longer necessary to use straps for fixing, and the movement is simple. This cushion can be used for various purposes.

Specification

 

Risks and Challenges

We can guarantee that first shipment will go out no later than July 2019 if we successfully get funded. We are committed to meet your expectations without any possible delay in production or delivery. We rate the risk of unexpected delay as being very low.

story:
Important Note to Backers

fishbusta has now passed the prototype stage, tooling has been ordered and production will commence shortly.

 

fishbusta guarantees delivery or a full refund

 

2 MODES OF OPERATION

fishbusta can be used in two ways;.

  • A controlled hand line,

 or,

  • with the tip extended, a conventional rod for cast and retrieve.

FEATURES

  • First ever built-in ‘feel trigger’
  • Higher sensitivity and control of line dispersal under cast.
  • Faster reaction time
  • Superior line guide ability
  • A true ‘fish-bond’ sensation
  • 10 Kg line capacity
  • Reversible mounts for left or right-handed use
  • 2-piece Telescopic extension
  • Equipped with a spinning reel, or, use your own favorite reel
  • Adaptable Cuff to suit arm size
  • Packs in to a compact shape

 

Available in a choice of colors

Two Cuff Sizes

Small/Medium

Medium/Large 

All purchasers will be contacted prior to delivery to nominate color and cuff size

 

ERGONOMIC ENGINEERING

fishbusta’s patented design transforms a hand line in to a power hand line equipped with a reel and uses the natural strength of your body to make catching larger fish a breeze.

It is fun for children to use and the unique ergonomic design makes fishing a joy for individuals with limited dexterity who may find conventional equipment difficult.

 

VERSATILITY

It is the ideal travelling companion for hikers, kayak fishing, stream, river, lake, jetty, rocks, boat and beach enjoyment with the feel of a rod and the power of larger rig. No cumbersome rods to carry around, you can use your own favorite reel, or the high-quality spinning reel supplied.

 

 

LASTS FOR A LIFETIME OF ADVENTURES

Designed by an expert engineering team and built using premium materials, fishbusta is your fishing companion for life. Its patented design has been tested extensively to deliver great performance in all conditions.

 

IDEAL FOR HIKERS, TREKKERS, KAYAKERS, TRAVELERS & EXPLORERS

The perfect travelling companion

We have used It in the rivers, lakes and streams of North America, the Amazon jungle and on Australian beaches to come up with the finished product, a take-anywhere, use- anywhere, carry-anywhere performance fishing rod that puts you in the action no matter where or how you fish.

MAKE PACKING A BREEZE
FOR THE NEXT FAMILY TRIP

No need to carry multiple rods on a roof rack that is already full. No-one needs to miss out on the fun. fishbusta packs in a corner of your cars’ trunk. The waterproof bag separates your fishing equipment from the rest of your luggage.

 

FISH & ENJOY

Wherever you decide to venture fishbusta makes life more enjoyable.

 

SELECT THE fishbusta PACK
THAT SUITS YOU

You will find the following special offers in the PERKS panel 

 

IT PAYS TO SHARE!
 

Click to earn cash rewards for pledges from your very own referral link.

 

WHO ARE WE?

fishbustaTM is headed by two experienced inventors and entrepreneurs John Rich and Alex Paine who between them have been directly involved with the world’s first laptop computer the Dulmont Magnum and the ground-breaking Solartube skylight. Between them they have more than 60 years of experience in design, engineering and production and, as a recreational pastime, have been and still are keen recreational fishermen.

Over 10 years ago John created the first fishbusta prototype and since then, has tested, refined, patented and trialled what is now the final version. Alex has founded successful companies in the IT, engineering and financial sectors, is a published author and a public speaker. John and Alex have combined their talents to form Alternative Innovation Pty Ltd under which fishbusta has been created.

 

fishbusta IN PRODUCTION

With the final engineering designs completed, prototypes tested, tooling ordered, and production facilities engaged we are ready to make fishbusta available to the world.




 

SHIPPING

WHERE DO WE SHIP?

We are able to ship to the U.S, Canada, United Kingdom, European Union, Australia,New Zealand,  Singapore and Japan. VAT and GST charges are not included. 

WHEN DO WE COMMENCE SHIPPING?

We plan to ship the product in January 2019*. We will keep you up to date on our progress and the expected delivery date of your order. *Actual ship dates may vary. We will keep you notified of your product ship date.

WHY ORDER NOW?

Fishbusta is effective, affordable and fun. By buying now, you're getting access to even LARGER discounts that we'll never offer like this again. You're also helping us build a company with a vision to change the way we all think about fishing.

 

SHARE #fishbusta WITH FRIENDS

Hit one of the buttons below and tag a friend or co-worker who needs this! We can't do this .

story:
Madagaskar, 2017/Der Anfang

Die Sonne hängt heiß über Madagaskar, als ein Einbaum im Jahr 2017 durch das lauwarme Wasser des Manambolo-Flusses gleitet. „Und was wäre, wenn wir 2019 mit einem mit Weltraumfolie beklebten Suzuki Wagon R und in Hahnenkostüme gekleidet an einer Rally teilnehmen, die der Dummheit gewidmet ist?“, fragt Marco und Matthias denkt, er habe einen Sonnenstich.

Deutschland, 2019/Das Auto

So oder weniger präzise waren unsere ersten Vorstellungen von der Mongol Rally. Zwei Jahre nach den ersten Tagträumen sitzen wir nun in unserem Suzuki Wagon R, in dem unsere Köpfe gegen die Decke stoßen, wenn die Straße holprig ist, und der sich im Kreisverkehr bedrohlich weit gen Boden neigt. Optimistisch haben wir dem 21 Jahre alten Gebrauchtwagen den Weltraum auf die auberginenfarbene Lackierung geklebt - in der Hoffnung, dass er die Grenzenlosigkeit des Universums annimmt und uns sicher durch den Mongol Rally’schen Kosmos bis nach Ulan Ude in Ostsibirien navigiert.

 

Das Team

Zum galaktisch gut aussehenden Auto gehören auch zwei galaktisch gut aussehende Männer. Dem Anlass entsprechend haben wir uns in Schale geworfen - oder diese vielmehr abgestreift - und plustern unsere prächtigsten Federn für euch auf. Wir, Marco und Matthias, sind Reise-Enthusiasten, teilen unsere Liebe zu Oeuf Sur plat, nehmen uns selbst nicht zu ernst und hegen eine Begeisterung für Hühnervögel. Wir könnten auch schreiben, dass wir langweilige Ingenieure aus Deutschland sind und mal etwas Aufregendes ausprobieren, aber wir wollen uns nicht in Klischees verlieren. Als Dschingis Hahn können wir nicht wirklich fliegen, rauschen aber voller Begeisterung und mit lautem: „Bokoook!“, die goldenen Straßen des Abenteuers entlang.

 

Die Gründe

Das klingt erstmal ganz cool (bei genauerem Nachdenken vielleicht auch eher stickig und schwitzig, wenn man sich die fehlende Klimaanlage und die heißen russischen, turkmenischen, usbekischen etc.-ischen Sommer ins Bewusstsein ruft), aber wir sind mit unserem Auto nicht einfach nur oeuf to space. In unserem Wörterbuch steht vor „Unsinn“ nur noch „Umweltschutz“ und so fahren wir nicht nur für uns, sondern auch für Cool Earth.

Erfahrt hier, welche tollen Projekte Cool Earth unterstützt:

https://www.coolearth.org/

 

Hierfür sammeln wir Spenden und hierfür brauchen wir dich, euch, Sie! Jeder noch so kleine Beitrag zählt und wird von uns mit großer Dankbarkeit entgegengenommen sowie weitergeleitet. Je nach Spendenhöhe gibt es außerdem das ein oder andere Hahnen-Goodie von unseren Abenteuern dazu. Wir sind für jede Unterstützung und sämtliches Interesse an unserem Vorhaben dankbar. Unsere Abenteuer könnt ihr hier

https://www.instagram.com/dschingis_hahn/

und hier

https://www.facebook.com/Dschingis-Hahn-Mongol-...

mitverfolgen.

 

Los geht's


Im Manambolo-Fluss befand sich 2017 übrigens so wenig Wasser, dass wir den Einbaum weitaus mehr geschoben haben, als dass er uns getragen hat. Hoffend, dass unser Auto uns während der Mongol Rally jeden Morgen fröhlich krähend ein Stückchen weiter gen Ulan Ude tragen wird, verbleiben wir bis auf weiteres mit der Hoffnung auf eure Spenden.

Das passiert mit eurem Geld:

52 % des Betrags gehen an Cool Earth
40 % Taschengeld für Autoreparaturen in Tadschikistan, Turkmenistan und der Mongolei (und überall sonst)
5 % Gebühren für Indiegogo
~3 % Transaktionsgebühren

story:
We, the Berlin Bombshells from Berlin, Germany, belong to one of the oldest European roller derby teams. Founded in 2008 we have maintained a competitive focus from the very beginning. Improving with every year and in 2013 we achieved our biggest successes - we won the German Championship and took 1st place in SKOD the European WFTDA Tournament. Now in 2014 the time has come to take on even bigger challenges - bouting against teams in the US.

Our goal

Bringing a roller derby team to the US means a 10 day quest for 20 athletes - players, coaches and officials.

To compete at the highest level the Berlin Bombshells chose to participate in the Beach Brawl Tournament in Florida, along side over twenty other teams from six different countries and three continents.

We have to cover flights, accommodation and day to day travel costs in and around Florida - car rentals and gas. We will not only be bouting against three opponents in the Beach Brawl Tournament in Ft. Lauderdale, but have we also accepted challenges from Tampa and Jacksonville. 

We estimate that we would require a budget of roughly 20,000 € (28,000 $) for the whole team. That gives each participant a share of 1000 euros (1400 $). This crowd-funding campaign is a means to further accrue funds for our endeavor.

What we have already done

To cover these costs we have been setting up fundraising activities since November 2013: We organized bootcamps in Berlin, collected donations at events, sold cakes and cocktails, produced and sold special merchandise.

This crowd-funding campaign is one of many means to reach our goal of 20,000 € (28,000 $)!

For months each one of us has been saving money for this momentous undertaking . We are determined to go to the US no matter what! (This may mean we may need to sleep on the beach, though we'd rather not

Your impact

The Berlin Bombshells want to make roller derby accessible to every woman independent of her financial situation. Bouting in Europe is a big thing, bouting in the US is huge! With your help this dream will come true.

Your donation will contribute to the sustainable growth of our team & league. Players who have been practicing for years will have the opportunity to take the next step - and financial limitations should not hinder them materalising the hard work they have invested in training. 

Your donation will bring American and European teams closer. The Beach Brawl Tournament is the most internationally present roller derby tournament thus far. Experiencing the level of play of teams from six different countries within one weekend is THE ultimate goal!!

Your donation will support the growth of this female sports discipline. Never before has a women's sport expanded so rapidly. You can be part of its history - even off the track. 

Want to help even more? Sweet!

Spread the word!

Speak to your friends, speak to your colleagues, speak to your family!

Share this page on Facebook or Twitter.

See you in May 2014 in Ft. Lauderdale, FL!
♡ Your Berlin Bombshells ☼
story_txt:
We, the Berlin Bombshells from Berlin, Germany, belong to one of the oldest European roller derby teams. Founded in 2008 we have maintained a competitive focus from the very beginning. Improving with every year and in 2013 we achieved our biggest successes - we won the German Championship and took 1st place in SKOD the European WFTDA Tournament. Now in 2014 the time has come to take on even bigger challenges - bouting against teams in the US.Our goal
Bringing a roller derby team to the US means a 10 day quest for 20 athletes - players, coaches and officials.To compete at the highest level the Berlin Bombshells chose to participate in the Beach Brawl Tournament in Florida, along side over twenty other teams from six different countries and three continents.We have to cover flights, accommodation and day to day travel costs in and around Florida - car rentals and gas. We will not only be bouting against three opponents in the Beach Brawl Tournament in Ft. story:
Grant Galloway's Racing Career

This 2014 racing season will feature Grant Galloway in a pavement sprint car. At the early age of nine, Grant Galloway began his racing career in a quarter-midget, where he grew to love the sport. As the years progressed, Grant also moved through the ranks of racing taking part in multiple car types: Kenyon Midgets, Outlaw Super Late Models, National Midgets, and the NASCAR Camping World Truck Series. While Grant's ultimate goal is to join the likes of the NASCAR elite, he is excited and looking forward to working with Ed Kenens Motorsports Sprint Car team this year. 

What We Need & What You Get

This year, Grant is working with a Sprint Car team - Ed Kenens Motorsports - he will be running over 20 pavement races in the 2014 season, and the biggest of all - The Little 500! The Little 500 - in its 61st running - is part of a one week premier event, that features racers from all over the country joining together to commemorate the Indianapolis 500. The field will consist of 33 cars lined up in 11 rows of 3, mimicking the traditional Indy 500 line-up. With 500 laps, this race is the longest Sprint Car race in history. The race will take place at Anderson Speedway on May 24; the speedway is a quarter mile, high-banked, paved short track in Anderson, Indiana, known to be the fastest quarter mile in the world.

Here's where you come in:

  • Racing is expensive.
  • We are looking for lap sponsors, by sponsoring one lap at $20 a lap, you help Grant work towards a dream. With an end goal of $10,000, Grant will be able to race an entire season with the Ed Kenens Motorsports Sprint Car team, and move towards his end goal of racing in NASCAR.
  • While we understand that $10,000 seems like a lot, your donation - no matter the size - will help Grant to gain traction in the racing industry. 

Lap Sponsor

As a lap sponsor, you get to choose which lap your donation works toward. Depending on the amount of your donation, the following perks are available:

  • 2 laps (a minimum of $40) - receive an autographed Grant Galloway hero card
  • 5 laps (a minimum of $100) - receive an autographed Grant Galloway t-shirt
  • 15 laps (a minimum of $300) - receive one pit pass* to a Sprint Car race of your choice. 
  • 50 laps or more (a minimum of $1,000) - receive four pit passes* to a Sprint Car race of your choice. 
*A pit pass allows you behind the scenes access to drivers, race cars, and race teams giving you the true experience of racing.

story:
Alooo-ha! We are Team Rock from Hilo, Hawai’i (pronounced he-low not high-low).  With a population of 44,000, Hilo is a cozy, sleepy town that we call our home.  Team Rock is a captivating group of ten female paddlers who are dedicated to life on the water while living mortal lives in nursing, teaching, biology, real estate, land management and accounting.  Although we are from a small town, our camaraderie has inspired us to dream so far beyond the shores of our islands that we are seeking sponsorship and friendly donations in order to compete in Auckland, New Zealand at the 2014 Tapakuna Beach Cup. 

Team Rock humbly ask for donations to help reach our goal to raise $7000. Your generous donations will help in a number of important ways:

Race entry fees (7km & 42km Race Events)
Canoe and Escort Boat hire
Accommodations/Meals
Transportation (Rental & Gas)
Team Uniforms

The perks of donating to our team reflect the unique persona and cultural relevance to canoe paddling in Hawai’i. Every funder will receive a Personalized "Mahalo Nui Loa" (Thank you) card from the team. And as a SPECIAL thank you for your donations, we have custom designed a limited amount of Team Stickers, Team Rock t-shirts, pareos and reusable bags.

10 women of Team Rock will be traveling to Auckland, New Zealand to compete in the 2014 Takapuna Beach Cup from February 21-23. We will be competing in the 7 km OC-6 man race and the 42 km OC-6 Change race. We are setting our sights on contending for a place on the podium. 

The women of Team Rock have also raced in several other races in 2013:

Dad’s Center Race - 25 mile change race from Kailua Beach to Waikiki Beach Duration of Race: 3 hours and 46 minutes

Queen Liliuokalani Race - The World's Largest Long Distance Race from Kailua-Kona to Honaunau.  Placed 19th, 26th  and 28th competing against of 133 local, national and international women’s crews.

Pailolo Challenge, Iron race from Maui to Molokai (26.2 miles)

Pailolo Challenge, Change race from Maui to Molokai (26.2 miles)

Team Rock is dedicated to competing at the next level of outrigger canoe long distance racing.  In the spirit of canoe paddling in Hawai’i, we are always searching for canoe races that push up beyond all possibilities.  We believe that anything is possible with the right training and teamwork.  Coach Loke, our fearless leader, has designed our training regiment to maximize our maximum potential.  In return our team has committed to training with toughness, determination and humility.  Because we represent the Hilo community, we carry ourselves with the highest regard of gratitude and appreciate for this incredible sport. 

Paddling canoe has given us so much more than just physical strength.  It has afforded us another perception of life that teaches us to train hard, commit, endure and unite for the team.  It has given us the perseverance to live resilient lives outside of paddling.  All of us work in career fields that benefit our community whether it is helping patients or students, protecting natural resources or enhancing the quality of life for the people of Hilo.  Therefore, paddling directly impact our little community on the Big Island of Hawai’i.

Other ways you can help:

Check out our Facebook page :  Team Rock (Link Below) and check for updates, pictures, etc.

SHARE our Indiegogo Sites with Friends, Family, Coworkers, ANYONE and EVERYONE!!!

Also a big shout out to our biggest supporters:  ROCKTAPE

RockTape is a special kind of tape, otherwise known as kinesiology tape, used by practitioners to treat injuries and improve sports performance. RockTape helps athletes improve form and decrease fatigue through better blood flow. It can be used to treat a number of injuries that include achilles tendonitis, rotator cuff, shin splints, postural correction, etc. They have instructional videos to show you how to properly tape for different issues. Check out their webpage at www.rocktape.com and use "Keaukaha" coupon code for 20% off your order!!

story:
Why we created ClickPack X?

 

After we finished the ClickPack Pro campaign, we received a huge amount of feedback from backers all over the world. Most backers were comfortable with our product quality and design; however, we collected some good ideas from ClickPack Pro users in order to improve our future designs. We spent almost two years communicating with our customers to understood that they wanted more safety features in bags that were sleek, durable and affordable. This is why we created the ClickPack X — an upgraded backpack with total cut-proof material, a hidden TSA lock, minimalist-style surface fabric, ergonomic back support design and optimized internal storage design. The most important thing was that many ClickPack Pro backers wanted to have a 100% black bag, but still with cut-proof material as an option. We can now present the ClickPack X. As a design-driven brand, we’re so proud to have created the new ClickPack. We need your help to bring the idea to life!

story:
Basically:

If there's one thing anyone knows about me, its that I am absolutely in love with service. This year I am going on a service trip to Panama from May 19th to May 31st, and I am SUPER excited to embark on this amazing experience. I am required to raise 700 dollars for basic needs on this trip. Please help me help others and donate to this awesome cause. Any amount will be more than helpful, and any extra money I raise will go to toward helping the other SJU students I am going on this trip with. 

More Deets:

So I'm a freshman at St. John's University, currently enrolled in a 5-year program for Government and Politics. At the moment, I'm on the road to declaring a double major in Government as well as Theology. I know, it's a weird pair- but these are two of the greatest loves in my life so I thought, why not put them together? I may not know exactly what career I am aiming for, but I know for sure God will take care of the rest! 

In Panama I will be living extremely simply, and a family will be opening up their home to me as well as the other students. As far as I know, there will be two students to a family. I don't really have any expectations of whats going to happen but my mind is wide open to all the possibilities.

Other Ways You Can Help

I really really appreciate any financial support, and as a way of saying thank you there are some perks to the side of the page that you can pick out if you pledge $5 or more. There is a choice of a rosary bracelet, rosary, or a variety of magnets that I designed with the phrase "Love is Power" because that's something I live by everyday, and its a great reminder of showing my supporters what a powerful thing they did by showing me love so that I can pass that on to others. Photos of these items can be found in the "Gallery" tab at the top of the page.


If you can't support financially, its no biggie. I would really appreciate if you could share this page, spread the word, even just bring it up in conversation. Most importantly, pray for us! The power of prayer alone is an amazing, beautiful thing, however, the power of prayer in a community is unstoppable. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this. I know we can reach this goal and I am praying for you all throughout this journey. God Bless!
