story:
Hi! I’m Nora and I am the founder of NOMADZ. I am originally from Germany, but grew up in Indonesia where I went to an international school before coming to the US. I am currently a senior at Rider University majoring in Entrepreneurial Studies and International Business. 

What makes NOMADZ different? 

  1. First and foremost, NOMADZ differentiates itself by the fact that we are solely aimed at university students, and young adults.
  2. Unlike traditional websites that need travel information before getting to work, the NOMADZ website offers the ability to recommend different travel recommendations based simply on your personal preferances. And if you have a specific destination, date, or length in mind - we offer that option as well.
  3.  As NOMADZ accumulates travel data from other sources, we have identified 9 key elements that we believe are most important to consider for anyone in our generation before they embark on their travel. For every destination that you explore, the NOMADZ website will offer you the ability to easily view these 9 elements: Flights & Transportation, Accommodation, Budgeting, Traveler Tips, Things to Do & Guides, Culture & Cuisine, Media & Highlights, Visas/Safety/Health, Group Travel.

What We Need & What You Get

We have the website prototype ready for development. We need your help to build the website, and bring our vision into reality. The funds raised through this campaign will go towards hiring an expert developer who will write the code, in order to create the functionally interactive website we have established in our prototype. 

Even if we don't reach our entire goal, the raised funds will still go towards a developer who will be able to produce a minimum viable product of the NOMADZ website. 

The Impact

We want to make traveling easy and personal, by providing a free tool for anyone who has a dream to see the world. Traveling changes us - it helps us understand that together, we are part of something greater: a global community.

Risks & Challenges

As a university student, I understand that I do not have the same experiences as a seasoned entrepreneur. However, as the founder I am also part of the market that we are aiming to reach. Because of this, I am able to put myself in the shoes of the consumer to help understand what our generation needs. Even though being young may provide its challenges, I also believe it is one of the greatest assets I have. As a student, I am surrounded by a vast amount of experienced entrepreneurs, and professors who have supported me throughout this journey. So even if I do not have the experience or knowledge myself, I can assure you that I am in good hands.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can support us by donating, and even sharing this campaign link through your social networks! You can also follow us on our social media accounts to stay up to date with what we have achieved so far.

Instagram: @nomadztravel

Twitter: @nomadztravel

Facebook: @nomadztrav

Your support means everything to us, so we hope you join us!

story:
Isn't it such a bummer when you lose your keys or wallet? Every time I lose something, I spend 20 minutes looking for my keys only to find them hiding in the most obvious place, possible - usually in yesterday's jeans or under the couch cushion. 

 

 

 

 

 

That's why we invented TrackR, a simple way to keep track of items using your smartphone. After 5 years of R&D, thousands of customer feature suggestions, and 5 product revisions, we are proud to reveal TrackR bravo to the world. 

 

TrackR bravo is the most elegant item tracking device ever created backed by the world's largest Crowd GPS network.

Questions? Talk to us! Support@TheTrackR.com

 

 

Track Anything

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Quickly Locate Lost Items

 

 

 

 

 

 

With the TrackR app for iPhone and Android, you can quickly locate items around the home using the distance indicator radar or tap the "Ring Device" button to cause your lost item to ring.

 

Can't Find Your Phone? No Problem.

 

 

 

 

Many phones have been eaten by couch cushions. Press the button on TrackR bravo to cause your phone to ring...and it works even on silent mode.

 

Track it down. From anywhere

 

 

If an item goes missing, TrackR's Crowd GPS network will help you find it.  When another user of the TrackR app comes within 100ft range of your lost item, you will receive a GPS update of where your item is. 

 

The World's Largest Crowd GPS Network

 

 

 

 

Because the TrackR app is built to track any Bluetooth device or Bluetooth tracker device, it's no surprise we have the world's largest Crowd GPS network with over 1,000,000 item updates per day!

 

See Crowd GPS in action:

 

 

 

 

Design Driven Product

 

 

We took a different approach with TrackR bravo. We focused on making sure we used the best techniques and materials to create the thinnest tracking device ever.

 

Impossibly Thin

 

 

Coin sized. 3.5mm x 31mm diameter. Metal construction. And feature packed.


 

 

Custom Laser Engraving

 

 

 

 

 

Have each TrackR bravo individually laser etched to display a short message. Have your return information etched into the back, add a nice message for a gift, or use TrackR bravo as a replacement for your cat or dog's name tag.

Anodized Metal Colors

 

 

 

 

 

 

Customize your devices by selecting one of 4 available colors: Black, Rose Gold, Sky, and Steel. Each color is applied through a metal anodization process in order to maintain the product's high quality look and feel. Color upgrade for your TrackR devices is just $5 on Indiegogo or you can get a free color upgrade by referring 5 people to visit the page using the sharing tools above, Facebook, Twitter, and email.

 

Accessorize 

 

 

The TrackR accessory pack enables you to track even more items with 3 unique accessories:

1) Pet Collar Attachment - A water-proof attachment that easily attaches to a pet's collar.

2) Steel Key Loop - An extra durable metal key loop that hooks onto not just keys, but backpacks, purses, and more.

3) Water Proof Casing - Take TrackR bravo where ever you want to. Keep track of things at the water park, by the pool, at the beach, or at the lake.

 

 

TrackR App

 

 

 

 

 

                                   

Keep your items at your fingertips

 

When Chris and Christian first came up with the idea of TrackR, they envisioned transferring the entire "database of items in our head" to our phones, just like your phonebook (remember how you used to know your best friend's phone number?). 

The TrackR app is focused on achieving that vision so you let the app keep track of your items for you.

 

 

With the app design, we tried to simplify the entire user interface by enabling users to access core functions as quickly as possible. 

It's of course packed with features:

  • 2 Way Separation Alerts
  • Custom Ring Tones
  • Custom Item Icons
  • Customizable Alert Settings
  • Tracking up to 10 Items*
  • Background Operation

If you have any feature requests or feedback, we would love to hear them: support@thetrackr.com. 

 

 

 

Compatible with iPhone 4s & later, iPad 3rd Generation & later, and Android 4.4 devices with Bluetooth 4.0.  

*For iPhone and iPad. Android varies on manufacturer

 

 

Use of Funds

 

  • App Design and Improvements
  • Production Tooling
  • Antenna Refinement
  • Firmware Refinement
  • Buzzer Cavity Optimization
  • Power Optimization
  • Certifications - FCC, CE, Bluetooth

 

 

 

 

 

Let's get to details

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Diameter: 31mm

 

Thickness: 3.5mm

Battery Life: 1 year replaceable

Battery Type: CR1616 coin cell

Connectivity: Bluetooth 4.0 

Device Compatibility: iPhone 4s & later, iPad 3rd Generation & later, and Android devices with 4.4 or above.

 

About Us

 

 

 

 

Now that you've learned about TrackR bravo, we'd like to take a moment to introduce the minds behind TrackR.

TrackR bravo was developed by TrackR, a Santa Barbara, CA-based startup company. The company was founded by Chris Herbert and Christian Smith, two UC Santa Barbara graduates who met during their college years.

The idea for TrackR began when Chris almost lost his car to the Pacific Ocean because he couldn't find his keys, ultimately redefining the definition of beach side parking. After brainstorming a solution, Chris and Christian entered into the UC Santa Barbara business plan competition and won. 

 

 

They began working on TrackR the same day they graduated in 2009 and launched the world's first next generation tracking device, Phone Halo, at Demo 2010. 

Since that time, several revisions of Phone Halo have been released including Cobra Tag, inSite, Wallet TrackR and StickR TrackR.  Each better than the last. Over a quarter of a million devices later, the team is proud to announce TrackR bravo and represents the original vision for the company of taking the database of items in your head and moving that to your phone.

Schedule

This is our 6th item tracking product and we already have trusted & very capable manufacturing partners. This isn't our first rodeo but things seem to always come up and will be providing regular updates every 3 weeks to backers.

 

 

 

 

You've heard from us and now we'd love to hear from you.

 

 

 

Please let us know if you have any questions, comments or suggestions!

Email Support at Support@theTrackR.com

Please note that our team will try as hard as possible to answer any and all questions and comments that are left on the comments page but the easiest way to get immediate assistance is to email our Support Team, Support@theTrackR.com. 

Don't forget to like and follow us for the latest information on all things TrackR bravo!

Like Us on Facebook: http://www.Facebook.com/TrackRbravo

Send us a tweet: @TheTrackR 

Contact Chris on the Twitter:@CGherb

(Quick note: I love hearing from backers, Twitter is preferred to email. If you need to email me, cc Support as my inbox is a tad backed up)

For inquiries regarding Distribution, Retail, and Partnerships please apply at: http://www.thetrackr.com/partners

 

 

 

 

Press

Please email chris@thetrackr.com for more information. 

 

 

Still have some questions?

How big is TrackR bravo?

We designed TrackR bravo to be so small that it can be attached discretely to virtually anything. It’s only 31mm diameter and 3.5mm height – about 50% thinner than previous designs.

How many TrackR bravo devices can a smartphone find?

Using the TrackR app, a smartphone can manage up to 10 TrackR bravo devices at once on iOS. Android this number varies from 1-10.

How do I replace the battery in my TrackR bravo?

TrackR bravo has a suicide battery door that swings open, making battery replacement easier than ever. Uses a CR1616 battery.

What is the range of TrackR bravo?

TrackR bravo's range is approximately 100 feet (30 meters).

How does TrackR bravo attach to items?

The back of TrackR bravo can be stuck to almost any surface. The device also has a convenient loop that can also attach to keychains.

How is TrackR bravo different from other finder products?

1) Two-Way Technology: Find your item using your phone or find your phone using your StickR TrackR Device.

2) Thinnest Device Available: TrackR bravo is nearly 50% thinner than previous designs.

3) Crowd GPS: Technology that allows users to locate their items after they have been lost. TrackR's network is the world's largest, locating lost items 8 times every minute

4) Separation Alarm: Notifies you when leaving an item behind as well as remembers where you left the item on a GPS map.

5) Sustainability: The device is meant to last a lifetime and has replaceable batteries.

6) Being really, really, really, ridiculously good looking.

Can I use your product with other BLE Tracking devices?

Absolutely! Our TrackR app can work with other BLE tracking devices, Bluetooth cars, headsets and more!

What's your plan for Android support?

We're one of the first to develop on Android using the Bluetooth Low Energy API's. As an early adopter of BLE technology on Android, we're dedicated to improving the platform and providing a world class Android app.  Android is supported at launch.

Is the device water resistant?

The device will last through rain but isn't waterproof, so don't go swimming with your TrackR bravo device.

Oops! I forgot to add international shipping! What should I do?

Please contribute the shipping amount ($10) and select no perk. We will match your contributions.

 

I want to upgrade my perk

Please contribute the difference and select no perk. We will match up your contribution to the correct perk and will confirm after the campaign.

Please note if you add custom engraving to your TrackR bravo device, we cannot accept returns or exchanges.

 

Is this iOS 8 Compatible?

Yes, it is compatible from iOS 7 & on.

 

Can I get a refund or cancel for an engraved order?

No because your device is unique to you and all engraved orders have been made. We stand by a policy if the device is non functional, we will replace the device.

Problem backing us?

Please contact support@indiegogo.com.
story_txt:
Isn't it such a bummer when you lose your keys or wallet? Every time I lose something, I spend 20 minutes looking for my keys only to find them hiding in the most obvious place, possible - usually in yesterday's jeans or under the couch cushion.      That's why we invented TrackR, a simple way to keep track of items using your smartphone. After 5 years of R&D, thousands of customer feature suggestions, and 5 product revisions, we are proud to reveal TrackR bravo to the world.  TrackR bravo is the most elegant item tracking device ever created backed by the world's largest Crowd GPS network.Questions? Talk to us! No Problem.    Many phones have been eaten by couch cushions. Press the button on TrackR bravo to cause your phone to ring...and it works even on silent mode. Track it down. From anywhere  If an item goes missing, TrackR's Crowd GPS network will help you find it.  When another user of the TrackR app comes within 100ft range of your lost item, you will receive a GPS update of where your item is.  The World's Largest Crowd GPS Network    Because the TrackR app is built to track any Bluetooth device or Bluetooth tracker device, it's no surprise we have the world's largest Crowd GPS network with over 1,000,000 item updates per day! See Crowd GPS in action:    Design Driven Product  We took a different approach with TrackR bravo. story:
Finnish Footbag Association organizes European Footbag Championships in Turku, Finland on July 11-13, 2014. It's gonna be great, no matter what. With the contributions, it will be the measuring stick for all future footbag events.

The Short Version: Euros needs your help!

The long version: We have the best possible venue to organize a footbag event in Turku; a 2,000-seat sports arena inside a Caribbean themed spa-hotel. The venue, equipment, player shirts, trophies, etc. all cost some serious money. Unfortunately, we can't afford to everything we want to without the participation fee getting through the roof. Since we're not looking to organize just another footbag tournament, we need the help of contributors to make a real difference. All contributors automatically become honorary Finns and are henceforth treated with the utmost respect by the Finnish footbag community.

Contributed yet? Great! Now, register as a competitor for Euros: bit.ly/1uCVMwL

story:
2 brothers, Lucas & Travis Boychuk, have finished building the worlds 1st action sports resort in San Juan Del Sur, Nicaragua.  They now need your help to build the second Surf Ranch resort in Costa Rica in exchange for discounted nights and all inclusive packages at the current and new resort.

We started with this piece of land (purchased from our gas station jobs)...

and turned it into this....

...the worlds 1st action sports resort.

Now we need your help to build our second one in Costa Rica!

The Surf Ranch Resort and how it was found.

One cold December night back in 2008 in Kelowna, BC, Canada, after work, 19 and 21 year old brothers Lucas & Travis Boychuk decided to pick up a case of beer after work and chill in their parents hot tub. The discussion started with buying islands and ended with buying land in a foreign country.        
                 
They brought out the laptop and looked up islands for sale around the world. As the search went on, islands seemed to be out of the question, so they decided to type in "cheap land for sale" on Google. Phillipines and Nicaragua came up. They decided to book 2 return tickets to Nicaragua that week...as it was closer than the Phillipines.        
             
So off to Nicaragua they went. They found themselves doing the same thing that every backpacker does when they travel...explore. They spent the 2 week trip, exploring, partying and having fun. The 2 weeks went faster than they thought. It was the day before they had to go home that they realized that they didn't really look at much land. After walking down the street of San Juan Del Sur, they met a local contractor from California that overheard them talking and stated..."you guys speak english?", as he was renovating an old building. That night the brothers went to go check out a 2 acre plot of land that his friend had for sale.        
 

             
Lucas and Travis loved the piece of land for sale, and they put a $1000 deposit on it. The owner of the land made an agreement where they would pay the rest off over the course of a year. The brothers came back to Nicaragua 4 months later, rented a truck and toured the country, hired a lawyer, and did some work on the land. Over the next year, they worked like crazy at their jobs. Also during that year, they built a website and came up with a business plan on what they wanted to do with the land...to build the world's 1st action sports resort.        
             
"To be honest with you, we had our doubts", says Lucas, that was until he posted an ad on their local towns website...looking for investors for the project. Over the course of 1 month, they met up with 6 potential investors at a local starbucks, and they all wanted in. They only chose 2 investors from the bunch, and off they went. The two brothers sold their vehicles, everything they owned, had to end their 5 year relationships with their girlfriends, and off they went into the unknown.

In Dec 2012, The Surf Ranch Resort launched its grand opening as the worlds 1st action sports resort and newest and most talked about resort in Nicaragua.

The Surf Ranch resort consists of Nicaragua`s largest skateboard park, jungle paintball course, tower drop into a huge inflatable airbag, world class restaurant & bar, swimming pool & swim up bar, poolside cabanas, luxury villas and penthouse condos.
 
 

Our Campaign and your contributions.

We are not a huge company, we are only 2 brothers with a dream.  We were successful in raising money for our 1st resort, and followed through, through thick and thin and finished it.  We have been through it all here in Nicaragua and it was 100% worth it.  We provide work for over 50 workers here in Nicaragua, in a place where jobs are very scarce.

Our campaign is to raise funds to help us build the second Surf Ranch resort in Costa Rica, after the success of our 1st resort in Nicaragua.  Your contributions mean everything, and will go towards buying the building materials and creating jobs for the local families.

You are not only helping to build the best action sports resort in the world for you to come and experience at discounted rates, but you are also helping create jobs for the local Costa Rican builders and families in the small beachtown of our second location.
 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $100,000 USD.

The funds will be used to start the resort in Costa Rica and buy building materials such as cement, bricks, blocks, rebar, iron, gravel and to hire locals for construction and security.

The funds will be used the following way:

$1 - 2 cement blocks

$10 - Bundle of rebar

$10 - 1 bag of cement

$10 - 1 day of pay for a construction worker or security guard which will go along way to support their families

We have many perks for you, from 1 - 5 night all inclusive stays at the finished resort to your very own condo unit that will allow you to make 50% monthly rental income and vacation in the unit for 2 months a year.

If we do not reach our goal for this campaign, then no problem!  Your raised funds will still be used to build the resort.

Your contributions mean everything and will help get us started.

The Impact

Over 90% of the worlds resorts are owned by the older generation.  At their resorts you can sleep, eat, get a massage and lay by the pool and it costs a fortune!

Our generations turn is here and we are at the forefront of building a resort chain made for our generation, the young and adventurous.

We have already built and opened the worlds 1st action sports resort in San Juan Del Sur, Nicaragua and it is has been very successful.  Our demographics are the 18 - 40 year old adventurous types looking for a new travel experience.

Other Ways You Can Help

It would mean the world to us if you could help us spread the word by using any of the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word on your Facebook page :)

Thank you so much for your contribution and we will see you in Costa Rica soon!

story:
Short Summary

We are proud to introduce you to Ryde Bright. Ryde Bright is a new company that specializes in intelligent wearable technology for motorcycle riders. We have been working on a product for over a year now that takes motorcycle jackets to a whole new level. We use a wireless LED system that connects to the motorcycle and syncs the signals from the bike to the jacket making the bike and the jacket one.

Our goal is to make motorcycle riders more visible on the road, especially at night. In 2012, approximately 5,000 people were killed and 91,000 were injured due to a motorcycle accident. We believe this product will revolutionize motorcycle riding by increasing the safety of both riders and drivers on the road.

Contributors will help us on our endeavor to take Ryde Bright from its prototype stage to a finished product. Making Ryde Bright the worlds #1 intelligent motorcycle jacket manufacture.


What We Need & What You Get


We need funds to develop this project. The money we raise will be used for engineering, designing, tooling, production and marketing of our product in order to bring you the latest and greatest product.  Right now we need to purchase top of the line LED lights that is available overseas.  We also need funds to purchase our limited hoodies, tees and ultimatley the jackets.  

 If we do not succeed in reaching our goal we will continue to send our contributors the listed perks and apply the remainder to the development of Ryde Bright. 

The Impact

As motorcycle riders we wanted to make a product that would make motorcycle riders safer and more visible on the road. 

We believe that we could revolutionize the motorcycle industry by creating a product that integrates both style and technology to make the riding experience safer and more enjoyable.

In our pursuit to bring Ryde Bright to you, we talked to hundreds of people, most believed that Ryde Bright is a great idea and thought that if it was on the market they would purchase one for themselves or for someone who they know who rides.  

We have successfully developed a prototype and with the reviews received from the community we are diligently working with industry designers to bring Ryde Bright to the next level. 

With your help and donations we will save lives together one jacket at a time!

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that in todays society not everyone can contribute financially but there are other ways to help. You can also donate your time by taking five minutes and sharing Ryde Bright with a friend. Please spread the word about our campaign!!!!

If you feel you have what it takes to be part of our team please reach out to us at info@rydebright. We would love to hear from you!!!!!!
story_txt:
Short Summary
We are proud to introduce you to Ryde Bright. Ryde Bright is a new company that specializes in intelligent
wearable technology for motorcycle riders. We have been working on a product
for over a year now that takes motorcycle jackets to a whole new level. We use
a wireless LED system that connects to the motorcycle and syncs the signals
from the bike to the jacket making the bike and the jacket one.
Our goal is to make motorcycle riders more
visible on the road, especially at night. In 2012, approximately 5,000 people
were killed and 91,000 were injured due to a motorcycle accident. We believe
this product will revolutionize motorcycle riding by increasing the safety of
both riders and drivers on the road.Contributors will help us on our endeavor to take Ryde Bright from its prototype stage to a finished product. Making Ryde Bright the worlds #1 intelligent motorcycle jacket manufacture.What We Need & What You GetWe need funds to develop this project. The money we raise will be used for engineering, designing, tooling, production and marketing of our product in order to bring you the latest and greatest product.  Right now we need to purchase top of the line LED lights that is available overseas.  We also need funds to purchase our limited hoodies, tees and ultimatley the jackets.   If we do not succeed in reaching our goal we will continue to send our contributors the listed perks and apply the remainder to the development of Ryde Bright. The ImpactAs motorcycle riders we wanted to make a product that would make motorcycle riders safer and more visible on the road. We believe that we could revolutionize the motorcycle industry by creating a product that integrates both style and technology to make the riding experience safer and more enjoyable.In our pursuit to bring Ryde Bright to you, we talked to hundreds of people, most believed that Ryde Bright is a great idea and thought that if it was on the market they would purchase one for themselves or for someone who they know who rides.  We have successfully developed a prototype and with the reviews received from the community we are diligently working with industry designers to bring Ryde Bright to the next level. With your help and donations we will save lives together one jacket at a time!Other Ways You Can HelpI know that in todays society not everyone can contribute financially but there are other ways to help. You can also donate your time by taking five minutes and sharing Ryde Bright with a friend. Please spread the word about our campaign!!!!If you feel you have what it takes to be part of our team please reach out to us at info@rydebright. We would love to hear from you!!!!!!

story:
UPDATES:

2/1/14:  Our new book has arrived!  All pre-orders are on their way to you.  Thank you once again to all Indiegogo supporters!  If you'd like to order an autographed book, eBook, or book/eBook package, please visit www.photographingacadia.com.

11/12/13:  WOW!!  We've surpassed our first stretch goal of $7,000, thanks to you! ALL funders/supporters that have already contributed or contribute prior to November 30, 2013 will now receive a FREE download of my "Shot List Template" (PDF) at the end of the campaign!

Let's keep the momentum going with a NEW stretch goal!  If we achieve $8,000, I'll send contributors a free handout on the Recommended Restaurants and Lodging Listing around Acadia, in addition to the free PDF download of my Shot List Template.

11/1/13:  Thanks to you, we've met our original $5,000 goal in the first week!  But we'll continue to accept pre-orders through November 30, 2013...with new goals and new rewards!

We've set a new stretch goal to $7,000.  If we achieve this amount - and we're really close! - I'll send all campaign funders a FREE download of my Shot List Template (PDF) to help you record your ideas for photographs during the visualization process. 

As always, appreciate your support!

Why This Book and Campaign?

After three Artist-in-Residencies, multiple Arizona Highways Photography Workshops groups I've led, and numerous personal visits to Acadia National Park in Maine, I feel this burning urge in my gut to run up to the top of Cadillac Mountain and yell at the top of my lungs so everyone in the world can hear, "COME TO ACADIA!  COME TO ACADIA!!"

But to do so would violate "Leave No Trace" principles (and annoy a whole lot of people).  So I decided to write this book instead!

Scheduled for publication in February 2014, my new guidebook, "Photographing Acadia National Park:  The Essential Guide to When, Where, and How" is my invitation to you to experience, enjoy, and photograph Maine's coastal gem through your own lens. 

But I need your help!

By offering the book/eBook for pre-order sales and other exciting perks at a discount to my amazing community of valued supporters, I'm hoping to raise $5,000 to help me cover the cost of printing the book.  (Besides being the author and photographer of this book, I'm also the publisher - Analemma Press, LLC.)

What's This Book About?

Whether you are a beginning shutterbug, professional photographer, painter, or hiker interested in nature, wildlife, or history, this book will save you time and help you prepare for the photographic trip of a lifetime to Acadia National Park.  In short, I'm writing the book I wish I had for my visits to Acadia!

Jam-packed with priceless location-specific information, over 250 inspirational color photos, and instructional photography tips collected during my unmatched experiences as a three-time Artist-in-Residence in Acadia National Park, this invaluable guidebook reveals:
  • WHEN:  Ideal times to photograph scenic vistas and intimate details based on lighting conditions and ephemeral seasonal events throughout the year (wildflowers, fall colors, & wildlife migrations).
  • WHERE:  50 can't-miss classic and lesser-known locations across Mount Desert Island, the Schoodic Peninsula, and Isle au Haut.
  • HOW:  Recommended equipment and expert-level techniques to help you make stunning photographs at each suggested spot.

Also featuring an 18-page Photography Basics section, 12 insightful "Behind the Photo" stories, a Shoot Summary, and Recommended Itineraries, this book will help you get in the right place at the right time to create your very own treasured photographs from Acadia National Park!

I'm also producing an eBook (PDF) for download to your mobile devices with the same content plus interactive hyperlinks and maps included!

Here's a sample of a two-page spread for location #16 Boulder Beach from within the book:

What's in it For You:

To show our appreciation for your support, we're offering our book for pre-order purchase as well as numerous other perks at a discount. We will not offer these discounts once this fundraising campaign concludes, so if you have interest in our guidebook, eBook, prints, and workshops, now's the time to buy!

In exchange for your pledge, here are the various perks you will receive (click the package listing on the right side of this website to order):

$5 - Little Hunters Beach: 
A personalized, heartfelt "Thank You" email note with a 10% off coupon for the book and/or eBook.  (Save $2.50!)

$10 - Pretty Marsh: 
A free download of the "Photographing Acadia National Park" eBook (Valued at $12.95 - save $2.95!)

$25 - Sand Beach: 
An autographed copy of the "Photographing Acadia National Park" book with FREE shipping within the U.S.  International orders, please add $7.00.  (Valued at $30.90 - save $5.95!)

$35 - Great Meadow: 

  • An autographed copy of the "Photographing Acadia National Park" book with FREE shipping within the U.S. International orders, please add $7.00
  • FREE download of the "Photographing Acadia National Park" eBook
  • (Valued at $43.85 - save $8.85!)

$45 - Jordan Pond: 
Two autographed copies of the "Photographing Acadia National Park" book with FREE shipping within the U.S. Buy one for you and one for a friend! Or, buy one for your bookshelf and one for your car/camera backpack! International orders, please add $7.00. (Valued at $55.85 - save $10.85!)

$80 - Eagle Lake: 

  • Two autographed copies of the "Photographing Acadia National Park" book with FREE shipping within the U.S.
  • An 8"x12" print on lustre paper of your choice from my Acadia National Park gallery. International orders, please add $24.00.
  • (Valued at $104.90 - save $20.85!)

$100 - Schoodic Point: 

  • Your name listed in the book and on our www.photographingacadia.com website as a Valued Contributor forever!
  • Four autographed copies of the "Photographing Acadia National Park" book with FREE shipping within the U.S. Great gifts for birthdays and holidays! International orders, please add $38.00.
  • FREE download of the "Photographing Acadia National Park" eBook
  • (Valued at $124.95 - save $24.95!)

$250 - Thunder Hole: 

  • Your name listed in the book and on our www.photographingacadia.com website as a Valued Contributor forever!
  • Four autographed copies of the "Photographing Acadia National Park" book with FREE shipping within the U.S. Great gifts for birthdays and holidays!
  • FREE download of the "Photographing Acadia National Park" eBook
  • A signed, limited edition 16"x24" lustre print of your choice from my Acadia National Park gallery. International orders, please add $60.
  • (Valued at $298.70 - save $48.70!)

$500 - Otter Cliffs: 

  • Your name listed in the book and on our www.photographingacadia.com  website as a Valued Contributor forever!
  • Six autographed copies of the "Photographing Acadia National Park" book with FREE shipping within the U.S.
  • FREE download of the "Photographing Acadia National Park" eBook
  • A signed, limited edition 20"x30" ready-to-hang metallic print of your choice from my Acadia National Park gallery. International orders, please add $65.
  • (Valued at $644.95 - save $144.95!)

$1,000 - Bass Harbor Head Lighthouse: 

  • Your name listed in the book and on our www.photographingacadia.com website as a Valued Contributor forever!
  • Six autographed copies of the "Photographing Acadia National Park" book with FREE shipping within the U.S.
  • FREE download of the "Photographing Acadia National Park" eBook
  • A personalized critique of up to 10 of your images PLUS a one-hour Skype session to review and discuss your images with me.
  • I'll develop your very own customized itinerary for your future trip to Acadia National Park based on your interests, including the best photo spots throughout the day, meals, lodging, etc. - to help you have the trip of a lifetime!
  • (Valued at $1,574.15 - save $574.15!)

$5,000 - Cadillac Mountain - SOLD OUT! 

  • Your name listed in the book and on our www.photographingacadia.com website as a Valued Contributor forever! And since you'll be responsible for funding our entire campaign, we'll put your name(s) at the very top of the list in bold.
  • Your very own private, exclusive photography workshop in Acadia National Park for up to four people for up to three days, led by yours truly. You and three of your friends cover your own airfare to get there; I'll cover everything else - your lodging (double occupancy), transportation, meals, etc. I'll show you my secret spots, get you to the right place at the right time, and we'll have a blast making unforgettable images while making memories in a magical place! (We'll work together to schedule a convenient date.)
  • Eight autographed copies of the "Photographing Acadia National Park" book, hand delivered during your workshop.
  • Each workshop attendee gets his/her own free download of the "Photographing Acadia National Park" eBook on all their mobile devices.
  • (Valued at $5,776.40 - save $776.40!)

Where Your Money Will Go:

All monies raised in this campaign will go towards the following:

  • The actual printing costs for 5,000 copies of the book
  • The cost of fulfilling perks (e.g. prints, shipping, travel)
  • Indiegogo fees (~4%)

In addition, I am proudly donating 10% of this book's profits to the Schoodic Education Adventure residential program, an unsurpassed educational opportunity for children to learn about science and nature in Acadia National Park.

I also donate 10% of the profit back to the National Park Service for every photograph purchased from Acadia National Park.

So not only will your contribution help me produce this book - my dream - but together we can make a difference for our future generations!  

Ways You Can Help:

  • Pre-order books and receive some great perks like prints, critiques, your name in the book forever, and even your own private workshop in Acadia!
  • Share this campaign with your friends and family - see below for more information about our Referral Contest!

The Referral Contest:

To show my appreciation for your help, I'll award the person who refers the most amount of funders (# of people) with a FREE 16"x24" ready to hang metal print of the Bass Harbor Head Lighthouse.

To participate:

  1. Log in to your Indiegogo account you utilized to make your donation.
  2. Cut & paste the URL in the "Share This Campaign" section to share your the personalized link on your social media (e.g. Facebook, G+, LinkedIn, Twitter), email, and websites.
  3. Track your referrals - when someone clicks on your shared link and contributes to this campaign, they will appear in your referrals (under My Profile beneath your name when you login)

I'll share the top three contenders each week until the campaign closes to keep you informed of the status.

Contact Me/Learn More:

  • My email: cms@cms-photo.com
  • My photography website: www.cms-photo.com
  • Photographing Acadia National Park book website:www.photographingacadia.com
  • The book's backstory on my You Can Sleep When You're Dead blog
  • CMS Photography Facebook page
  • My first book, Wild in Arizona: Photographing Arizona's Wildflowers, A Guide to When, Where, and How

Thank you for your support!!

story:
ALREADY MADE A CONTRIBUTION?

Provide your shipping details HERE

 

 

 Code 10 Backpacks are fully waterproof, making them perfect for outdoor activities, commuting and travel. The roll-down design is fast and easy to use and prevents water from entering at the top of the backpack.

We've used a special TPU-Coated Fabric (PVC-free), which is 100% impenetrable to moisture. Rather than using a conventional stitching method, all seams on the bag are welded using a special high-frequency method, which makes the backpacks more durable and prevents any moisture leakage. 

 

We designed the Code 10 Backpack to be theft-proof. The roll down design prevents pickpockets from accessing the main compartment of the backpack, and can be locked if necessary. 

If you're leaving the backpack unattended, the bag itself can be secured to almost any fixed object using the integrated steel wire and combination lock, making it impossible for opportunistic thieves to access your belongings or steal the bag, without special cutting equipment. Perfect for when you want to leave your stuff and go for a swim at the beach!

Love it or loathe it, our tech products are now essential to our daily lives. We designed a removable tech sleeve that can accommodate all your daily tech products, so you can work anywhere! The tech sleeve uses Velcro to attach inside the backpack and is quick and easy to remove.

 

If you're carrying other heavy backpacks or suitcases and don't want to have our backpack on your back, our smart strap system allows you to convert the backpack into a messenger bag. The main straps can be hidden inside the back panel of the bag and replaced with the included shoulder strap. When the straps have been hidden, the backpack can also be attached to a suitcase.

Our main issue with regular waterproof bags? You can never find your things! We've included 4 outer pockets to help you store and access everything you need. The "secret" backpocket allows you to hide your valuables in the most secure place possible - between your bag and your body. The main front pocket is water resistant and great for storing your phone, wallet and cash when you're hiking. The card pocket on the front means no more searching around for your travel passes and the side bottle pocket is perfect for keeping you hydrated.

We also have two inner pockets (a big one for your cellphone/wallet) and a small one for you keys!
 

 

 

Code 10 was founded by Charlie + Chris, two product designers from the UK and Switzerland. We met whilst working in Hong Kong a city where your working life and the outdoors blend together. We both love to travel, surf and spend our time adventuring.

Why Waterproof?

With regular "Code 10" typhoons, Hong Kong can be a very rainy place - like many tropical places, it can go from sunshine to rain in a matter of seconds. 

Over the last few years we therefore found ourselves using waterproof bags a lot, especially if we knew we would be taking our laptops to a client meeting in the morning, then heading off to a beach or a hiking trail in the afternoon.

However, we found that most waterproof bags aren't designed to be functional for everyday use. Usually they don't have practical pockets and have no space for your tech products. Our first step was to design a waterproof bag that would be really useful, and perfectly suit our mixture of work and leisure, city life and travel. 

Why Lockable?  

Although Hong Kong is generally a safe place, it’s still a big city and there’s always the risk of pick-pocketing and petty theft. We therefore designed the pockets on the bag so that we could keep our valuables in an easy-to-reach position, but also completely out of reach of criminals.

Both of us had also experienced theft several times while travelling, especially when we were surfing and had left our belongings on the beach. It was really important to us that we could leave our bag almost anywhere and be confident that no opportunistic thieves could get inside our bag, or carry it away.

 

Shipping FAQs:

  • All products are shipped from Hong Kong.
  • Shipping will take approximately 3 days to Hong Kong, Taiwan, Japan, Singapore and Korea, 14 days to Europe, 20 days to the US and up to 30 days everywhere else. 
  • For most orders, we use Express services (DHL, FEDEX, USPS etc). For some countries, we use alternative shipping methods including local postal services.
  • Shipping only covers transportation charges and does not include import taxes / duties. These are the responsibility of the end customer. If these costs are requested by your country's customs and are not paid and your backpack is returned/destroyed, Code 10 will not issue a replacement product.
  • Please make sure to double check the email address recorded in your Indiegogo account. You can do this by going to Indiegogo > My Settings. We send all communication to this email address, so if your regular email address differs to your Indiegogo address, please let us know.

  • Please double-check the shipping information  you input at the time of purchase as we use this address to send your product to you. You can find the address you used on the receipt from Indiegogo at the time of purchase. Please note that any discrepancies between the address you provided and your actual address may mean you cannot receive your products.

  • All products will receive a tracking number.

 

CODE 10 PAYPAL DISCLAIMER:

We'll do our very best to send your perks and we're confident 100% of our backers will receive their backpacks. According to Paypal requirements, we have added the following disclaimer:

Delivery of rewards/perks is subject to best efforts and not guaranteed.

The roll-down design is fast and easy to use and prevents water from entering at the top of the backpack.We've used a special TPU-Coated Fabric (PVC-free), which is 100% impenetrable to moisture. Rather than using a conventional stitching method, all seams on the bag are welded using a special high-frequency method, which makes the backpacks more durable and prevents any moisture leakage.  We designed the Code 10 Backpack to be theft-proof. The roll down design prevents pickpockets from accessing the main compartment of the backpack, and can be locked if necessary. If you're leaving the backpack unattended, the bag itself can be secured to almost any fixed object using the integrated steel wire and combination lock, making it impossible for opportunistic thieves to access your belongings or steal the bag, without special cutting equipment. Perfect for when you want to leave your stuff and go for a swim at the beach!Love it or loathe it, our tech products are now essential to our daily lives. We designed a removable tech sleeve that can accommodate all your daily tech products, so you can work anywhere! The tech sleeve uses Velcro to attach inside the backpack and is quick and easy to remove. If you're carrying other heavy backpacks or suitcases and don't want to have our backpack on your back, our smart strap system allows you to convert the backpack into a messenger bag. The main straps can be hidden inside the back panel of the bag and replaced with the included shoulder strap. When the straps have been hidden, the backpack can also be attached to a suitcase.Our main issue with regular waterproof bags? You can never find your things! We've included 4 outer pockets to help you store and access everything you need. The "secret" backpocket allows you to hide your valuables in the most secure place possible - between your bag and your body. The main front pocket is water resistant and great for storing your phone, wallet and cash when you're hiking. The card pocket on the front means no more searching around for your travel passes and the side bottle pocket is perfect for keeping you hydrated.We also have two inner pockets (a big one for your cellphone/wallet) and a small one for you keys!  
We know we've got an ambitious timeline but due to our experience in production, we're very confident we can produce and deliver all backpacks to our backers in April 2017! Code 10 was founded by Charlie + Chris, two product designers from the UK and Switzerland. We met whilst working in Hong Kong a city where your working life and the outdoors blend together. We both love to travel, surf and spend our time adventuring.Why Waterproof?With regular "Code 10" typhoons, Hong Kong can be a very rainy place - like many tropical places, it can go from sunshine to rain in a matter of seconds. Over the last few years we therefore found ourselves using waterproof bags a lot, especially if we knew we would be taking our laptops to a client meeting in the morning, then heading off to a beach or a hiking trail in the afternoon.However, we found that most waterproof bags aren't designed to be functional for everyday use. Usually they don't have practical pockets and have no space for your tech products. Our first step was to design a waterproof bag that would be really useful, and perfectly suit our mixture of work and leisure, city life and travel. Why Lockable?  Although Hong Kong is generally a safe place, it’s still a big city and there’s always the risk of pick-pocketing and petty theft. We therefore designed the pockets on the bag so that we could keep our valuables in an easy-to-reach position, but also completely out of reach of criminals.Both of us had also experienced theft several times while travelling, especially when we were surfing and had left our belongings on the beach. It was really important to us that we could leave our bag almost anywhere and be confident that no opportunistic thieves could get inside our bag, or carry it away. 

 
Shipping FAQs:

All products are shipped from Hong Kong.
Shipping will take approximately 3 days to Hong Kong, Taiwan, Japan, Singapore and Korea, 14 days to Europe, 20 days to the US and up to 30 days everywhere else. 
For most orders, we use Express services (DHL, FEDEX, USPS etc). For some countries, we use alternative shipping methods including local postal services.
Shipping only covers transportation charges and does not include import taxes / duties. These are the responsibility of the end customer. If these costs are requested by your country's customs and are not paid and your backpack is returned/destroyed, Code 10 will not issue a replacement product.
Please make sure to double check the email address recorded in your Indiegogo account. You can do this by going to Indiegogo > My Settings. We send all communication to this email address, so if your regular email address differs to your Indiegogo address, please let us know.
Please double-check the shipping information  you input at the time of purchase as we use this address to send your product to you. You can find the address you used on the receipt from Indiegogo at the time of purchase. Please note that any discrepancies between the address you provided and your actual address may mean you cannot receive your products.
All products will receive a tracking number.



 
CODE 10 PAYPAL DISCLAIMER:
We'll do our very best to send your perks and we're confident 100% of our backers will receive their backpacks. According to Paypal requirements, we have added the following disclaimer:
Delivery of rewards/perks is subject to best efforts and not guaranteed.

story:
STANLEY Bike Rack + Roof Racks

The foundation of this product is a new patented and powerful vacuum mount that attaches anywhere on your vehicle's smooth glass or metal surfaces.

This becomes the incredibly strong fastening point for the tie-down straps that can secure any load. Then snap on the Bike Rack to transport a bicycle, wheelchair or stroller and the Roof Rack to carry an even greater diversity of cargo. Finally, for those over-sized loads, strap on the Soft Roof Pads to keep hauling.

 

The new inventions:

Attachment for the suction mounts. Holds one bike, wheelchair, stroller and much more

  • Includes neoprene pads and straps, so your car stays scratch-free
  • Little cars can now carry big bikes
  • Attaches to the STANLEY suction cup with one click
  • The 2x tie-down straps (2x 900 pound / 450 kg capacity) hold the bike through the tailgate
  • The 2x suction cups and bike rack attachment give protective distance between car and bike
 

How to mount the STANLEY Bike Rack Kit

 

​

  • Adjustable cam and strong metal buckles adjust for small to large items
  • Corrosion-resistant finish protects from rust and oxidation
  • Durable straps with foam pad won't scratch your car
  • Comes with convenient carrying bag and case
  • Attaches to any clean, smooth surface, including metal, glass, wood, and fiberglass
  • Includes a bag that doubles as a flag for carrying oversized cargo
  • Buckle cinches strap tightly with minimal effort
 

Wheelchair

Mounting and dismantling 
 

Uses:

 

Attachment for the Suction mounts.  Holds long items like skis, snowboards, lumber, fishing pole and much more

  • Includes rubber tie-down straps to keep items secure
  • Supports up to 150 pounds (75 kg)
  • Can be adapted to new configurations never seen before, such as the side of your vehicle
  • Also useful on boats, RVs, buildings and more

 

Snap attachments on and off with a locking device for security

Easily carry irregular loads, even on tiny cars

Attaches in seconds

 

Uses:

 

Safely and securely hold kayaks, skis, snowboards, surfboards, canoes, furniture, ladders, building materials, luggage and any other items that are too large for the inside of the vehicle

  • Comes with convenient storage case with handles
  • Lightweight yet powerfully strong foam pads dampen vibration and absorb shock
  • Soft yet strong materials protect your vehicle
  • Weatherproof exterior for hauling through heat, cold, rain, sleet and snow
  • 110-pound capacity per pad at 3.3 feet (1 m) long. (2 including)
  • Easy to set up and use when needed, yet stows conveniently for storage
  • Grips transporting items as they are tied down

How to use the Roof Pads

 

Uses:

 

Product Comparison

These issues with existing products are what inspired us to create the STANLEY roof rack kits

 

The foundational product included in every perk, the powerful Suction mounts and safety strap.

 

 

Camping

 

19-foot (6 meter) long x 1-inch wide cam-buckle lashing straps with neoprene padding secure the load with up to 900 pounds (450 kg) of pull during acceleration and braking

 

Tie Down Kit tailgate

 

Uses:

This STANLEY System has countless possibilities. And you can keep adding on to this solution.

 

Product Awards

 

Production Timeline

 

The Team

This new patented system was invented by a team led by Bryan Göddert, the founder and CEO of the American company: EasyStrap inc.  

EasyStrap inc. manufactures all products under license from Stanley, Black & Decker inc., the world famous brand for tools and home accessories. Together we are bringing the new STANLEY Bike Rack, Tie-down and Roof Rack system to you through Indiegogo.com.

STANLEY and the STANLEY logo are registered trademarks of Stanley, Black & Decker inc. or one of its affiliates and are used under license. 

Watch the Full Story

 

Progress and Delivery

Since 1843, Stanley has been a renowned international brand with a reputation for producing high-quality products. Today our new Stanley automotive accessories live up to this pedigree with a brand new line of products that stand up to Stanley's reputation for excellence. Our research teams work side-by-side with people out in the real world coming up with ways to help improve comfort and performance. This Indiegogo campaign is backed by experienced professionals and a company with established manufacturing lines, so we are highly confident we will be able to deliver your perks.

The Tie-down kit and Soft Roof Pads offered in this crowdfunding campaign are already in production and shipped to customers, so you will receive these within few months after the end of the campaign. The Roof Rack attachment is already produced and we have thousands of units in our warehouse ready to ship to you, so the first 4,000 orders will also be received within months after the end of the campaign. We are now moving the last remaining item (the Bike Rack) into the mass-production process (mould and tooling in December 2018) and we expect to ship these to you in March 2019.

    Products in this campaign are patented and protected.

story:
On June 6th, Nathaniel Edgar, a teacher who works with Firefly Music Lessons, was struck by a vehicle while riding his bike. Nathaniel escaped with his life but suffered a fractured pelvis.

Nathaniel is a great guy and a wonderful teacher. As a way of supporting and encouraging Nathaniel through this tough time, we have decided to raise funds to replace his destroyed bike.

Please consider supporting us with this campaign.  We have seeded the effort with $150 and will top up the fund to $500 so that we reach the goal.

Thanks so much!

James Ross

Firefly Music Lessons

fireflymusiclessons.com

story:
UPDATE: Siesta4 is sold out for summer 2018

If you're looking for a tent with incredible heat blocking performance you can still grab a new Siesta2, which will be shipping soon. Click here for details.


 

The Siesta4 Disco

Inspired by the festival community, we modified our heat reflective fabric to give a spectacular new look. The fly fabric looks silver in the shade, but when sunlight bounces off the tent it creates an awe-inspiring kaleidoscope of colors that changes with the angle of the light:

The performance and features of the Siesta4 Disco are identical to the original Siesta4 with aluminum poles, YKK zippers and premium materials throughout. Basically, we’ve just added rainbow sparkles! Check out this short video to see more of the Disco fabric:

The dazzling rainbow effect changes constantly with the light:

 

Our Story

Whether you spend your evening chatting by the campfire or dancing all night at a festival, being woken up at sunrise sucks! Less sleep means less energy to get the full potential from the rest of your day (or night), so we set out to improve the camping experience for everyone and make bright, overheating tents a thing of the past!

 
Featured in:

 

The Siesta4 is a four person tent, made from a specially developed lightweight, durable, waterproof fly fabric that reflects infrared, visible, and ultraviolet light. Compared to typical nylon and polyester tents, the Siesta4 is dramatically cooler and darker inside when in direct sun.

The photos above and below show the original Siesta4 Prototype.

 

The Siesta4 is the world’s first tent to feature ducted side vents, into which two ultra-quiet, 8 inch, USB-powered fans can be installed. The fans draw cooling fresh air directly into the inner tent through a special fabric duct that connects the inner tent to the fly. 

 

Sure, the Siesta4 beats any other tent hands down in hot weather, but what about rain, wind and cold? Well, the full length fly and closable mesh give excellent protection when the weather turns nasty. Far better protection, in fact, than a 3-season tent. We'll even go so far as to claim the Siesta4 is the most versatile tent ever made!

In terms of wind resistance, aluminium poles, full length pole sleeves and plenty of guy rope attachment points give you best-in-class performance.  In response to early feedback, we've already decided to add even more guy rope attachments to the production model to help in very strong winds.

A common problem with tents when the temperature drops is condensation. We've got that covered too! The inner tent is made from breathable polyester fabric, which combined with excellent airflow under the fly makes the Siesta4 extremely condensation-resistant.

 

Waking up in the Siesta4 is more like waking up at home with the blinds/curtains closed than waking up in a tent. Unless you set your alarm, chances are you’ll carry on sleeping until you wake up naturally.

Basically, you won’t be woken up by bright light, and you won’t feel a burst of heat when the sun hits your tent. It's comparable to pitching a regular tent in complete shade, such as under a large tree… only it’s darker inside, and you don’t need to find a tree or move your tent when the angle of the sun changes!

 

What's the temperature like?

This chart compares the air temperature inside the Siesta4 to a tent made from regular tent fabric. This data was recorded on a typical summer morning in Spain. As a general rule in any climate, the temperature inside the Siesta4 remains relatively close to the temperature of the (ambient) air outside the tent. We've also marked on the chart the time at which one fan was turned on. As you can see, the Siesta4 is dramatically cooler than a regular tent even without a fan running. In this example the doors were closed so you can see how the fan helps keeps the temperature down when the tent is nice and dark inside.

By contrast, the air inside a normal tent gets extremely hot. In reality you’d be much hotter than the air temperature indicates because this doesn't account for the additional heat you feel as a result of infrared radiation. Infrared energy doesn't heat the air - it’s only converted into heat when it’s absorbed by your skin (or your tent).
 

How dark is it?

A small amount of light comes in through the 4" gap around the bottom of the fly.  This isn't enough to wake you up, but it's enough to be able to find your way around the tent. If you want more light you can simply open the doors of the fly.  It's more of a dim glow that's diffused by the wall of the inner tent.

To accurately demonstrate the difference between fabrics, we made an identical tent out of standard tent polyester. These two photos are taken using the exact same camera settings.

 

The Siesta4 is a double-walled design. The inner tent is made from breathable polyester fabric (210T ripstop taffeta), and has two huge double doors with full mesh panels. There are two circular side vents with zips to attach the fans, and there are also two smaller mesh vents in the roof of the tent.  All the mesh panels can be zipped closed, so the inner tent can be fully protected against wind-borne sand and dust.

Having two doors means both ends of the tent can be opened up for great cross-flow of air, giving the best possible ventilation. Opening up all the doors also turns the tent into a great hang-out space if you need a break from the heat during the day! 

In crowded campsites, such as festivals, the tent can be easily pitched without guy ropes. Just stake out the corners and vestibules. Of course, we advise you to add extra stakes and guy ropes if it’s likely to be very windy.

Only four poles and a familiar dome style design means the intuitive setup is quick and easy. The inner tent can be left clipped in, so everything can be pitched in one go.

Other features include:

  • High quality aluminium poles for strength and durability
  • Full length pole sleeves for additional structural stability
  • 2 vestibules give loads of storage space for bags, cooler etc.
  • Adjustable fly door positions (using toggles on the inside) make it easy to increase ventilation without letting in too much light
  • High-sided, heavy-duty, waterproof floor
  • Top quality YKK zippers
  • Central lantern loop
  • 16 additional hanging loops
  • 6 mesh storage pockets
  • Power cord access zippers
  • Reflective guy ropes
  • 16 x Super-strong 8" aluminum stakes

 

We spent many months developing our unique, ultra-reflective fly fabric. The base fabric is 210T polyester taffeta cloth, the same as is used to make other high quality tents. The difference is that ours undergoes a special process that applies a reflective coating on one side, and a polyurethane coating on the other. Both coatings are waterproof, and the seams are sealed at the factory with industry standard PU seam tape. This also means you can repair the fly with a standard tent repair kit should any accidental damage occur (always apply the repair patch to the underside of the fly, not the reflective side).

To demonstrate how reflective our fly fabric is, here’s a comparison with some other materials using an infrared thermal camera. This image shows several different fabrics, placed on a hotplate:

 

The dark colour is due to aluminium cooking foil and our fabric both having low emissivity (they don’t radiate much heat), which shows that they are also excellent heat reflectors. In contrast, normal polyester tent fabric absorbs and radiates heat very well, which is why it’s almost the same colour as the hotplate itself.

You can see an even more dramatic effect when the whole tent is viewed by a thermal camera on hot sunny day:

 

 

In a camping world first, we have designed a ducted vent system that keeps out heat and light, whilst allowing fresh air in from outside. A fabric air duct connects an opening in the inner tent to the vent on the fly, and the outer end of the duct has insect mesh so bugs can’t use you as a tasty treat.

 

Inside the tent the vent opening can be left uncovered for natural ventilation, or one of our custom fans can be zipped in. The duct can be left in place when the tent is rolled up, but the fan(s) have to be removed and packed separately. 
 

The fan(s) can be run from any 2A USB power source. Power consumption is very low so battery life isn't a problem . The fans are supplied with a 2-speed USB power adapter. This allows 'eco' mode for extended battery life or 'max' mode of maximum cooling.

We recommend portable rechargeable power banks like the ones used to charge cell phones and tablets, and/or solar charging kits. 

For most camping trips (less than a week), a portable battery (USB power bank) can run the fan for a few hours each day without needing to be recharged. We evaluated the options for supplying our own portable battery packs, but we can’t currently compete with the prices you can find online from Amazon, eBay etc. Therefore we've created a table to give you an idea of what size battery to buy. 

We recommend buying from a reputable brand (check the online reviews) as not all battery packs provide as much real world capacity as the suppliers claim. If in doubt buy a slightly larger capacity pack than you think you'll need. If you want to run two fans, simply double the capacity. Also look for a model that has a 2A or higher output capacity.

If you wish to use the same battery pack to charge your cell phone or other devices while camping, don’t forget to add extra capacity for those devices as well.

 

As an example, with one fan a 20,000mah power bank should last most people for a week of camping without needing to be recharged. For more examples, search ‘usb power bank’ on your favourite online shopping site.

 

What about solar?

A solar panel with 5v USB or 12v output is a great option for powering the fan(s), especially in hotter climates.  You can leave it connected overnight and the fans will start as soon as the sun hits the panel in the morning. Furthermore, you can leave the fans running during the day so the tent remains at a lower temperature in case you fancy a nap at any time.

For a single fan we recommend 8-16W panels. If you want to run two fans from a single solar panel a 20W or higher panel is recommended.

Solar panels can be a little more expensive than USB power banks so for shorter trips, a USB power bank that can last the duration of the trip may be a more economical option. Please feel free to email us if you’d like advice about which is the best option for your particular type of usage.

 

 

 

All shipping will be from our Los Angeles warehouse. All free shipping and $29 flat-rate shipping options are for the contiguous 48 states. For other areas please contact us for a quote.

We're happy ship internationally, but please consider customs duty and any applicable taxes that you may have to pay. Please contact us for a quote.

 

Outback Logic LLC is a US company founded by a team of entrepreneurs from Australia, America, and England, who got together to bring Gareth’s idea for a heat-reflective, light-blocking tent to life. We’re a multidisciplinary bunch with a wealth of commercial experience. We partnered with leading fabric, tent, and specialist coating manufacturers to develop a world-class product and make the Siesta4 a reality.

Gareth originally had the idea while camping at a festival in the Australian outback. Having camped in a number of warm climates, including Australia, Southern Europe, California, and Nevada, he realised there was huge potential for a heat-reflective tent, and undertook extensive research, design and development to prove the concept and ensure commercial viability.

 

Why are we here?

The manufacture of tents at a competitive price is only possible at volume, especially as we’re also producing our own custom fabric, which is more complicated and more expensive than typical tent fabrics. We use a crowdfunded business model to help cover the upfront manufacturing costs and more accurately determine what quantities of tents and fans to produce.

 

Risks & Challenges

Since our Kickstarter in November 2015 we’ve completed all tooling and development, and produced four production runs of tents. During this time, we’ve refined our production processes and further strengthened our supply chain. All manufacturing carries some risks, but with the experience we’ve gained over the past two years we can be very confident of another smooth production run and timely delivery.

We've seen how frustrating it can be for backers when project owners are not open and transparent about delays or problems. We promise to post regular updates and in the unlikely event of any problems we'll let everyone know exactly what's going on and how we're going to fix it.
story_txt:

How dark is it?
A small amount of light comes in through the 4" gap around the bottom of the fly.  This isn't enough to wake you up, but it's enough to be able to find your way around the tent. If you want more light you can simply open the doors of the fly.  It's more of a dim glow that's diffused by the wall of the inner tent.To accurately demonstrate the difference between fabrics, we made an identical tent out of standard tent polyester. These two photos are taken using the exact same camera settings.



 
The Siesta4 is a double-walled design. The inner tent is made from breathable polyester fabric (210T ripstop taffeta), and has two huge double doors with full mesh panels. There are two circular side vents with zips to attach the fans, and there are also two smaller mesh vents in the roof of the tent.  All the mesh panels can be zipped closed, so the inner tent can be fully protected against wind-borne sand and dust.
Having two doors means both ends of the tent can be opened up for great cross-flow of air, giving the best possible ventilation. Opening up all the doors also turns the tent into a great hang-out space if you need a break from the heat during the day! 
In crowded campsites, such as festivals, the tent can be easily pitched without guy ropes. Just stake out the corners and vestibules. Of course, we advise you to add extra stakes and guy ropes if it’s likely to be very windy.
Only four poles and a familiar dome style design means the intuitive setup is quick and easy. The inner tent can be left clipped in, so everything can be pitched in one go.
Other features include:

High quality aluminium poles for strength and durability
Full length pole sleeves for additional structural stability
2 vestibules give loads of storage space for bags, cooler etc.
Adjustable fly door positions (using toggles on the inside) make it easy to increase ventilation without letting in too much light
High-sided, heavy-duty, waterproof floor
Top quality YKK zippers
Central lantern loop
16 additional hanging loops
6 mesh storage pockets
Power cord access zippers
Reflective guy ropes
16 x Super-strong 8" aluminum stakes


 


We spent many months developing our unique, ultra-reflective fly fabric. The base fabric is 210T polyester taffeta cloth, the same as is used to make other high quality tents. The difference is that ours undergoes a special process that applies a reflective coating on one side, and a polyurethane coating on the other. Both coatings are waterproof, and the seams are sealed at the factory with industry standard PU seam tape. This also means you can repair the fly with a standard tent repair kit should any accidental damage occur (always apply the repair patch to the underside of the fly, not the reflective side).
To demonstrate how reflective our fly fabric is, here’s a comparison with some other materials using an infrared thermal camera. This image shows several different fabrics, placed on a hotplate:
 

The dark colour is due to aluminium cooking foil and our fabric both having low emissivity (they don’t radiate much heat), which shows that they are also excellent heat reflectors. In contrast, normal polyester tent fabric absorbs and radiates heat very well, which is why it’s almost the same colour as the hotplate itself.
You can see an even more dramatic effect when the whole tent is viewed by a thermal camera on hot sunny day:
 

 
In a camping world first, we have designed a ducted vent system that keeps out heat and light, whilst allowing fresh air in from outside. A fabric air duct connects an opening in the inner tent to the vent on the fly, and the outer end of the duct has insect mesh so bugs can’t use you as a tasty treat.

 Inside the tent the vent opening can be left uncovered for natural ventilation, or one of our custom fans can be zipped in. The duct can be left in place when the tent is rolled up, but the fan(s) have to be removed and packed separately.  
The fan(s) can be run from any 2A USB power source. Power consumption is very low so battery life isn't a problem . The fans are supplied with a 2-speed USB power adapter. This allows 'eco' mode for extended battery life or 'max' mode of maximum cooling.We recommend portable rechargeable power banks like the ones used to charge cell phones and tablets, and/or solar charging kits. 

For most camping trips (less than a week), a portable battery (USB power bank) can run the fan for a few hours each day without needing to be recharged. We evaluated the options for supplying our own portable battery packs, but we can’t currently compete with the prices you can find online from Amazon, eBay etc. Therefore we've created a table to give you an idea of what size battery to buy. 
We recommend buying from a reputable brand (check the online reviews) as not all battery packs provide as much real world capacity as the suppliers claim. If in doubt buy a slightly larger capacity pack than you think you'll need. If you want to run two fans, simply double the capacity. Also look for a model that has a 2A or higher output capacity.
If you wish to use the same battery pack to charge your cell phone or other devices while camping, don’t forget to add extra capacity for those devices as well.
 

As an example, with one fan a 20,000mah power bank should last most people for a week of camping without needing to be recharged. For more examples, search ‘usb power bank’ on your favourite online shopping site.
 
What about solar?A solar panel with 5v USB or 12v output is a great option for powering the fan(s), especially in hotter climates.  You can leave it connected overnight and the fans will start as soon as the sun hits the panel in the morning. Furthermore, you can leave the fans running during the day so the tent remains at a lower temperature in case you fancy a nap at any time.For a single fan we recommend 8-16W panels. If you want to run two fans from a single solar panel a 20W or higher panel is recommended.Solar panels can be a little more expensive than USB power banks so for shorter trips, a USB power bank that can last the duration of the trip may be a more economical option. Please feel free to email us if you’d like advice about which is the best option for your particular type of usage. 


  

All shipping will be from our Los Angeles warehouse. All free shipping and $29 flat-rate shipping options are for the contiguous 48 states. For other areas please contact us for a quote.
We're happy ship internationally, but please consider customs duty and any applicable taxes that you may have to pay. Please contact us for a quote.
 

Outback Logic LLC is a US company founded by a team of entrepreneurs from Australia, America, and England, who got together to bring Gareth’s idea for a heat-reflective, light-blocking tent to life. We’re a multidisciplinary bunch with a wealth of commercial experience. We partnered with leading fabric, tent, and specialist coating manufacturers to develop a world-class product and make the Siesta4 a reality.
Gareth originally had the idea while camping at a festival in the Australian outback. Having camped in a number of warm climates, including Australia, Southern Europe, California, and Nevada, he realised there was huge potential for a heat-reflective tent, and undertook extensive research, design and development to prove the concept and ensure commercial viability.
 
Why are we here?
The manufacture of tents at a competitive price is only possible at volume, especially as we’re also producing our own custom fabric, which is more complicated and more expensive than typical tent fabrics. We use a crowdfunded business model to help cover the upfront manufacturing costs and more accurately determine what quantities of tents and fans to produce.
 
Risks & Challenges
Since our Kickstarter in November 2015 we’ve completed all tooling and development, and produced four production runs of tents. During this time, we’ve refined our production processes and further strengthened our supply chain. All manufacturing carries some risks, but with the experience we’ve gained over the past two years we can be very confident of another smooth production run and timely delivery.
We've seen how frustrating it can be for backers when project owners are not open and transparent about delays or problems. We promise to post regular updates and in the unlikely event of any problems we'll let everyone know exactly what's going on and how we're going to fix it.

story:
Made for climbers who are proud to “Climb MN”.

If you climb here, you get it. Minnesota may not receive the same attention as the alpine wonderlands of Colorado or the granite-filled valleys of California, but gosh darn it, it’s home and it ought to be celebrated. Minnesota has some truly spectacular climbing, and we’re proud to call it home.

The “Climb MN” tee was inspired by a fierce love for local Minnesota climbing. Designed by local climber Kyle Ellefson, we created it because we wanted a way to share how much we cared about climbing in our home state and help others do the same. 
 


 

Good causes + good gear

5% of profits go to Ardent Alpinists, a MN non-profit that introduces veterans to climbing.  So when you get our gear, you're spreading good vibes all around. 
 


 

Super comfy. Rad design. 

Nothing complicated, just a super soft and comfortable tri-blend tee. And a design by Granite Creek Climbing Collective that lets you share your stoke for MN climbing...

  • Unisex design
  • 50% poly, 25% cotton, 25% rayon
  • No sweatshops
  • Super comfy triblend

 

Size chart (from t-shirt manufacturer Bella + Canvas):

 




 

Why Granite Creek?

Granite Creek started with a simple love for climbing and the outdoors. That quickly grew into a thirst for exploring all the rock in our home state, and Minnesota climbing soon won a bold place in our hearts.

We started Granite Creek Climbing Collective for two big reasons:

1. Share a love for local climbing and help others do the same.

2. Use apparel to help support local climbing areas and the climbing community that we love. The long-term vision is to help protect and conserve local climbing areas and support the community with each piece of Granite Creek gear purchased. Part of our profits go to local organizations that do those two things.

Granite Creek Climbing Collective was started by two MN natives, Kyle Ellefson and Conner Kranz.

As climbers, we wanted to share our love for local rock. Our designs and apparel are a small reminder of climbing in our home state and why it’s so important to us.


 

Keep the stoke high

We're doing a limited run of these t's. Like warm fall days, they won't last long. Get it while ya still can!
