Andrii is involved in a variety of cultural, social and entrepreneurial projects, primarily in publishing and nature protection.Андрій Божок народився в Українці, лише за кілька кілометрів від Витачева. Він мріяв створити місце для усамітнення та відпочинку з неймовірним краєвидом на Дніпро з часу першого візиту до Витачева понад десять років тому. Андрій залучений у різноманітні культурні, соціальні та підприємницькі проекти, переважно видавничі та спрямовані на захист довкілля.ДЯКУЄМО, ЩО ПРИЄДНАЛИСЯ, ПРОФІНАНСУВАЛИ І / АБО ПОДІЛИЛИСЯ В СОЦІАЛЬНИХ МЕДІА НАШОЮ МРІЄЮ ПРО ІДЕАЛЬНИЙ МАЛЕНЬКИЙ БУДИНОК З ВИДОМ НА ДНІПРО.THANK YOU FOR JOINING, FUNDING AND/OR SHARING OUR DREAM OF THE RIVERBIRD’S NEST OVERLOOKING THE DNIPRO RIVERFOR YOU, ME AND EVERYONE WHO SEEKS FREEDOM.
Візуалізація нашого майбутнього будинку в його оригінальному розташуванні. P.S. Interested in watching our first crowdfunding campaign?https://igg.me/at/1UutXrcd5io/x/6221634#/

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Devyn Sivers and my boyfriends name is Scott Conrade. We are both college students at Mansfield University. I guess you could say we like to dream big. College for both of us was a chance to achieve anything we wanted to and make dreams a reality. Our idea started off as just a biking trip across the United States. We soon discovered an organization that allowed us to do just that only it gave us a purpose; to raise money for MS. We both know people affected by this disease and our dream soon became a passion. We know it's a big feat and will require lots of support and planning. That's where you come in. Every little bit you contribute will get us one step closer to achieving our dream.

What We Need & What You Get

The organization we are doing this adventure through is called Bike the US for MS. They raise money for research on MS. Their goal is to combine an amazing experience with an important cause. Our minimum fundraising is $1000 however we would like to exceed that goal not only to give towards MS but to help us along in our journey. We know we will have emotional and physical support through our adventure but a little financial support is always needed. 

The Impact

Where is your money going?

90% of the funds we raise will go directly to Bike the US for MS where it will be used for research on MS and home modifications for those who suffer from MS.

10% of the funds we raise will go towards our trip across the US. The money will be used for things such as food, water, emergency repairs, and the trip home. 

If our bike trip does not end up looking like a feasible thing to accomplish 100% of the money we raise  will go directly to  MS!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everybody is able to contribute at this point in time but have no fear you can still contribute and make a difference.

We will be holding more fundraisers you can contribute to.

You can share our link and help spread the word about our campaign!

Lastly you can use Indiegogo's share tools to make some noise about our campaign too!

Any way that you can and are willing to contribute is greatly appreciated. Thank you so much!

story:
"It's hot and I'm cranky!"   That's right - my name is Crankie, and I live in St. Petersburg, Florida.

I'm putting together a bike, that's really a trike, to pedal my wares - chillin' smoothies, lemonade, and iced tea - to the sidewalks, parks and waterfront vistas of our beautiful city. 

The smoothie bike is fully self-contained, uses all reCYCLEd and reCYCLE-able products, makes refreshing drinks from locally grown chem-free produce, and is pedaled by Crankie herself.  Crankie will finally be off the street, and behind bars (handlebars, that is). 


After many years in a corporate job, and many more years of random cycling around town, Crankie has decided to make a change - a REVOLUTION!  Bikes and trikes have so much more to offer us than an enjoyable ride around the neighborhood or an all out group ride on Saturday with the bike club. Bicycles are an affordable and practical mode of transport, they bring families, neighborhoods and communities together, and present monetary savings galore.  All this without even the mention of the reduction in parking hassles and carbon emissions!  Crankie wants to show her community all of this and more - it begins with one smoothie bike.  

Crankie has enlisted the help of some friends and a couple experts to put together the smoothie bike, and is looking to you for some financial help. The bike and cart will cost $7,200, and the supplies and equipment (purchased from local manufacturers) will cost about $950. Fees for the license, certifications, insurance, and permits will cost $1,650.  With your generous contribution, the smoothie bike will become reality.


Together we can awaken our communities to the huge, positive impact that can be made by incorporating more bikes and trikes into our everyday lives. We can show that bicycles truly have a much bigger part to play in our world, and that the REVOLUTION is happening now.

 

Crankie knows that not everyone can contribute financially - so here are some other BIG ways you can help -

     1. "Like" this campaign - click on the Like button above

     2. "Tell" your friends about this campaign

     3. "Share" this campaign on your Facebook page

     4. "Tweet" about Crankies and this campaign

     5. "Promote" and "Support" bicycling any way you can in your part of the world

 

 

"Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep
your balance, you must keep moving." ~ Albert Einstein

___________________________________________________________________

Crankies has joined One Percent for the Planet whose mission is to build, support and activate an alliance of businesses financially committed to creating a healthy planet.

story:
Hello My name is Rory Duckworth. For the last few years, I have been addicted to anything involving running, biking, or swimming. Yeah, I am one of those crazy guys on the side of the road or swimming in the middle of the lake!

On September 21-22nd, I will be racing the 2012 Salt to Saint solo bike race (422 miles). The race has 24 sections, each of which I will be dedicating to what I call a "Fighter". This could be a person or organization. My goal is to bring more awareness to the person or organization. All the funds I receive will be donated to a great organization called Peaches Neat Feet. Their mission is simple: to "hand paint personally customized canvas shoes to lift the 'soles' of children fighting cancer and other life threatening illnesses and lifelong disabilities, to share passion for art and desire to pay it forward." https://www.facebook.com/PeachsNeetFeet?ref=ts#!/PeachsNeetFeet/info

Your contribution will bring many smiles to kids fighting for their lives. This is important to me because I feel I have an obligation being that I have the time and resources to make this world just a little better.

What We Need & What You Get

I need $500 to give to Peaches Neet Feet. You or your business will be able to sponser a leg of the race (24 legs total) or purchase other "perks" associated with my race day. 

Regardless of the amount given, you will have special access to the "Salt To Saint: Solo Rory Duckworth" YouTube video before it is made public.

When you purchase a leg you get 1) A video shout out with link to any website. If you choose, you can remain anonymous. 2)Each leg will have a unique story about one of the Peache's Neet feet fighters or another great organization. You will be forever linked to this great organization or person. 3) Signed picture from yours truly with me holding my bike in the air at the finish line.

All legs can be seen here: http://salttosaint.com/am-i-set/leg-breakdown/

Perk 1: Leg 1-24

Leg 1- Brynn Barton "Brynn Strong Live to Inspire" & Bows for Brenda

Leg 2- Push to the Finish

Leg 3- The Random Acts of Kindness foundation

Leg 4- Cameron 

Leg 5- Values.com

Leg 6- Awareness for Aubri

Leg 7- Team KK 

Leg 8- Colin's Crew 

Leg 9- Hope for Johnathon 

Leg 10- Pay it Forward Experience

Leg 11- Prayers for Lane Goodwin

Leg 12- The Daniel Fountain Fund

Leg 13- The Kindness Mission

Leg 14- John Cancer Slayer Austin

Leg 15- The Rotary Foundation

Leg 16- Keegan

Leg 17- Team Jaxon- Frog

Leg 18- March of Dimes

Leg 19- Caleb Blaise

Leg 20- Gary

Leg 21- Challenged Athletes Foundation

Leg 22- Alex's Lemonade Stand

Leg 23- Daniel the Brave

Leg 24- Peach's Neet Feet

Perk 2: 10 push-ups at finish line (Availble 5 for a total of 50)

1 Dedicated to Jacob “The Leukemia Slayer” Goeders

2 Dedicated to Angels for Adam

Perk 3: 20 push-ups at finish line (Availble 5 for a total of 100)

Wow..150 pushups after that ride!

Perk 4: 6 legs of the race riding in a Jersey of your choice i.e. Business sponsors. The jersey will need to be provided due to timing constraints. Or I can attach something to my jersey.

The “6 legs riding in a Jersey” perk SOLD OUT!!!

I will be wearing a jersey for:

The Epilepsy Association of Utah (Purple)
Challenged Athletes Foundation
The Ethan Jostad Foundation 
Team Jaxon- Frog (Yellow)

Perk 5: Three Video spotlights. (Short commercials)

All donations will go to Peaches Neet feet.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate money you can always help by spreading the word about Peache's Neet Feet. Go like their Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/#!/PeachsNeetFeet

story:
Pour la version en français, cliquez ici.

 

Hi,

My name is Ari Tapiero, I am a photographer in Ottawa, Canada; my heart and soul is in documentary work, specifically portraits. I work with large format film cameras, 4x5 and 8x10, to get the look and detail I need.

I've been a photographer for 15 years; I've had a few exhibits, notably a solo show in Montreal, where I also produced a book to accompany the exhibit. I've also photographed a coffee-table book about the city of Ottawa.

I've been working on The Last Jews of Eastern Hungary for six months now, and I hope to return to Hungary this summer to continue work, as well as expand upon it.

My Goal

For The Last Jews of Eastern Hungary, I will produce portraits of individuals or groups who are relevant to the story I am trying to tell.

I will also record videotaped interviews with each person, asking them to recount various aspects of their lives within the context of the Jewish community of their childhood, the Holocaust, and their thoughts about their childrens' futures.

My short-term goal is to complete the photography and interviews this summer in eastern Hungary.

My ultimate, long-term goal is to produce a once-in-a-lifetime book; a beautiful, grand photo book of wonderful portraits and incredible stories, one that will ultimately serve as testament and memory to these people and places.

This will be part one of the series: the Jewish communities of eastern Hungary.

Parts two and three will be devoted to the Jewish communities of western Ukraine and northern Romania, respectively, and photography on those will begin in 2014.

 

Why It Matters

 There are sizable, stable and growing Jewish populations in much of western Europe; but what about the east, where the Holocaust claimed the majority of its victims? What happened to the survivors and their descendants in Hungary, Ukraine, or Romania?

 I got a small glimpse when I was in Miskolc, Hungary in 2010. My wife is from the town, and our daughter was born there in the summer of 2010. I found an aging, withered, but defiant, tiny Jewish community. They had heard the war stories of their parents, and still feared for their children's future, so they did not continue in their religious traditions. Their children, grown fearful of religious reprisals, have largely gone overseas or married out-of-the-faith, and are thus unable or unwilling to make a Jewish community for themselves and their own children. The resulting sense of finality hangs heavily over this community, as their congregation slowly dies off.

 There are other places like Miskolc in eastern Hungary, Ukraine and Romania, and I feel it important to document their existence as a kind of living museum; most of these communities will have disappeared in the next 20-30 years. The small-town eastern European Jewish community, once the backbone of a continent, is on the verge of natural extinction; eventually, only memories and recorded materials will tell us that they existed at all.

 It is of vital importance to me to be able to give a sense of what people are (and were) like and how they live as individuals and as a community, in order to preserve that memory for future generations. In essence, this is what being a photographer means to me, and it is both a great responsibility and a great honour.
 

I have completed an exploratory version of the project, you can see it here: 

http://www.aritapiero.com/the-last-jews-of-miskolc.html

 

Funding & Why I Need It

 I funded the first part of the project myself, because it was all in the same town, and no travel expenses were necessary. I worked with only eleven subjects, so the first part was relatively easy to do by myself.

 I am now looking for outside funding so as to complete the portrait project in eastern Hungary, a much larger region, requiring more time and research. 

 The money will go to exactly what you see listed here. We will travel through eastern Hungary by car (we have a two-year old), so some of the budget is given over to gasoline.

I am asking for $3600 to complete the project in Miskolc and other towns or villages in eastern Hungary. This breaks down as follows:

return airfare - $1250

film and processing - $900 (250 sheets of 4x5 colour negative film +  chemicals)

travel expenses - $350 (gas for the car in Hungary)

scanning services - $700

printing - $400 (sponsor gifts, and a print for each participant)

 I do all of my own shooting, photo-editing and printing. I do not use an assistant nor do I require funds for room and board. My wife, Zsuzsanna, will be both facilitator and translator. I do not need to buy equipment, just materials.

 I expect that this would take about 6-8 weeks of shooting to complete, and 2-3 more months of post-production once we return to Canada.

 Should I raise more than my goal, the extra funds will go toward post-production, i.e., scanning, printing, or printing a small version of an eventually larger-scale book.

 If I don't reach my goal of $3600, I will likely try and get this done anyway, albeit on a smaller scale and over a longer period of time.

 I hope to build momentum with this project, so that I could eventually continue to research and document similarly-affected communities in eastern Europe.

 The end result will be a comprehensive book of large format portraits, with accompanying text, on the entire project, with separate sections devoted to each region (Hungary, Ukraine, Romania).

 

Transparency

Every single dollar contributed goes towards the completion of the project.

As a contributor you want to know where your money is going, and that it is all going to the project.

Therefore, if you wished, I could arrange for you to see the income/expenditure of all contributions.

 
 
What You Can Do
 
 Please see the work I have done until now, http://www.aritapiero.com/the-last-jews-of-miskolc.html , and help us get closer to realizing this project by making a donation and passing this page along to others.

 You can use the simple share tools, just under the video at the top, to make it a quick and easy process by email, Facebook, Twitter and other options. 

 

Donating/Contributing

You can donate any amount you wish, even one dollar; it is entirely up to you.

Even though the donations are shown in US dollars it is just as easy to make donations from Canada or any other country using Paypal or directly with your debit or credit card.

If you want to use Paypal you can pay as a 'guest' on Paypal so there is no need to have or open an account with them.

Simply follow the 'Contribute Now' steps to make your donation, and during the Paypal payment process you will see the amount in your own currency so you know exactly how much you are donating.

If you can't donate, a word of support or encouragement is greatly appreciated.
 
 
 
Thank you so much for your interest in this project and I do hope that, like me, you can see why this is a valuable and important project that deserves to be completed.
 
Thank you,
Ari Tapiero 
 
                                         ***          ***                
 

FAQ For Contributors, as supplied by the kind people at IndieGoGo

How much information do I share when making a contribution? 

You can make an anonymous contribution. Only the person running the campaign and campaign editors can view your name and contribution details. You may need to enter your mailing address if you redeem a perk or for your payment via credit card. 

What happens after I contribute to a campaign?

The person running the campaign will contact you regarding updates to the campaign and how to fulfill your perk. You will also receive a confirmation email. 

Are contributions final?

Yes. 

I want to start receiving a campaign's updates before I fund it, how do I do that? 

Go to the campaign, and in the share tool box click on the heart icon. This will add the campaign to your favorites and you will automatically receive updates. 

Where does the money go if the funding goal isn't reached?

Campaign owners keep all the money they raise, even if their goal isn't reached. Their funding plan is likely outlined on their campaign profile. If you are unclear how funds will be used, you can contact the campaign administrator directly by sending a private comment via the Comments tab on their campaign page. 

I don't want to contribute to a campaign using PayPal, but it's the only option I am given. Can I still contribute?

Yes. You can pay with your credit card as a Guest on PayPal (no PayPal account required!). After you click "Contribute" on the campaign, you'll be taken to a PayPal screen. At the top, you will see "Choose a Way To Pay." Click on "Pay with a credit or debit card." Uncheck the box that says "Save this information with a PayPal account. It's easy and free to sign up. Learn more about PayPal." Then proceed to pay as Guest with your credit card.

The resulting sense of finality hangs heavily over this community, as their congregation slowly dies off.
 There are other places like Miskolc in eastern Hungary, Ukraine and Romania, and I feel it important to document their existence as a kind of living museum; most of these communities will have disappeared in the next 20-30 years. The small-town eastern European Jewish community, once the backbone of a continent, is on the verge of natural extinction; eventually, only memories and recorded materials will tell us that they existed at all.
 It is of vital importance to me to be able to give a sense of what people are (and were) like and how they live as individuals and as a community, in order to preserve that memory for future generations. In essence, this is what being a photographer means to me, and it is both a great responsibility and a great honour.
 
I have completed an exploratory version of the project, you can see it here: 
http://www.aritapiero.com/the-last-jews-of-miskolc.html
 
Funding & Why I Need It
 I funded the first part of the project myself, because it was all in the same town, and no travel expenses were necessary. I worked with only eleven subjects, so the first part was relatively easy to do by myself.
 I am now looking for outside funding so as to complete the portrait project in eastern Hungary, a much larger region, requiring more time and research. 
 The money will go to exactly what you see listed here. We will travel through eastern Hungary by car (we have a two-year old), so some of the budget is given over to gasoline.
I am asking for $3600 to complete the project in Miskolc and other towns or villages in eastern Hungary. This breaks down as follows:
return airfare - $1250
film and processing - $900 (250 sheets of 4x5 colour negative film +  chemicals)
travel expenses - $350 (gas for the car in Hungary)
scanning services - $700
printing - $400 (sponsor gifts, and a print for each participant)
 I do all of my own shooting, photo-editing and printing. I do not use an assistant nor do I require funds for room and board. My wife, Zsuzsanna, will be both facilitator and translator. I do not need to buy equipment, just materials.
 I expect that this would take about 6-8 weeks of shooting to complete, and 2-3 more months of post-production once we return to Canada.
 Should I raise more than my goal, the extra funds will go toward post-production, i.e., scanning, printing, or printing a small version of an eventually larger-scale book.
 If I don't reach my goal of $3600, I will likely try and get this done anyway, albeit on a smaller scale and over a longer period of time.
 I hope to build momentum with this project, so that I could eventually continue to research and document similarly-affected communities in eastern Europe.
 The end result will be a comprehensive book of large format portraits, with accompanying text, on the entire project, with separate sections devoted to each region (Hungary, Ukraine, Romania).
 
Transparency
Every single dollar contributed goes towards the completion of the project.
As a contributor you want to know where your money is going, and that it is all going to the project.
Therefore, if you wished, I could arrange for you to see the income/expenditure of all contributions.

 
 
What You Can Do
 
 Please see the work I have done until now, http://www.aritapiero.com/the-last-jews-of-miskolc.html , and help us get closer to realizing this project by making a donation and passing this page along to others.

 You can use the simple share tools, just under the video at the top, to make it a quick and easy process by email, Facebook, Twitter and other options. 
 


Donating/Contributing
You can donate any amount you wish, even one dollar; it is entirely up to you.
Even though the donations are shown in US dollars it is just as easy to make donations from Canada or any other country using Paypal or directly with your debit or credit card.
If you want to use Paypal you can pay as a 'guest' on Paypal so there is no need to have or open an account with them.
Simply follow the 'Contribute Now' steps to make your donation, and during the Paypal payment process you will see the amount in your own currency so you know exactly how much you are donating.

If you can't donate, a word of support or encouragement is greatly appreciated.
 
 
 
Thank you so much for your interest in this project and I do hope that, like me, you can see why this is a valuable and important project that deserves to be completed.
 
Thank you,
Ari Tapiero 
 
                                         ***          ***                
 

FAQ For Contributors, as supplied by the kind people at IndieGoGo
How much information do I share when making a contribution? 
You can make an anonymous contribution. Only the person running the campaign and campaign editors can view your name and contribution details. You may need to enter your mailing address if you redeem a perk or for your payment via credit card. 
What happens after I contribute to a campaign?
The person running the campaign will contact you regarding updates to the campaign and how to fulfill your perk. You will also receive a confirmation email. Are contributions final?
Yes. I want to start receiving a campaign's updates before I fund it, how do I do that? 
Go to the campaign, and in the share tool box click on the heart icon. This will add the campaign to your favorites and you will automatically receive updates. Where does the money go if the funding goal isn't reached?
Campaign owners keep all the money they raise, even if their goal isn't reached. Their funding plan is likely outlined on their campaign profile. If you are unclear how funds will be used, you can contact the campaign administrator directly by sending a private comment via the Comments tab on their campaign page. I don't want to contribute to a campaign using PayPal, but it's the only option I am given. Can I still contribute?
Yes. You can pay with your credit card as a Guest on PayPal (no PayPal account required!). After you click "Contribute" on the campaign, you'll be taken to a PayPal screen. At the top, you will see "Choose a Way To Pay." Click on "Pay with a credit or debit card." Uncheck the box that says "Save this information with a PayPal account. It's easy and free to sign up. Learn more about PayPal." Then proceed to pay as Guest with your credit card.

story:
The ADV3NTURE Backpack is high-quality, multi-functional backpack with over 32 features and innovations, like TWO built-in coolers, security pockets for your valuables, our Drop & Go feature, and A LOT more! Whether you're traveling across town or around the world, you will wonder how you lived without your Adv3nture Backpack!

 

The Adv3nture Backpack is made up of the "small pack" and the "BIG PACK" which are amazing on their own. But, together, they truly make the world's best premium backpack.

  • Drop & Go feature; backpack separates into two bags, so you can drop & go and adapt to your travel needs
  • Two security pockets (hidden and secure against your back)
  • Two, triple-insulated coolers to keep food & drinks warm or cold
  • Two water bottle pockets
  • Hard-shell sunglass case
  • Side magnetic pockets
  • Dedicated computer and tablet (iPad) pockets
  • Corrugated AIRFLOW foam to keep your back cool
  • And A LOT more, in the lightest travel backpack you can buy!

The "3" in our name represents the THREE TREES we plant with every purchase, including this Indiegogo campaign. Our tags and packaging is all recyclable. And we use NO ANIMAL PRODUCTS in anything we make.

ADV3NTURE produces premium, high-quality travel gear. We love traveling and exploring and understand that the right hoodie, jacket or backpack can make all the difference. We use meticulously curated manufacturers that are environmentally friendly, and produce at the high standards to which we hold ourselves.

We crowdfund our new products to give our backers the opportunity to pay less, get free shipping in the US (and discounted shipping around the world), and receive their Adv3nture products before anyone else.

If you have any questions, don't hesitate to email us! info@adv3nture.com 

Watch this video with our founder, Zane Lamprey, as he shows you some of the unique features of the Adv3nture Backpack.

The small pack is the perfect day pack. It's perfect as an everyday bag, as well as for day hikes or exploring. It doesn't like being called "small" because (as it points out) it can hold six cans, four sandwiches, four energy bars, a water bottle, sunglasses, wallet, lip balm, car keys, and cell phone at the same time. Sorry little, buddy... I mean, Sorry, buddy.

This pack weighs just over a pound (1.2 lbs to be exact) and has been field-tested by moms, dads, and kids while commuting, golfing, hiking, and going to school. What will YOU use it for?

The BIG PACK has twice the capacity of the small bag. While it has similar features, there are more pockets, a dedicated padded sleeve for your laptop, and a slew of incredibly useful innovations. 

The Two-Pack offers incredible versatility. They can be worn together, or shared with a friend (to share the load), or used separately for different occasions. The bags attach in about 5-seconds (Although the record among the Adv3nture staff is 3.2 seconds. Well done, Erica!).

When combined, the Two-Pack has a 45-Liter capacity, 14 accessible external pockets, and two coolers that can carry a total of 14 cans. The reason we tell our capacity in "cans" is so you have a relatable unit of measurement, because we all know how big a six-pack is. But, there are so many more things you can put in the coolers besides cans. Because the coolers are insulated, you could even (are you ready for this?) put warm items in one cooler and cold items in the other cooler. #mindblown

There are five connections points to attach the small pack with the BIG PACK. 

  •  Locking YKK Zipper - This YKK self-repairing nylon zipper secures the bags together.
  •  Dorsal Clip - Gives additional support to the zipper
  •  Gravity Clips - Located on each side, the gravity clips support most of the load of the bags. They also lock in place, to offer more security.
  •  Ventral Clips - This clip is shared with the cooler. When the the two bags are attached, the clip supports the cooler and offers stability to the attached bags.
  •  Cooler Clips - Three separate clips reinforce the zippered cooler in the big bag.

 

Both packs, including the Two-Pack when they are combined, have 360° Reflectivity. That means that there are reflective features on all sides, including the waterproof zippers!

Here is Justin, our Creative Director, taking a closer look at the backpack in this In-Depth Video!

At Adv3nture, we make innovative products for travel + everyday. While we like to have fun, as you can see by our video, we are serious about making premium, high-quality products with features that you will use and innovations that you wonder how you lived without.

Adv3nture launched with the Adventure Hoodie in 2016, which raised over $1.8M and effectively crowdfunded the Adv3nture brand. Founded by Zane Lamprey and his wife, Mel, in 2015, the company is now made up of a great team of individuals with experience in product design, environmental sustainability, and digital media.

We are passionate about making premium apparel and accessories with innovations to make traveling a better experience. We are equally passionate about the environment, sustainability and green initiatives. We plant three trees with every item purchased from our store, and this Indiegogo campaign. We use no animal products in our gear. We welcome you to join our community and join us at one of our plantings (and the parties that follow)!

Like all of our products, with your pre-order here, we will plant three trees in your honor!

We like to have fun at Adv3nture, but we are serious about doing our part for the environment. For every purchase from our on-line store, and this Indiegogo campaign, we will plant three trees. Since we started, we have planted 88,530 trees.

Zane, our founder, has a profound respect and passion for trees and the environment. Below is a video that illustrates why we've chose trees as our mission.

We work with Green Forests Work, who have planted over 2,492,359 trees with the help of 16,892 volunteers since they started in 2009. Even if you chose not to back this campaign, we would still love for you to join us on one of our plantings around the US. By choosing the $3 option, we will add you to our newsletter and plant three trees in your honor.

story:
Hello friends and family!

I hope you all are doing well! This semester I will be continuing school at the University of Arizona, still studying psychology and Russian Language. This summer I have been able to work at United Christian Youth Camp, which has been one of the best experiences of my life. At camp, I have been making the videos for the kids, which includes filming and editing daily videos that I hope will help the children remember their wonderful camp experience. I'm excited to share another super cool opportunity that I have been given at UCYC.

The Impact

UCYC partners with many different organizations all around the world every year and this year we have been raising money all summer for the Asian Children’s Mission in Myanmar, Asia. We have been raising funds to help facilitate the orphanage they have there, as well as provide food, clothing, simple necessities like a toothbrush and toothpaste, a Christian education, and most importantly mosquito nets to prevent malaria, which is one of the biggest health concerns for children and adults in that region.

I am writing you today because I have been given the opportunity to travel to Myanmar this November to care for the children and help in the orphanage, as well as help set up an aquaponics filtration system that will provide clean drinking water, as well as provide the ability for the Myanmar people to grow and supply their own food and resources.

Your Impact

I am writing you, my friends and family, to first and foremost ask for prayer! Prayer for the country of Myanmar and the people, prayer for the orphans who have lost their families to malaria and the horrible typhoons that have hit southern Asia, prayer for the teams that go to Myanmar and spread the gospel to these amazing children and Myanmar people, and prayer for the opportunity for me to be able to travel to this amazing country and to be the light of God’s love.

The second area of support is financially. The only way I and my team will be able to travel to this great country and help these amazing people is by the financial support from my friends and family! We will be embarking on this trip November 7th through the 16th and to be able to go I need to raise $2,300. The cost includes airfare, food, and transportation around Myanmar. To secure a spot for me to go on this trip I am requested to have all my funds in by October 7th of 2014.

Support

If you feel called to give financially here’s how you can give!

1. You can give right here on indiegogo!

2.You can also give by check to United Christian Youth Camp and in the memo please mention my name and Myanmar Mission Trip.

A video that I have filmed and edited can be viewed on my facebook, or on United Christian Youth Camp's facebook page. Its something that I am very proud of, and I would love if you could view it!

Without the support of my friends and family this trip wouldn’t be possible. My heart is called to helping people in need and I feel this would be a great opportunity to do so! Whether you feel led to help financially, through prayer, or both, all of your support is appreciated!

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this letter and hear about something I’m very passionate about!

God Bless,

Megan Connolly

story:
Who We Are

Portland is known for its majestic surroundings, bearded residents drinking micro-brews . . . and bicycles. Since moving to Northeast Portland last year, we've been working to bring fun, innovative Jewish content to the city of Roses, with distinctly Portlandian twist.

Last year we brought the Pedisukkah to Portland for the holiday of Sukkot. Part Sukkah, part bicycle, the Pedisukkah was an instant success. Visiting various locations around the city, people flocked to us, taking pictures and sharing them with their friends.

 This year we're bringing the Pedisukkah back! Redesigned for use for the entire year and reborn as "The Mitzvah Bike," we expect to serve as a mobile means for building community here in Portland. During the fall it will take to the streets as a Pedisukkah, come Chanukkah, it will be a mobile-menorah. No matter what time of year, we envision a beacon around which members of the Jewish community can convene and connect.

What We Need

Each Mitzvah Bike is built to order and personalized with custom-wraps and specialy modified for each holiday. Though its spirit may be in Portlandia, the Mitzvah Bike is born in Brooklyn, so we'll need to ship it out to the West Coast. (Unfortunately, biking out wouldn't get us back in time for Sukkot!) We'll also be printing promotional material and some awesome swag (some of which you guys can get as perks!) for those who visit the Mitzvah Bike. We'll need to cover all of these costs to make sure the bike is ready to serve Portland's Jewish community for an entire year.

The Impact

Portland has recently experienced a massive population surge -  among them many young, hip, and unaffiliated Jews. It is after all where young people go to retire. 

Located in Northeast Portland, we're looking to engage our friends and neighbors, to teach Jew and non-Jew alike about the message of the Sukkot holiday and the eternal call to grow in our acts of social goodness. The Mitzvah Bikes speak to people and catch everyone by surprise. They help keep Portland meshuga! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Every dollar given to this campaign will help us make our mission a reality, but you can help in other ways too! Please Tweet, Facebook, Email, WhatsApp or send carrier pigeons to your friends and family about the Mitzvah Bike campaign. We very excited to make our dream a reality, and look forward to partnering with you!

story:
Solving a series of security problems caused by losing keys and leaking passwords

We believe that everyone the trouble of losing or forgetting their heavy keysWith the advancement in technology, password locks were created. Although the coded locks would solve some inconvenience, there are still cases where passwords leak. In order to solve all the problems at once, the Anylock Team put in thousands of hours in developing different of possible programs to research & designFinally, the Anylock Team came up with the most advanced fingerprint padlock-the Anylock.

Distinguish from traditional locks and coded lock, instantly unlocks with a touch of your single finger. There is not with finding keys, not with entering the password. Extreme speed to unlock, only can do it.

locks you want to protect.

has super powerful memory storage capability which can store memory of 10 sets fingerprints at the same time. Besides, Anylock's special fingerprint recognition module, can recognize fingerprints from 7 to 70 years old. What's more, Anylock comes with the advanced touch recognition capability, which recognize the fingerprint from , and makes the unlocking process smooth as it can.

Different from other Bluetooth padlock on the market, Anylock is an independent AI intelligent processing system. It integrates with multiple encryption technologies, which means all fingerprints are securely encrypted. refuses to connect with any network outside, and fundamentally eliminates the leakage of your private information.

adapts AI deep learning technology, which can identify the changing process of fingerprints that have been entered. And automatically collect the new of fingerprints, replenish and repair the fingerprint data. Not only do the immature fingerprints, like children' fingerprints, but the fingerprints like the elderly' would not affect the sensitivity and accuracy of fingerprint recognition.

A new upgraded intelligent learning algorithm that enhances recognition speed and effectively prevents false fingerprints, which ensures the accuracy of the falsehood rate and eliminates the potential risks of cloning fingerprints.

not only has intelligent algorithms, but also has a fairly complex and solid structure. It is difficult to unlock it forcibly or illegally, so you don't need to lose your belongings.

 

 

The Anylock R&D team has thousands of hours of research, hundreds of feasibility studies, dozens of program designs, and tens of thousands of security tests. The final 304 high-end steel, and all-zinc shell, with a scientific design and lighting effect, makes from the inside out, exudes a strong and reliable temperament.

is made of all-zinc alloy and cast by stamping process. It is seamlessly docked and can withstand more than 500 kilograms of tension. Even industrial-grade bolt cutters and hydraulic tongs can not cut the strong lock beam of the lock. The lock is with the capacity of anti-saw, anti-smashing, anti-shearing, and anti-smashing. The integrated stamping creates a full zinc alloy casing that seamlessly interfaces to prevent cracking or bedding. 

 

By using USB charging, equipped with a built-in 300mAh battery, 0.5um low power design. Just charge once and use up to 2500 times! The rechargeable battery is able to support 2-year standby time and 1-year normal use. When out of battery, the lock will remain locked. You just connect the lock to a power supply, and it will work again.

IP65 waterproofing ability to effectively prevent dust, rain, and salt spray corrosion. It is treated with multiple PTFE processes and has excellent temperature resistance. In a variety of complex environments from -10° to 45°, can work normally without fear of extreme environmental tests.

The dust cover of Anylock protects the fingerprint chip from external impact, avoiding of the fingerprint lock due to touch or rain wash. This design also greatly reduces the electricity consumption, ensuring up to two years of battery lifetime.

Information Technology Co. Ltd to produce car dashboard cameras since 2009. There are our distributors throughout of China, Anytek has been accepted by the end-users as one of the top brands in . The Hong Kong movie actor, Eric Tsang is our promoter.

 

What

Abandoning burden of traditional keys and insecurity of Bluetooth lock, Anylock is advanced offline fingerprint padlock. Your finger is your key, unlock with your own fingerprints.

How to record the fingerprints?

Please make sure you have read the manual and set-up the video tutorial first before setting up the product to prevent the accidental lock. It can be unlocked by any fingerprint when there’s no fingerprint recorded. During the recording process, please use the same finger to complete the 10 times fingerprint collections with different angles.

What happens if the battery dies while Anylock is locked?

The product can be under emergency situation---It can be unlocked by recorded fingerprint directly when charging.

Is Anylock waterproof?

The is waterproof. We will be applying for certification for IP65. dust proof and can withstand more than 500 kilograms of tension.

How does the Anylock compare with other smart padlocks in the market?

What’s convenient is that family or friends do not need to download the Anylock app to receive the unique PIN codes or carry the heavy keys. All they need is finger itself to unlock. The first innovative fingerprint padlock with dust cover in the market.

What is Anylock use for?

If you are doing small business that has different coming in/out, there is no need for the passing of physical keys to staffs in the event of unforeseen circumstances. is perfect for lockers, pick-up trucks, and Airbnb .

How secure is ?

Only the recorded fingerprint can be unlocked the Anylock. And only the first and second administrators have the function of adding fingerprints and delete fingerprints, and they are not connected to the network to ensure security.

How to charge Anylock?

The product by USB. Please fully charge the product for the first time.

How can we get in touch with the team/Still have questions?

Email us at Anylocksales@outlook.com, we'll be happy to assist with your queries.

Does it come with ?

Yes, the warranty is guaranteed for 1 year. The warranty period commences from the date of purchase or receipt of goods, whichever is later. During the warranty period, Anylock will provide without charge the costs of shipping, and/or replacement parts necessary to repair or replace due to defects or manufacturing faults subject to the terms and conditions.
story_txt:

We believe that everyone  the trouble of losing or forgetting their  heavy keysWith the advancement in technology, password locks were created. Although the coded locks would solve some inconvenience, there are still cases where passwords leak. In order to solve all the problems at once, the Anylock Team put in thousands of hours in developing different of possible programs to research & designFinally, the Anylock Team came up with the most advanced fingerprint padlock-the Anylock.

Distinguish from traditional locks and coded lock,  instantly unlocks with a touch of your single finger. There is not  with finding keys, not  with entering the password. Extreme speed to unlock, only  can do it.

 locks  you want to protect.

 has super powerful memory storage capability which can store memory of 10 sets fingerprints at the same time. Besides, Anylock's special fingerprint recognition module, can recognize fingerprints from 7 to 70 years old. What's more, Anylock comes with the advanced touch recognition capability, which recognize the fingerprint from , and makes the unlocking process smooth as it can.

Different from other Bluetooth padlock on the market, Anylock is an independent AI intelligent processing system. It integrates with multiple  encryption technologies, which means all fingerprints are securely encrypted.  refuses to connect with any network outside, and fundamentally eliminates the leakage of your private information.

 adapts AI deep learning technology, which can identify the changing process of fingerprints that have been entered. And automatically collect the new of fingerprints, replenish and repair the fingerprint data. Not only do the immature fingerprints, like children' fingerprints, but the  fingerprints like the elderly' would not affect the sensitivity and accuracy of fingerprint recognition.

A new upgraded intelligent learning algorithm that enhances recognition speed and effectively prevents false fingerprints, which ensures the accuracy of the falsehood rate and eliminates the potential risks of cloning fingerprints.
 not only has intelligent algorithms, but also has a fairly complex and solid  structure. It is difficult to unlock it forcibly or illegally, so you don't need to lose your belongings.
 

 
The Anylock R&D team has thousands of hours of research, hundreds of feasibility studies, dozens of program designs, and tens of thousands of security tests. The final 304 high-end steel, and all-zinc shell, with a scientific design and lighting effect, makes  from the inside out, exudes a strong and reliable temperament.
 is made of all-zinc alloy and cast by  stamping process. It is seamlessly docked and can withstand more than 500 kilograms of tension. story:
Created By You

Standard Luggage Co. is a Crowfunding-born company. One year ago, we successfully launched a campaign to create the Ultimate Travel Backpack. Thanks to you, thousands of people use our 3-in-1 Travel Backpack every day.

 

 Our Products As Featured In

Why We're Doing it

The Crowdfunding community epitomises how companies should listen to customers, and create new things.  

With feedback from backers, we’ve been able to take our crazy little idea, and transform it into a growing line products to help people travel easier and happier.  

Over the last year, we’ve travelled countless miles, constantly thinking about how we could improve on our original design. 

We’ve spoken and listened to our customers, their needs, and their desires.

 

What The Experts Are Saying

 

 

 

Travel Backpack Demo Video 
& How to Use:

 

New in Version 2.0

We know many people will be seeing our bag for the first time. So we’ll focus on the new features first, and then we'll recap all the previous features.

The biggest thing we heard from customers is that you wanted a way to detach the computer pocket for the plane. The bag is great for fitting in the overhead bin, but way too bulky for under the air plane seat. Solution: We’ve equipped v.2.0 with a computer sliding system that allows you to easily remove your laptop and tablet. 

The next thing you said was the bag needed more comfort. Solution: We’ve overhauled both the backpack and shoulder straps. Now there's more padding on the Backpack straps.  In addition, the shoulder strap was redesigned with more cushioning that will ensure both carry modes are sturdier and hug your shoulders.

The next thing you said was you needed an inconspicuous pocket to stash cash and passports. And we thought to ourselves, wouldn’t it be great if it was completely hidden?

It's worth mentioning there are dozens of other improvements that enhance the quality of the bag. Through customer feedback we quickly realised what needed to be fixed, and incorporated your these changes into v2.0. Improvements such as reinforcing weak points, more rain sealant, redesigning the rain-cover, more pockets and others...

The mission of Standard Luggage Company is to create versatile gear that adapts to any situation. We sought out to design a travel system that would work equally well when riding a motorbike ride through Saigon or breezing in your client’s boardroom. Solution: Design a bag that works in 3 carry modes: a Suitcase, Backpack, and Shoulder Bag.

Hideaway straps make it easy to streamline the look of the bag - for when you need to make great a first impression.

The bag was specifically designed to be the maximum legal carry-on size that conforms to airline rules.  

Padded top and side handles make it easy to remove from an overhead bin or from under a seat. Handy outside pockets provide easy access to boarding passes, books, or other items you may need while travelling on trains or planes.

It’s very easy to pack, and opens up like book. A full perimeter zip open all the way around the top, and allows you to pack this it like a suitcase. The bag has a soft-skeleton shell that allows the bag to maintain its shape while packing.

Inside you’ll find many clever pockets. Notably, there is this sleeve for keeping garments wrinkle free. 


Need to carry all of those extra souvenirs on the way home? The bag can expand. This zip adds an instant 10L capacity!

Sometimes you need to be prepared for contingencies. On the sternum strap you’ll find a safety whistle.    We also included a rain-cover because you never know when it’s going to pour.

In case you are travelling with wheeling luggage, this integrated sleeve makes it easy to attach, and roll on top of any spinning luggage.

The zip pulls comes in two colors, included, to match your individual style, or keep your bag different from your partner. Or you can remove them outright, to make the bag black and stealthy.

If you have any questions about the features, just shoot us a message and we’ll be happy to get you more details.

 

Materials and Warranty  

We're more confident than ever in the quality and materials of v.2.0. Our products are built to last, and the bag will be backed by our Lifetime Warranty. Made from premium 1680 denier fabric that is durable, water-resistant, and easy to clean. The bag is constructed from the with best quality fasteners from brand name manufacturers—YKK and ITW Nexus. 

 

Rewards & Shipping 

To get you our rewards faster and reward early backers, we’ve arranged with our manufacturing partner to deliver in smaller batches. This approach will allow us to deliver rewards faster than many crowdfuding projects. We will do our best to keep you updated via e-mail as we reach key dates:

 

About Standard Luggage Co.

We are a crowd-funding born company. In March 2015 we launched our campaign on Kickstarter to create the Ultimate Travel Backpack.

Standard Luggage Co. strives for design and innovation excellence in providing modern, versatile, and durable gear for the global traveller. Based in Toronto, Canada, we’ve spent restless nights and countless miles on the road. 

Our designs are built on the principle that you can live, work, and move spontaneously. We make products that break the norms. We are modern travellers and digital professionals that sweat the details so you can focus on your worldly goals and the places you want to be.

Follow us on Facebook  

Follow us on Twitter  

Watch us on YouTube  

Follow us on Instagram  

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT, we couldn’t have done it without you!

story:
The wait is OVER. Meet the first DIY wooden drone kits.

For drone lovers who want something more than a ready-to-fly drone, we have come up with the best gift for you: Aerowood, a wooden DIY drone that can be customized according to your preferences and be built completely from scratch.

Rediscover the world with Aerowood! The world is beautifully different from a new angle. 


Don’t underestimate the power of Aerowood by the simplicity of its look. Aerowood is equipped with sophisticated technologies including 720P HD camera, real time transmission, one key return, and stable hovering technologies. 

                       

                                                  

Note: For trademark conflicts, we renamed our product from Airwood to Aerowood.

Also Featured in 

 

The drone kit contains nothing else but 184 pieces of safe and eco-friendly wooden components that are approved by the FSC. The drone is to be assembled like a 3D jigsaw puzzle with wood joinery mortise and tenon joints. You won't need any glues or nails to interlock the parts.  

Upgrade to the 4-in-1 Kit to get a comprehensive DIY experience with Aerowood! The kit offers the four most popular frame settings: NINJIA, TAIJI, SOPHON, and CUBEE. There are many more possibilities in terms of frame settings for you to explore. Each setting comes with a unique flying experience. Keep on exploring! 

The 4-in-1 Aerowood Kit is equipped with one remote control and two sets of batteries, allowing you to switch among 4 frame settings. 

Not only are you able to DIY your own drone but also your own remote. The remote, equally as eco-friendly as the aircraft body, is also made up of renewable and recyclable parts.  If you want to have complete control over your drone, or take your flying experience to the next level,  build your own remote to fly like a pro! 

                                                      
If you are new to drone engineering like many others, the biggest obstacle may be getting your hands on your first drone. But with Aerowood, you don't have to go through a learning curve! Here is the step-by-step instruction:
  1. Take out the parts from the main board
  2. Follow the instructions to assemble the aircraft and remote 
  3. Install a flight control module

  4. (optional) To make your drone unique and colorful, you can even paint on the drone!

Equipped with a 720P HD Camera and real-time transmission, Aerowood synchronizes high-quality images and videos onto your device in seconds. With a slight change in perspective, everything looks so beautifully different from what you see at ground level.

To make your flying experience smarter and easier, Aerowood can automatically return to its home location in one click. Even if Aerowood flies out of its range under Safe Mode, or if the aircraft encounters a signal loss, it is still capable to return to its initial starting point.  

                               

 

Aerowood can hover perfectly in air with no drifting, holding both position and altitude at the exact level you command.

 

You can set height and distance limits to keep your flights within a safe range. If you command your drone to fly beyond your set limits, the drone will cease from going further once it hits the limits. If Aerowood detects no signal, it automatically returns to your initial starting point. You don't have to worry about losing your drone when it is smart enough to find its way home. 

With a minimalist wooden design, we manage to bring down the weight of the aircraft to 79g. Aerowood should be the lightest drone you will ever see.

STEAM is an educational approach to learning that uses Science, Technology, Engineering, the Arts and Mathematics as access points for guiding student inquiry, dialogue, and critical thinking. The end results are students who take thoughtful risks, engage in experiential learning, persist in problem-solving, embrace collaboration, and work through the creative process. These are essential skills of innovators, educators, leaders, and learners!

Not only can you build and fly your own drone, but also can you program your flying experience with Aerowood. If you wish to customize a move for your drone, you can set a new command through simple programming. Aerowood has made complicated programming into simple mechanisms that are even accessible for kids!  

At each stretch goal, we will add one additional frame option or feature module to your Aerowood. The first stretch goal will be unlocked at $50,000, and one of the frame options from above will be added to your drone! Please spread the words for us and share our campaign with your family and friends!

First Stretch Goal update: Optical Flow Positioning Modular

Our first stretch goal will be unlocked when we hit $50k. It allows the Aerowood to hold its position without a pilot’s input. It is a feature that works by having a downward-facing camera “view” the ground surface while sending a continuous flow of optical feedback to the flight controller which then makes flight adjustments to keep the drone in its position. 

Early Shipping

Great news, as we hit the funding goal in 24 hours,  we will start early shipping when we have our first 100 backers with us.  Share our campaign and you will receive your perk sooner!

Targeting on the young generation, we want to make Aerowood the most affordable drone in the market.  Here is our Super early bird price list:

 

                               

 

Kids are more tech-savvy than ever before, but all that screen time may mean less time spent interacting with physical objects, creating, designing, and developing important coordination skills. Many kids are growing up without basic hands-on skills. 

At Aerowood, we want to introduce something that allow kids to create things with their hands, learn to fix and build things, and adopt some hobbies that don’t require an internet connection. From an educational standpoint, hands-on activities have been widely found to be effective and engaging, especially in science and engineering. That's why we decided to create an affordable modular drone that anyone can build and fly. 

As a leading STEAM solution provider, we have helped hundreds of schools and institutions in Asia to teach students about the theories and mechanisms behind building and flying a drone. After finding tremendous success in Asia, we are moving forward to reach out to curious minds all over the world. 

After 18 months of hard work from our design and manufacturing teams, we have finally developed a prototype that is affordable, eco-friendly, fun, and easy to play with. We would like to share the excitement to global customers, here on Indiegogo.

 

As an experienced crowdfunding partner, we work closely with designers, manufacturers, Indiegogo, and worldwide couriers, to make sure we stick with our schedule. Despite the many procedures and challenges involved throughout the campaign, we will do our best to mitigate all risks associated with project planning, production, and shipments. There are also chances that backers of some countries may need to pay for customs duties, according to the country's laws and regulations. Should a problem come up during the process, we will definitely keep you in the loop.

That's why we decided to create an affordable modular drone that anyone can build and fly. As a leading STEAM solution provider, we have helped hundreds of schools and institutions in Asia to teach students about the theories and mechanisms behind building and flying a drone. After finding tremendous success in Asia, we are moving forward to reach out to curious minds all over the world. After 18 months of hard work from our design and manufacturing teams, we have finally developed a prototype that is affordable, eco-friendly, fun, and easy to play with. We would like to share the excitement to global customers, here on Indiegogo. As an experienced crowdfunding partner, we work closely with designers, manufacturers, Indiegogo, and worldwide couriers, to make sure we stick with our schedule. Despite the many procedures and challenges involved throughout the campaign, we will do our best to mitigate all risks associated with project planning, production, and shipments. There are also chances that backers of some countries may need to pay for customs duties, according to the country's laws and regulations. Should a problem come up during the process, we will definitely keep you in the loop.
